		const videoBridgeCountries = ["AE","AG","AL","AM","AR","AT","AU","AZ","BA","BB","BD","BG","BH","BN","BO","BR","BS","BY","CA","CH","CL","CN","CO","CR","CU","CY","CZ","DE","DK","DO","DZ","EC","EE","EG","ES","FI","FR","GB","GE","GF","GG","GH","GP","GR","GT","GU","GY","HK","HN","HR","HU","ID","IE","IL","IM","IN","IQ","IR","IS","IT","JE","JM","JO","JP","KE","KG","KH","KR","KW","KY","KZ","LA","LB","LK","LT","LU","LV","LY","MA","MD","ME","MK","MM","MN","MO","MQ","MT","MU","MV","MX","MY","NG","NI","NL","NO","NP","NZ","OM","PA","PE","PH","PK","PL","PR","PS","PT","PY","QA","RE","RO","RS","RU","SA","SC","SE","SG","SI","SK","SV","TD","TH","TN","TR","TT","TW","UA","US","UY","UZ","VE","VI","VN","ZA","ZW"];
		const tier3VideoBridgeCountries = ["GB","BE","NL","DE","AU","MX","AR","FR","MD","CA","ES","IE","IT","PE","CO","CL","NZ"];
		let hasVideoOnPage = null;

		function getCookieValue(cookieName) {
			const cookieSplit = ('; ' + document.cookie).split('; ' + cookieName + '=');
			return cookieSplit.length === 2 ? cookieSplit.pop().split(';').shift() : null;
		}

		function hasMaxedOutPlayerImpressionsInWiki() {
			const impressionsSoFar = Number(getCookieValue('playerImpressionsInWiki')) || 0;
			const allowedImpressions = Number(videoDetails.impressionsPerSession);

			return impressionsSoFar >= allowedImpressions;
		}

		function getCountryCode() {
			try {
				return JSON.parse(decodeURIComponent(getCookieValue('Geo'))).country.toLowerCase();
			} catch {
				return null;
			}
		}

		function isVideoBridgeAllowedForCountry() {
			const countryCode = getCountryCode();

			if (!countryCode) {
				return false;
			}

			// If it's a default mapping, then check the country whitelist from the default mapping.
			if (videoDetails?.mapping?.isDefaultMapping) {
				// If the wiki is classified as a tier3 wiki, then check the country whitelist from the tier3VideoBridge whitelist.
				const allowedCountriesForTier3Wikis = tier3VideoBridgeCountries.map(function (allowedTier3CountryCode) {
					return allowedTier3CountryCode.toLowerCase();
				})

				return allowedCountriesForTier3Wikis.indexOf(countryCode) !== -1;
			} else {
				// If not a default mapping wiki (so it's a wiki mapping), then check the country whitelist from the videoBridge whitelist
				const allowedCountries = videoBridgeCountries.map(function (allowedCountryCode) {
					return allowedCountryCode.toLowerCase();
				});

				return allowedCountries.indexOf(countryCode) !== -1;
			}
		}

		window.fandomIsVideoPossible = function () {
			if (hasVideoOnPage === null) {
				hasVideoOnPage =
					videoDetails.mapping &&
					isVideoBridgeAllowedForCountry() &&
					!hasMaxedOutPlayerImpressionsInWiki();
			}

			return hasVideoOnPage;
		};

		window.canPlayVideo = function () {
			return window.fandomIsVideoPossible()
		};

		if (!window.canPlayVideo()) {
			document.body.classList.add('no-featured-video');
		} else {
			document.body.classList.add('has-featured-video');
		}
	})();
</script>

<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">"<i>Albus Dumbledore was never proud or vain; he could find something to value in anyone, however apparently insignificant or wretched, and I believe that his early losses endowed him with great humanity and sympathy. I shall miss his friendship more than I can say, but my loss is as nothing compared to the wizarding world's. That he was the most inspiring and the best loved of all Hogwarts headmasters cannot be in question. He died as he lived: working always for the greater good and, to his last hour, as willing to stretch out a hand to a small boy with dragon pox as he was on the day that I met him.</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— Albus Dumbledore's obituary by <a href="/wiki/Elphias_Doge" title="Elphias Doge">Elphias Doge</a><sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<p><b>Professor Albus Percival Wulfric Brian Dumbledore</b>, <span class="template-c"><a href="/wiki/Order_of_Merlin" title="Order of Merlin">O.M. (First Class)</a></span>, <small>Grand Sorc.</small>, <small>D. Wiz.</small>, <small>X.J. (sorc.)</small>, <small>S. of Mag.Q.</small><sup id="cite_ref-HPFW_27-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HPFW-27"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>27<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> (<a href="/wiki/August" title="August">August</a><sup id="cite_ref-birthday_2-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-birthday-2"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>2<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> <a href="/wiki/1881" class="mw-redirect" title="1881">1881</a><sup id="cite_ref-PottermoreFactFile_4-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PottermoreFactFile-4"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>4<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> – <a href="/wiki/30_June" title="30 June">30 June</a> <a href="/wiki/1997" title="1997">1997</a>)<sup id="cite_ref-PottermoreFactFile_4-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PottermoreFactFile-4"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>4<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> was an <a href="/wiki/England" title="England">English</a> <a href="/wiki/Half-blood" title="Half-blood">half-blood</a> <a href="/wiki/Wizardkind" title="Wizardkind">wizard</a>. He was the <a href="/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts" title="Defence Against the Dark Arts">Defence Against the Dark Arts</a> <a href="/wiki/Professor" title="Professor">Professor</a>, later the <a href="/wiki/Transfiguration_(class)" title="Transfiguration (class)">Transfiguration</a> Professor, and later the <a href="/wiki/Headteacher" title="Headteacher">Headmaster</a> of <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry</a>. He also served as <a href="/wiki/Supreme_Mugwump" title="Supreme Mugwump">Supreme Mugwump</a> of the <a href="/wiki/International_Confederation_of_Wizards" title="International Confederation of Wizards">International Confederation of Wizards</a> <span class="template-c">(?–1995)</span> and <a href="/wiki/Chief_Warlock" title="Chief Warlock">Chief Warlock</a> of the <a href="/wiki/Wizengamot" title="Wizengamot">Wizengamot</a> <span class="template-c">(?–1995; 1996–1997)</span>. A <a href="/wiki/Non-magic_people" title="Non-magic people">Muggle</a>-supporting wizard, though the absolute opposite in his earlier years, he was considered to have been the greatest wizard of all time.
</p><p>Albus Dumbledore was the son of <a href="/wiki/Percival_Dumbledore" title="Percival Dumbledore">Percival</a> and <a href="/wiki/Kendra_Dumbledore" title="Kendra Dumbledore">Kendra Dumbledore</a>, and the elder brother of <a href="/wiki/Aberforth_Dumbledore" title="Aberforth Dumbledore">Aberforth</a> and <a href="/wiki/Ariana_Dumbledore" title="Ariana Dumbledore">Ariana</a>. His father died in <a href="/wiki/Azkaban" title="Azkaban">Azkaban</a> when Albus was young, while his mother and sister were later accidentally killed. His early losses greatly affected him early on, even at his <a href="/wiki/Death" title="Death">death</a> many years later, but, in turn, made him a better person.
</p><p>While initially unable to directly act against <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Gellert Grindelwald</a> due to their past <a href="/wiki/Blood_pact" title="Blood pact">blood pact</a>, the <a href="/wiki/British_Ministry_of_Magic" title="British Ministry of Magic">Ministry</a>'s surveillance of him, his love for Grindelwald, and his lingering guilt over his sister's death, Dumbledore sent <a href="/wiki/Newton_Scamander" title="Newton Scamander">Newt Scamander</a> to <a href="/wiki/New_York" title="New York">New York</a> to release the <a href="/wiki/Thunderbird" title="Thunderbird">Thunderbird</a> <a href="/wiki/Frank_(Thunderbird)" title="Frank (Thunderbird)">Frank</a>, and later sent Newt to <a href="/wiki/Paris" title="Paris">Paris</a> to rescue <a href="/wiki/Aurelius_Dumbledore" title="Aurelius Dumbledore">Credence Barebone</a>. After the tragic death of <a href="/wiki/Leta_Lestrange" title="Leta Lestrange">Leta Lestrange</a> in Paris, Dumbledore became determined to contribute helpful advice to the resistance against Grindelwald, notably <a href="/wiki/Newton_Scamander" title="Newton Scamander">Newt</a>, <a href="/wiki/Theseus_Scamander" title="Theseus Scamander">Theseus</a>, <a href="/wiki/Porpentina_Goldstein" title="Porpentina Goldstein">Tina</a>, <a href="/wiki/Jacob_Kowalski" title="Jacob Kowalski">Jacob</a>, <a href="/wiki/Yusuf_Kama" title="Yusuf Kama">Yusuf</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Nagini" title="Nagini">Nagini</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Global_Wizarding_War" title="Global Wizarding War">Global Wizarding War</a>. Initially unbeknownst to Dumbledore, however, Grindelwald intended to use the former's alleged <a href="/wiki/Obscurial" title="Obscurial">Obscurial</a> relative, <a href="/wiki/Aurelius_Dumbledore" title="Aurelius Dumbledore">Aurelius Dumbledore</a>, as a weapon against him.
</p><p>Following the Global Wizarding War, regardless of Aurelius's fate, Dumbledore became most famous for <a href="/wiki/Duel_between_Albus_Dumbledore_and_Gellert_Grindelwald" class="mw-redirect" title="Duel between Albus Dumbledore and Gellert Grindelwald">defeating</a> Grindelwald in what was considered to be the most epic duel of all time. He also gained much more recognition with his involvement in the discovery of the twelve uses of <a href="/wiki/Dragon_blood" title="Dragon blood">dragon's blood</a> and his work on <a href="/wiki/Alchemy" title="Alchemy">alchemy</a> with <a href="/wiki/Nicolas_Flamel" title="Nicolas Flamel">Nicolas Flamel</a>.
</p><p>It was through Dumbledore that resistance to the rise of <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a> was formed. He founded and led the <a href="/wiki/Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Order of the Phoenix">Order of the Phoenix</a> during the <a href="/wiki/First_Wizarding_War" title="First Wizarding War">First Wizarding War</a>. Following <a href="/wiki/Return_of_Lord_Voldemort" title="Return of Lord Voldemort">Voldemort's return</a> and the start of the <a href="/wiki/Second_Wizarding_War" title="Second Wizarding War">Second Wizarding War</a> after the resignation of <a href="/wiki/Cornelius_Fudge" title="Cornelius Fudge">Cornelius Fudge</a>, Dumbledore swiftly formed and led the second Order of the Phoenix. He would also support <a href="/wiki/Jacob%27s_sibling" title="Jacob's sibling">Jacob's sibling</a> in the latter's quest for the <a href="/wiki/Cursed_Vaults" title="Cursed Vaults">Cursed Vaults</a>, and consistently aid <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a>, <a href="/wiki/Ronald_Weasley" title="Ronald Weasley">Ron Weasley</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Hermione_Granger" title="Hermione Granger">Hermione Granger</a> during their first six years at Hogwarts, thus leading them to name <a href="/wiki/Dumbledore%27s_Army" title="Dumbledore's Army">Dumbledore's Army</a> after him.
</p><p>Due to the fact that he had a keen mind and legendary power, Dumbledore became the only wizard that Voldemort ever feared. He was the wielder and the master of the <a href="/wiki/Elder_Wand" title="Elder Wand">Elder Wand</a> from <a href="/wiki/1945" title="1945">1945</a> until 1997, and considered by many as the greatest Hogwarts Headmaster. As he was about to die by a <a href="/wiki/Marvolo_Gaunt%27s_Ring" title="Marvolo Gaunt's Ring">cursed ring</a>, Dumbledore planned his own <a href="/wiki/Death" title="Death">death</a> with <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Severus Snape</a>. Per the plan, Dumbledore was killed by Snape during the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Astronomy_Tower" title="Battle of the Astronomy Tower">Battle of the Astronomy Tower</a>.
</p><p>Though he was no longer alive at the time, it was through Dumbledore's manipulations that Voldemort was ultimately <a href="/wiki/Voldemort%27s_Last_Stand" title="Voldemort's Last Stand">defeated</a>, and lasting peace finally restored to the <a href="/wiki/Wizarding_world" title="Wizarding world">wizarding world</a>. Dumbledore was the only Headmaster who was <a href="/wiki/Funeral_of_Albus_Dumbledore" title="Funeral of Albus Dumbledore">laid to rest</a> at Hogwarts. <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore%27s_portrait" title="Albus Dumbledore's portrait">A portrait</a> of him was later put in place in <a href="/wiki/Headmaster%27s_office" title="Headmaster's office">his office</a> at Hogwarts. Harry Potter later named his second son, <a href="/wiki/Albus_Potter" title="Albus Potter">Albus Severus Potter</a>, after him.
</p>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Biography">Biography</span></h2>
<h3><span id="Early_life_.281881.E2.80.931892.29"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="Early_life_(1881–1892)">Early life <span class="template-c">(1881–1892)</span></span></h3>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">"<i>You know the secret of my sister's ill-health, what those Muggles did, what she became. You know how my poor father sought revenge, and paid the price, died in Azkaban. You know how my mother gave up her own life to care for Ariana.</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— Dumbledore retelling his early years to Harry<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<p>Albus Percival Wulfric Brian Dumbledore was born to <a href="/wiki/Kendra_Dumbledore" title="Kendra Dumbledore">Kendra</a> and <a href="/wiki/Percival_Dumbledore" title="Percival Dumbledore">Percival Dumbledore</a> in the summer<sup id="cite_ref-birthday_2-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-birthday-2"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>2<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> of <a href="/wiki/1881" class="mw-redirect" title="1881">1881</a>, in the mainly wizarding village of <a href="/wiki/Mould-on-the-Wold" title="Mould-on-the-Wold">Mould-on-the-Wold</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-HPLE_5-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HPLE-5"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>5<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> The early years of Dumbledore's life were marked by tragedy when his younger sister, <a href="/wiki/Ariana_Dumbledore" title="Ariana Dumbledore">Ariana Dumbledore</a>, was attacked by a group of <a href="/wiki/Non-magic_people" title="Non-magic people">Muggle</a> <a href="/wiki/Unidentified_Mould-on-the-Wold_boys" title="Unidentified Mould-on-the-Wold boys">boys</a>, who saw her performing <a href="/wiki/Magic" title="Magic">magic</a> and were frightened by what they saw.
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Ariana_Dumbledore" title="Ariana Dumbledore">Ariana</a> was left mentally and emotionally scarred by the event and her magical powers were left severely altered and would manifest themselves on rare occasions usually in random or destructive ways. Albus's father, <a href="/wiki/Percival_Dumbledore" title="Percival Dumbledore">Percival Dumbledore</a>, was heartbroken and set out in search of his own brand of justice. He located the Muggle boys and attacked them, as they had his daughter. For this, Percival was sentenced to <a href="/wiki/Azkaban" title="Azkaban">Azkaban</a> where he later <a href="/wiki/Azkaban_burial_ground" title="Azkaban burial ground">died</a>, choosing the sentence over explaining why he had attacked the boys as it would have meant Ariana being taken away.
</p><p>To escape the accusing eyes of the local community, <a href="/wiki/Kendra_Dumbledore" title="Kendra Dumbledore">Kendra Dumbledore</a> moved her young family to the village of <a href="/wiki/Godric%27s_Hollow" title="Godric's Hollow">Godric's Hollow</a> which, like Mould-on-the-Wold, was a part-wizarding village. Fearing - like her husband - that the ousting of her daughter's inability to control her magical ability would see her confined indefinitely to <a href="/wiki/St_Mungo%27s_Hospital_for_Magical_Maladies_and_Injuries" title="St Mungo's Hospital for Magical Maladies and Injuries">St Mungo's Hospital for Magical Maladies and Injuries</a>, Kendra rebuffed all her neighbours, with the eventual exception of <a href="/wiki/Bathilda_Bagshot" title="Bathilda Bagshot">Bathilda Bagshot</a>, preferring to be left alone: and Albus learned not to mention his  sister or father in public.<sup id="cite_ref-DH_28-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH-28"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>28<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span id="Hogwarts_years_.281892.E2.80.931899.29"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="Hogwarts_years_(1892–1899)">Hogwarts years <span class="template-c">(1892–1899)</span></span></h3>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">"<i>By the end of his first year, he would never again be known as the son of a Muggle-hater, but as nothing more or less than the most brilliant student ever seen at the school.</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— Elphias Doge on Dumbledore's years as a Hogwarts student<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 250px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/11/Hogwarts_Castle_%E2%80%93_HPatPS.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20130514141001" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Hogwarts Castle – HPatPS" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="141" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Hogwarts Castle – HPatPS.jpg" data-image-key="Hogwarts_Castle_%E2%80%93_HPatPS.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/11/Hogwarts_Castle_%E2%80%93_HPatPS.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20130514141001" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/11/Hogwarts_Castle_%E2%80%93_HPatPS.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20130514141001" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Hogwarts Castle – HPatPS" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/11/Hogwarts_Castle_%E2%80%93_HPatPS.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20130514141001" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="141" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Hogwarts Castle – HPatPS.jpg" data-image-key="Hogwarts_Castle_%E2%80%93_HPatPS.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/11/Hogwarts_Castle_%E2%80%93_HPatPS.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20130514141001" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Hogwarts_Castle_%E2%80%93_HPatPS.jpg" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption"><a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry</a></p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Dumbledore began attending <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts</a> in the autumn of <a href="/wiki/1892" class="mw-redirect" title="1892">1892</a> <span class="template-c">(<a href="/wiki/1892%E2%80%931893_school_year" title="1892–1893 school year">1892–1893</a>)</span> and was <a href="/wiki/Sorting_Ceremony" title="Sorting Ceremony">Sorted</a> into <a href="/wiki/Gryffindor" title="Gryffindor">Gryffindor</a> house. Dumbledore's first year was met with much whispering about his <a href="/wiki/Percival_Dumbledore" title="Percival Dumbledore">father</a>'s crime. Many of Albus's fellow students mistakenly believed that, like father like son, Albus too hated <a href="/wiki/Non-magic_people" title="Non-magic people">Muggles</a>. Some praised his father's actions, hoping to gain his trust, but they would not find favour with the young Dumbledore this way. Though later in his young life, under the influence of his love for <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Gellert Grindelwald</a>, some anti-<a href="/wiki/Non-magic_people" title="Non-magic people">Muggle</a> prejudice did develop, but he soon saw the error of his intent.<sup id="cite_ref-DH_28-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH-28"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>28<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He befriended a young <a href="/wiki/Elphias_Doge" title="Elphias Doge">Elphias Doge</a> on his first day at Hogwarts; Doge was suffering from the aftermath of <a href="/wiki/Dragon_Pox" title="Dragon Pox">Dragon Pox</a> at the time (greenish skin and pockmarks), which discouraged most from approaching him. Dumbledore, however, demonstrated his uncommon kindness and willingness to look past the surface and find inner beauty in people.<sup id="cite_ref-DH_28-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH-28"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>28<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>In his third year, Dumbledore presumably took <a href="/wiki/Study_of_Ancient_Runes" title="Study of Ancient Runes">Study of Ancient Runes</a> and at least one other subject, which was known not to be <a href="/wiki/Divination_(class)" title="Divination (class)">Divination</a>. During his fourth year, he accidentally set the bed-curtains in his dormitory on <a href="/wiki/Fire" title="Fire">fire</a>, (although he admitted that he had never liked them anyway). and, being the single most outstanding student in the school at the time, was made both a <a href="/wiki/Prefect" title="Prefect">prefect</a> during his fifth year, and <a href="/wiki/Head_Boy_or_Girl" title="Head Boy or Girl">Head Boy</a> in his <a href="/wiki/Seventh_year" title="Seventh year">seventh</a>. As an exceptionally gifted student of prodigious talents, Albus's aptitude for magical learning was such that he would eventually grow up to become arguably the greatest wizard of his day through largely his own efforts, he was noted to have had access to various highly accomplished teachers in his youth, who each would have played a part in nurturing his magical skills and helping him reach his full potential.<sup id="cite_ref-29" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-29"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>29<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> 
</p><p>Indeed: At some point over the course of his school career, Albus even won the <a href="/wiki/Barnabus_Finkley_Prize_for_Exceptional_Spell-Casting" title="Barnabus Finkley Prize for Exceptional Spell-Casting">Barnabus Finkley Prize for Exceptional Spell-Casting</a>, became the <a href="/wiki/British_Youth_Representative_to_the_Wizengamot" title="British Youth Representative to the Wizengamot">British Youth Representative to the Wizengamot</a>, and received the <a href="/wiki/Gold_Medal_for_Ground-Breaking_Contribution_to_the_International_Alchemical_Conference" title="Gold Medal for Ground-Breaking Contribution to the International Alchemical Conference">Gold Medal for Ground-Breaking Contribution to the International Alchemical Conference</a> in <a href="/wiki/Cairo" title="Cairo">Cairo</a>, and considered by some to have been the most brilliant student to have ever attended the school.<sup id="cite_ref-DH_28-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH-28"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>28<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In addition, Dumbledore also became very well-connected during his Hogwarts years, making notable friends such as <a href="/wiki/Nicolas_Flamel" title="Nicolas Flamel">Nicolas Flamel</a>, <a href="/wiki/Bathilda_Bagshot" title="Bathilda Bagshot">Bathilda Bagshot</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Griselda_Marchbanks" title="Griselda Marchbanks">Griselda Marchbanks</a>, who marked him in his <a href="/wiki/Nastily_Exhausting_Wizarding_Test" title="Nastily Exhausting Wizarding Test">N.E.W.T.s</a> for <a href="/wiki/Charms_(class)" title="Charms (class)">Charms</a> and <a href="/wiki/Transfiguration_(class)" title="Transfiguration (class)">Transfiguration</a> and later recalled that he did things with a wand that she had never seen before. He also had several of his papers published during his studies and exchanged <a href="/wiki/Letters_between_Albus_Dumbledore_and_Adalbert_Waffling" title="Letters between Albus Dumbledore and Adalbert Waffling">letters</a> with theoretician <a href="/wiki/Adalbert_Waffling" title="Adalbert Waffling">Adalbert Waffling</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-DH2_30-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH2-30"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>30<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>During his time at Hogwarts, he had also discovered <i><a href="/wiki/The_Spore_Scrolls" title="The Spore Scrolls">The Spore Scrolls</a></i>, a collection of scrolls hidden by Headmistress <a href="/wiki/Phyllida_Spore" title="Phyllida Spore">Phyllida Spore</a> detailing the creation of the <a href="/wiki/Magical_Enhancer" title="Magical Enhancer">Magical Enhancer</a>, a fungus which could amplify magical abilities. Fearful of how the wizarding would react to such knowledge, he believed it's current hiding place wasn't suitable enough and stole the <a href="/wiki/Spore_Scrolls%27_box" class="mw-redirect" title="Spore Scrolls' box">box</a> containing <i>The Spore Scrolls</i> and hid it in the <a href="/wiki/Forbidden_Forest" title="Forbidden Forest">Forbidden Forest</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-HMTSS_31-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HMTSS-31"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>31<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>

			<p class="caption">Albus (left) with his best friend and lover <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Gellert Grindelwald</a> (right) in <a href="/wiki/1899" class="mw-redirect" title="1899">1899</a></p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>After graduating from <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts</a> in <a href="/wiki/June" title="June">June</a> <a href="/wiki/1899" class="mw-redirect" title="1899">1899</a>, Dumbledore planned to take the traditional <a href="/wiki/Grand_Tour" title="Grand Tour">Grand Tour</a> of the world with his friend <a href="/wiki/Elphias_Doge" title="Elphias Doge">Doge</a>. However, tragedy ensued on the eve of the departure when <a href="/wiki/Kendra_Dumbledore" title="Kendra Dumbledore">Kendra Dumbledore</a> was killed by an <a href="/wiki/Backfiring_Jinx" title="Backfiring Jinx">outburst</a> of <a href="/wiki/Ariana_Dumbledore" title="Ariana Dumbledore">Ariana</a>'s uncontrollable magic, leaving Albus the head of his own broken family and now in charge of his younger siblings. Albus returned to <a href="/wiki/Godric%27s_Hollow" title="Godric's Hollow">Godric's Hollow</a> full of bitter resentment at his situation, feeling trapped and wasted, although he refused to let Aberforth quit school and insisted he complete his education first before taking care of Ariana. For a number of weeks following this, he, at least according to Aberforth, managed to keep Ariana under control and happy. Fortune finally appeared to shine on Dumbledore, however, when a foreigner arrived at their little village, by the name of <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Gellert Grindelwald</a>.
</p>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Fantastic Beasts: The Secrets of Dumbledore">"<i>The summer <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Gellert</a> and I fell in love, my brother fell in love as well, with a <a href="/wiki/Credence_Barebone%27s_mother" class="mw-redirect" title="Credence Barebone's mother">girl</a> from the Hollow. She was sent away, there were rumours about a child. He's a Dumbledore. If I had been a better friend to <a href="/wiki/Aberforth_Dumbledore" title="Aberforth Dumbledore">Aberforth</a>, if I had been a better brother, he might have confided in me. Perhaps things would have been different, this boy could have been part of our lives, part of our family.</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— Albus Dumbledore telling <a href="/wiki/Newton_Scamander" title="Newton Scamander">Newt</a> about <a href="/wiki/Aurelius_Dumbledore" title="Aurelius Dumbledore">his nephew</a>'s rumoured birth.<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Fantastic_Beasts:_The_Secrets_of_Dumbledore" title="Fantastic Beasts: The Secrets of Dumbledore">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<p>In the summer of 1899, Albus was introduced to Gellert by his great-aunt <a href="/wiki/Bathilda_Bagshot" title="Bathilda Bagshot">Bathilda Bagshot</a>. After a day of knowing each other, they quickly struck up a close friendship. The two of them spent days together, sharing ideas and talking, and building their relationship. They learned a lot about each other and even shared the same inspirations and what they wanted to spend their lives doing. One night, Albus sent a <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore%27s_letter_to_Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Albus Dumbledore's letter to Gellert Grindelwald">letter</a> by owl to Gellert in the 'dead of night'.
</p><p>A young man around Albus's age, he lived for the next two months with his great-aunt, the celebrated magical historian and family friend of the Dumbledores, Bathilda Bagshot, who introduced the two soon after Grindelwald crossed her doorstep. Thrilled to realise that the newcomer was every bit as brilliant as himself, the two young men took to each other right away and quickly struck up a close friendship, unified by the revelation of Grindelwald's research into the existence and whereabouts of the fabled <a href="/wiki/Deathly_Hallows" title="Deathly Hallows">Deathly Hallows</a>. Dumbledore also quickly became fascinated by Grindelwald's ideas of wizarding domination, obviously considering Grindelwald an unexpected new chance to show his own brilliance and come out of the local misery. Over the course of the two months Grindelwald stayed in Godric's Hollow, the two young men's friendship became romantic, with Albus ignoring any misgivings he had about Gellert's dark intents by convincing himself the <a href="/wiki/Global_Wizarding_War" title="Global Wizarding War">revolution</a> they were planning to embark on was truly "<a href="/wiki/For_the_Greater_Good" title="For the Greater Good">For the Greater Good</a>", and that any harm caused would be repaid a thousandfold after its conclusion.<sup id="cite_ref-DH_28-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH-28"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>28<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 250px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/4/41/BloodPactAlbusGrindel.gif/revision/latest?cb=20210829094215" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="BloodPactAlbusGrindel" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="104" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="BloodPactAlbusGrindel.gif" data-image-key="BloodPactAlbusGrindel.gif" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/4/41/BloodPactAlbusGrindel.gif/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20210829094215" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/4/41/BloodPactAlbusGrindel.gif/revision/latest?cb=20210829094215" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="BloodPactAlbusGrindel" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/4/41/BloodPactAlbusGrindel.gif/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20210829094215" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="104" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="BloodPactAlbusGrindel.gif" data-image-key="BloodPactAlbusGrindel.gif" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/4/41/BloodPactAlbusGrindel.gif/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20210829094215" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:BloodPactAlbusGrindel.gif" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Albus and Gellert forming their loyalty and love bond</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>One night, Albus and Gellert walked to a <a href="/wiki/Barn_used_by_Albus_Dumbledore_and_Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Barn used by Albus Dumbledore and Gellert Grindelwald">barn</a> in which they went inside with plans to create a <a href="/wiki/Blood_pact_between_Albus_Dumbledore_and_Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Blood pact between Albus Dumbledore and Gellert Grindelwald">blood pact</a> together, forming a love bond that could only be broken if their spells met without intent to attack one another.
</p><p>Sometime between Albus and Gellert's relationship, Aberforth fell in love also, with <a href="/wiki/Credence_Barebone%27s_mother" class="mw-redirect" title="Credence Barebone's mother">a girl</a> from Godric's Hollow, and their relationship led to her becoming pregnant with Aberforth's child. However, the girl was "sent away", presumably by her family, and Aberforth wouldn't see <a href="/wiki/Credence_Barebone" class="mw-redirect" title="Credence Barebone">his son</a> again for over thirty years. Albus was aware of rumours that there was a child from the relationship, but he never knew for sure as the distance between the brothers resulted in Aberforth not confiding in or seeking Albus' help with the situation.<sup id="cite_ref-SODS_32-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-SODS-32"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>32<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Fantastic Beasts: The Secrets of Dumbledore - The Complete Screenplay">"<i>Gellert and I had made plans to go away together. My brother didn't approve, one night he confronted us. Voices were raised, threats made, Aberforth drew his wand, which was foolish, I drew my wand, which was even more foolish. Gellert just laughed. No-one heard Ariana coming down the stairs. Can't say for certain it was my...spell. Doesn't really matter. One minute she was there, and the next, she was gone.</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— Albus Dumbledore recalling the duel to Newt<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Fantastic_Beasts:_The_Secrets_of_Dumbledore_-_The_Complete_Screenplay" title="Fantastic Beasts: The Secrets of Dumbledore - The Complete Screenplay">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<p>Near the end of the summer, after Albus and Gellert both completely knew and agreed upon everything, with their blood pact in hand, they had plans to start a <a href="/wiki/Global_Wizarding_War" title="Global Wizarding War">Global Wizarding War</a>, and to force Muggles into subservience, with full intent on becoming the great leaders of the revolution. Aberforth knew he had to stay behind, for his sister <a href="/wiki/Ariana_Dumbledore" title="Ariana Dumbledore">Ariana</a>. With his brother about to leave, Aberforth had to stop him and young Grindelwald from leaving him and their sister. He confronted them one night and was told that he was a stupid little boy by Gellert for doing so. After Aberforth and Gellert yelled and made countless threats, Aberforth drew his wand, but was <a href="/wiki/Cruciatus_Curse" title="Cruciatus Curse">tortured</a> by Gellert, though he laughed. Albus realised then how horrible a person Grindelwald truly was and stepped in to defend his younger brother, and a three-way duel broke out between <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Gellert Grindelwald</a>, Albus Dumbledore, and <a href="/wiki/Aberforth_Dumbledore" title="Aberforth Dumbledore">Aberforth Dumbledore</a>. <a href="/wiki/Ariana_Dumbledore" title="Ariana Dumbledore">Ariana Dumbledore</a> ran down the stairs to see what was happening and to try to help the ruckus, but did not know what she was doing and was inadvertently killed by one of the teenagers' stray spells. Gellert retreated quickly to his great-aunt's <a href="/wiki/Bathilda_Bagshot%27s_House" title="Bathilda Bagshot's House">cottage</a>, where he had her make him a <a href="/wiki/Portkey" title="Portkey">Portkey</a> to take him back home. Albus and Aberforth both rushed towards their sister's body, and cried in regret and pity.
</p><p>Soon after, they held a <a href="/wiki/Funeral_of_Ariana_Dumbledore" title="Funeral of Ariana Dumbledore">funeral</a> for Ariana, at which Aberforth broke Albus's nose out of pure anger and sadness at what he had done.
</p>
<h3><span id="Early_career_at_Hogwarts_.281900s.E2.80.931925.29"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="Early_career_at_Hogwarts_(1900s–1925)">Early career at Hogwarts <span class="template-c">(1900s–1925)</span></span></h3>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows"><b>Dumbledore</b>: "<i>I had proven, as a very young man, that power was my weakness and temptation. I was safer at Hogwarts. I think I was a good teacher.</i>"</span></dd>
<dd><b>Harry Potter</b>: "<i>You were the best.</i>"</dd>
<dd>— A discussion in <a href="/wiki/Limbo" title="Limbo">limbo</a> regarding power and leadership<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">[src]</a></sup></dd></dl>
</div>
<p>Shortly thereafter, Albus, who had been exchanging owls with the famous researcher as far back when he had been a student at Hogwarts, travelled to <a href="/wiki/France" title="France">France</a> and spent some time in <a href="/wiki/Paris" title="Paris">Paris</a> studying the ancient art and science of <a href="/wiki/Alchemy" title="Alchemy">alchemy</a> under the tutelage of <a href="/wiki/Nicolas_Flamel" title="Nicolas Flamel">Nicholas Flamel</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-HM_Beauxbatons_33-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM_Beauxbatons-33"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>33<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> where, according to Flamel, he would 'go on and on about the uses of dragon's blood and the like', and had a high opinion of himself.<sup id="cite_ref-HM3TA_34-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM3TA-34"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>34<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He presumably did so in order to both give his brother some space, as well as to get away for a bit and spend his time grieving more productively than he otherwise would have done simply wallowing in his own misery. It is unknown when exactly he returned to <a href="/wiki/Great_Britain" title="Great Britain">Britain</a>, but after he did so, he continued with the study of <a href="/wiki/Dragon_blood" title="Dragon blood">dragon's blood</a> and was ultimately credited with the discovery of no less than twelve new uses for it<sup id="cite_ref-PS6_35-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PS6-35"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>35<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> (even though a wizard by the name of <a href="/wiki/Ivor_Dillonsby" title="Ivor Dillonsby">Ivor Dillonsby</a> would later claim that he had already discovered eight of them when Dumbledore "borrowed" his notes);<sup id="cite_ref-DH2_30-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH2-30"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>30<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> an accomplishment that earned him widespread recognition and ultimately played no small role in the subsequent offer he received of a teaching position at <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-36" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-36"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>36<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Having always had a deep fondness for the old school and felt drawn towards teaching even as a student,<sup id="cite_ref-DH2_30-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH2-30"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>30<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Albus was happy to accept. At some point after this, he had the unfortunate experience of tasting a vomit-flavoured <a href="/wiki/Bertie_Bott%27s_Every_Flavour_Beans" title="Bertie Bott's Every Flavour Beans">Bertie Bott's Every Flavour Bean</a>, as a result of which he lost his liking for the sweets.<sup id="cite_ref-PS_8-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PS-8"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>8<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-right show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 250px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/15/Dumbledore_teaching_DADA.gif/revision/latest?cb=20190325024211" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Dumbledore teaching DADA" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="104" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Dumbledore teaching DADA.gif" data-image-key="Dumbledore_teaching_DADA.gif" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/15/Dumbledore_teaching_DADA.gif/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20190325024211" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/15/Dumbledore_teaching_DADA.gif/revision/latest?cb=20190325024211" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Dumbledore teaching DADA" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/15/Dumbledore_teaching_DADA.gif/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20190325024211" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="104" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Dumbledore teaching DADA.gif" data-image-key="Dumbledore_teaching_DADA.gif" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/15/Dumbledore_teaching_DADA.gif/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20190325024211" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Dumbledore_teaching_DADA.gif" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Dumbledore teaching <a href="/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts" title="Defence Against the Dark Arts">Defence Against the Dark Arts</a></p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>And so it was that Albus Dumbledore returned to Hogwarts Castle, not to learn this time, but to teach. Burdened by the secret knowledge of Grindelwald's imminent <a href="/wiki/Global_Wizarding_War" title="Global Wizarding War">rise to power</a> and wanting to rectify past mistakes, it was natural, perhaps, that he felt drawn towards the job of <a href="/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts" title="Defence Against the Dark Arts">Defence Against the Dark Arts</a> instructor, a position in which he could most easily prepare his charges for the dangers he knew one day would come.<sup id="cite_ref-COG_37-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COG-37"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>37<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Albus, who would henceforth come to be known to successive generations of students as 'Professor Dumbledore', was granted <a href="/wiki/Classroom_3C" title="Classroom 3C">Classroom 3C</a> on the third-floor and an office.<sup id="cite_ref-38" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-38"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>38<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Around the same time, the bookish young educator also procured and read a copy of <i><a href="/wiki/The_Predictions_of_Tycho_Dodonus" title="The Predictions of Tycho Dodonus">The Predictions of Tycho Dodonus</a></i>.<sup id="cite_ref-39" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-39"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>39<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>At some point early on in his teaching career, Albus became aware of the existence of an ancient magical artefact of unknown origin within the school; a looking-glass with a grim history that was far more revealing than most.<sup id="cite_ref-PS12_40-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PS12-40"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>40<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Having once been kept out in the open where hundreds of people could discover the apparent delights of the <a href="/wiki/Mirror_of_Erised" title="Mirror of Erised">Mirror of Erised</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-PS12_40-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PS12-40"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>40<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> it had since been given a new home after a large number of them had become so entranced by what they had seen as to waste away before it. Some had reportedly even gone <a href="/wiki/Insanity" title="Insanity">mad</a>; not knowing if what it showed them was real or even possible.<sup id="cite_ref-PS12_40-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PS12-40"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>40<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He eventually found it, however, safely tucked away in a <a href="/wiki/Room_of_Requirement" title="Room of Requirement">hidden room</a> on the uppermost floor of the castle that would only reveal itself to someone if they were in great need of it.<sup id="cite_ref-OOTP18_41-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OOTP18-41"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>41<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> The device, however, which upon closer examination turned out to have been bewitched with the tantalising power of showing those who stared into its surface a <a href="/wiki/Vision" title="Vision">vision</a> of their heart's deepest desire,<sup id="cite_ref-PS12_40-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PS12-40"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>40<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> proved interesting rather than useful.<sup id="cite_ref-Erised_42-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Erised-42"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>42<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Intrigued by the mirror as a fascinating piece of magical ingenuity, Albus was nevertheless painfully aware that his <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">greatest yearning</a> at the time was for something impossible, and that clinging on to a wish that could never – and for <a href="/wiki/For_the_Greater_Good" title="For the Greater Good">obvious reasons</a> ought never – to be fulfilled could only hurt him, Dumbledore eventually decided to leave the mirror where it was, covered by a curtain of black velvet. It would take many years before he went to visit it again.<sup id="cite_ref-COG_37-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COG-37"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>37<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Even though the freshly hired instructor would henceforth largely busy himself with the training of young witches and wizards, Albus would continue to keep in touch with Nicolas Flamel, alongside whom he would eventually achieve a number of advancements in the field of alchemy over the years as their relationship blossomed from that of student-and-mentor, to that of an equal partnership and near life-long friendship.<sup id="cite_ref-PS_8-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PS-8"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>8<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> At some point after this, Albus would visit his old friend and pose for a photograph in Flamel's <a href="/wiki/Flamel_House" title="Flamel House">workshop</a> alongside his celebrated mentor, with many of his alchemical tools and equipment being visible in the background, as well as <a href="/wiki/Nicolas_Flamel%27s_crystal_ball" title="Nicolas Flamel's crystal ball">crystal ball</a> and a <a href="/wiki/Nicolas_Flamel%27s_phoenix-embossed_book" class="mw-redirect" title="Nicolas Flamel's phoenix-embossed book">book with a phoenix on the cover</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-HM_Beauxbatons_33-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM_Beauxbatons-33"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>33<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 250px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/2/26/NewtRiddikulus.gif/revision/latest?cb=20190224141731" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="NewtRiddikulus" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="104" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="NewtRiddikulus.gif" data-image-key="NewtRiddikulus.gif" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/2/26/NewtRiddikulus.gif/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20190224141731" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/2/26/NewtRiddikulus.gif/revision/latest?cb=20190224141731" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="NewtRiddikulus" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/2/26/NewtRiddikulus.gif/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20190224141731" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="104" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="NewtRiddikulus.gif" data-image-key="NewtRiddikulus.gif" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/2/26/NewtRiddikulus.gif/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20190224141731" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:NewtRiddikulus.gif" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Dumbledore teaching <a href="/wiki/Newton_Scamander" title="Newton Scamander">Newt Scamander</a>, <a href="/wiki/Leta_Lestrange" title="Leta Lestrange">Leta Lestrange</a> and other students the <a href="/wiki/Boggart-Banishing_Spell" title="Boggart-Banishing Spell">Boggart-Banishing Spell</a></p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>In the <a href="/wiki/1910s" title="1910s">1910s</a>, Dumbledore taught <a href="/wiki/Hufflepuff" title="Hufflepuff">Hufflepuff</a> <a href="/wiki/Newton_Scamander" title="Newton Scamander">Newton Scamander</a> and <a href="/wiki/Slytherin" title="Slytherin">Slytherin</a> <a href="/wiki/Leta_Lestrange" title="Leta Lestrange">Leta Lestrange</a>. One of his lessons involved confronting a <a href="/wiki/Boggart" title="Boggart">Boggart</a> and learning the <a href="/wiki/Boggart-Banishing_Spell" title="Boggart-Banishing Spell">spell</a> to banish it. When Newt's Boggart turned into a desk, Dumbledore commented on its unexpected nature and kindly inquired why it took this form: Newt confessed that his greatest fear was being stuck working in an office. After Newt successfully dispatched the Boggart, Dumbledore encouraged Leta to take her turn, reassuring her that being afraid of something wasn't shameful; everyone was afraid of something. The form of Leta's Boggart surprised both Dumbledore and the entire class: a white sheet containing an undistinguishable, slight <a href="/wiki/Corvus_Lestrange_(V)" title="Corvus Lestrange (V)">form</a> floating through a dark blue glow. The event badly shook Leta.<sup id="cite_ref-COG_37-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COG-37"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>37<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>In <a href="/wiki/1913" title="1913">1913</a>, one of Leta's experiments with a <a href="/wiki/Jarvey" title="Jarvey">Jarvey</a> went too far endangering the life of another student. Newt decided to take the blame and was sentenced to expulsion. Dumbledore, however, argued strongly on his behalf. Whether Newt's expulsion was enforced or not is unknown, but Dumbledore succeeded in at least allowing Newt to keep his wand.<sup id="cite_ref-FBS_43-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FBS-43"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>43<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>During his time at Hogwarts, Dumbledore also developed close relationships and friendships with wizards and witches throughout the world. Among these friends, he counted the French <a href="/wiki/Alchemy" title="Alchemy">alchemist</a> <a href="/wiki/Nicolas_Flamel" title="Nicolas Flamel">Nicolas Flamel</a> and <a href="/wiki/Ilvermorny_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Ilvermorny School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Ilvermorny</a> <a href="/wiki/Charm" title="Charm">Charms</a> Professor <a href="/wiki/Eulalie_Hicks" title="Eulalie Hicks">Eulalie Hicks</a>. He maintained close contact with these friends in the form of <a href="/wiki/Nicolas_Flamel%27s_phoenix-embossed_book" class="mw-redirect" title="Nicolas Flamel's phoenix-embossed book">enchanted books</a> they all possessed which allowed them to speak despite the distance. The <a href="/wiki/British_Ministry_of_Magic" title="British Ministry of Magic">British Ministry of Magic</a>, which was already suspicious of Dumbledore because of his past connection to Grindelwald, was wary of these relationships, believing that he used these contacts as spies to allow him to act as an independent authority to theirs, and maintained a close watch on Dumbledore and his allies. Chief among Dumbledore's rivals within the Ministry was <a href="/wiki/Torquil_Travers" title="Torquil Travers">Torquil Travers</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Department_of_Magical_Law_Enforcement" title="Department of Magical Law Enforcement">Head of the Department of Magical Law Enforcement</a>, who never tried to hide his dislike for the Hogwarts teacher.<sup id="cite_ref-COG_37-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COG-37"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>37<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span id="Global_Wizarding_War_.281926.E2.80.931945.29"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="Global_Wizarding_War_(1926–1945)">Global Wizarding War <span class="template-c">(1926–1945)</span></span></h3>
<p>Throughout the early days of the <a href="/wiki/Global_Wizarding_War" title="Global Wizarding War">Global Wizarding War</a>, a series of <a href="/wiki/Grindelwald_Attacks" title="Grindelwald Attacks">devastating attacks</a> was perpetrated by <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Gellert Grindelwald</a> and his <a href="/wiki/Alliance" title="Alliance">cadre of followers</a> across <a href="/wiki/Europe" title="Europe">Europe</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-FBS2_44-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FBS2-44"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>44<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> and rumours begun circulating that his former friend had procured a wand of immense power, which Albus, who was privy to the aspiring revolutionary's <a href="/wiki/Hallows_Quest" title="Hallows Quest">Quest</a> for the <a href="/wiki/Deathly_Hallows" title="Deathly Hallows">Deathly Hallows</a>, understood to mean that he had successfully obtained the <a href="/wiki/Elder_Wand" title="Elder Wand">Elder Wand</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-DH352_45-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH352-45"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>45<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Sometime afterwards, word reached Albus through his extensive contacts that Grindelwald had had another <a href="/wiki/Vision" title="Vision">vision</a>: He had seen a powerful <a href="/wiki/Obscurus" title="Obscurus">Obscurus</a> kill the man he feared above all else;<sup id="cite_ref-46" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-46"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>46<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> and even though the <a href="/wiki/Blood_pact" title="Blood pact">pact</a> they had made all those years ago not to fight one another had ultimately worked in Grindelwald's favour by effectively preventing Albus from coming after him, it was clear that he still harboured fears that Dumbledore might still find a way to overcome it and move against him. Only too aware that he was quite possibly the only wizard alive capable of bringing a definitive end to Grindelwald's reign of terror, however, Dumbledore continued to monitor and to try to anticipate Grindelwald's activities in the hopes of intercepting the attempted recruitment of the Obscurus.
</p><p>It was only years later, around <a href="/wiki/December" title="December">December</a> of <a href="/wiki/1926" title="1926">1926</a> that Dumbledore's patient monitoring of Grindelwald's movements through second-hand accounts paid off; when he heard about the series of magical disturbances that were causing severe devastation throughout the city of <a href="/wiki/New_York" title="New York">New York</a> that risked the exposure of the wizarding world. Having correctly guessed that the mysterious attacks to be the work of a powerful <a href="/wiki/Obscurial" title="Obscurial">Obscurial</a> and, forever mindful of the fact that if he could figure out where the prophesied entity was located, so could Grindelwald. Hence, Albus decided to arrange for his plans to be thwarted.<sup id="cite_ref-COG_37-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COG-37"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>37<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> To this end, he contacted his old student, Newt Scamander, who had become a <a href="/wiki/Magizoologist" title="Magizoologist">Magizoologist</a> in the employment of the <a href="/wiki/Department_for_the_Regulation_and_Control_of_Magical_Creatures" title="Department for the Regulation and Control of Magical Creatures">Department for the Regulation and Control of Magical Creatures</a> at the <a href="/wiki/British_Ministry_of_Magic" title="British Ministry of Magic">Ministry of Magic</a> in London and had been travelling throughout the world, locating and rescuing magical creatures from his fellow wizards; whether it was because they were greedy <a href="/wiki/Wizard_poacher" title="Wizard poacher">poachers</a> seeking to profit off of them, or otherwise targeted them for the perceived threat they posed to the <a href="/wiki/International_Statute_of_Wizarding_Secrecy" title="International Statute of Wizarding Secrecy">Statute of Secrecy</a>.
</p><p>Dumbledore told Newt of <a href="/wiki/Frank_(Thunderbird)" title="Frank (Thunderbird)">a Thunderbird</a> that was being held captive in <a href="/wiki/Egypt" title="Egypt">Egypt</a>, knowing he would not stand for such an injustice and would not only rescue him but also return him to his native <a href="/wiki/Arizona" title="Arizona">Arizona</a>. To accomplish this, Newt would have to pass through the Muggle customs in <a href="/wiki/New_York" title="New York">New York</a>; where his visit would co-concur with both the Obscurial attacks and Grindelwald's scheme to locate, identify and ally himself with the culprit. Trusting Newt to do the right thing and protect the Obscurial from Grindelwald, it turned out that his confidence in Newt's character and ability was well placed: Newt's involvement resulted not only in the discovery of <a href="/wiki/Aurelius_Dumbledore" title="Aurelius Dumbledore">Credence Barebone</a>, the most powerful <a href="/wiki/Obscurus" title="Obscurus">Obscurus</a> ever recorded (the only one to survive into adulthood), but also in the capture of Grindelwald, who had been disguised as a high-ranking official at <a href="/wiki/Magical_Congress_of_the_United_States_of_America" title="Magical Congress of the United States of America">MACUSA</a> by the name of <a href="/wiki/Percival_Graves" title="Percival Graves">Percival Graves</a> to find the Obscurus. While there, however, Newt got in <a href="/wiki/Newton_Scamander%27s_Grade_One_Infraction_of_the_International_Statute_of_Wizarding_Secrecy" title="Newton Scamander's Grade One Infraction of the International Statute of Wizarding Secrecy">trouble</a> when a number of the magical creatures his case escaped and ran loose in areas of the city inhabited mainly by <a href="/wiki/Non-magic_people" title="Non-magic people">Non-magical people</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-FBS_43-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FBS-43"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>43<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-COG_37-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COG-37"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>37<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-right show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 150px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/0/03/TransfigurationToday.png/revision/latest?cb=20161205200722" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="TransfigurationToday" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="150" height="222" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="TransfigurationToday.png" data-image-key="TransfigurationToday.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/0/03/TransfigurationToday.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/150?cb=20161205200722" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/0/03/TransfigurationToday.png/revision/latest?cb=20161205200722" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="TransfigurationToday" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/0/03/TransfigurationToday.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/150?cb=20161205200722" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="150" height="222" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="TransfigurationToday.png" data-image-key="TransfigurationToday.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/0/03/TransfigurationToday.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/150?cb=20161205200722" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:TransfigurationToday.png" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Dumbledore mentioned in the <i><a href="/wiki/Transfiguration_Today" title="Transfiguration Today">Transfiguration Today</a></i> periodical</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>For his role in the incident in New York, as well as his reluctance and evasiveness in providing his superiors at the Ministry details about why he had been in New York in the first place, Newt was banned from travelling internationally by the Ministry, a ban they offered to lift if he confessed that Dumbledore had been the one to send him to New York. Although he realised that Dumbledore had covertly sent him to New York, Newt remained loyal to his old teacher and refused to confess his role in the affair.<sup id="cite_ref-COG_37-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COG-37"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>37<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Even in later years, when the rumours were published by <a href="/wiki/Rita_Skeeter" title="Rita Skeeter">Rita Skeeter</a> in a biography of Newt called <i><a href="/wiki/Man_or_Monster%3F_The_TRUTH_about_Newt_Scamander" title="Man or Monster? The TRUTH about Newt Scamander">Man or Monster? The TRUTH about Newt Scamander</a></i>, he continued to deny that Dumbledore was responsible for his trip to New York in the foreword of a new edition of <i><a href="/wiki/Fantastic_Beasts_and_Where_to_Find_Them" title="Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them">Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them</a></i>.
</p><p>In the same year Dumbledore became a regular columnist for <i><a href="/wiki/Transfiguration_Today" title="Transfiguration Today">Transfiguration Today</a></i>, with the <i><a href="/wiki/Daily_Prophet" title="Daily Prophet">Daily Prophet</a></i> quoting him as saying he was "enraptured!" to be writing for the magazine.<sup id="cite_ref-FBF-prophet_23-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FBF-prophet-23"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>23<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Moving_against_Gellert_Grindelwald">Moving against Gellert Grindelwald</span></h4>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 250px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/9/99/Dumbledore_Newt_in_Trafalgar_Square.gif/revision/latest?cb=20210804064056" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Dumbledore Newt in Trafalgar Square" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="104" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Dumbledore Newt in Trafalgar Square.gif" data-image-key="Dumbledore_Newt_in_Trafalgar_Square.gif" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/9/99/Dumbledore_Newt_in_Trafalgar_Square.gif/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20210804064056" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/9/99/Dumbledore_Newt_in_Trafalgar_Square.gif/revision/latest?cb=20210804064056" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Dumbledore Newt in Trafalgar Square" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/9/99/Dumbledore_Newt_in_Trafalgar_Square.gif/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20210804064056" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="104" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Dumbledore Newt in Trafalgar Square.gif" data-image-key="Dumbledore_Newt_in_Trafalgar_Square.gif" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/9/99/Dumbledore_Newt_in_Trafalgar_Square.gif/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20210804064056" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Dumbledore_Newt_in_Trafalgar_Square.gif" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Albus walking with Newt in <a href="/wiki/Trafalgar_Square" title="Trafalgar Square">Trafalgar Square</a></p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>In <a href="/wiki/1927" title="1927">1927</a>, when Grindelwald had escaped, Dumbledore, knowing that he would not be able to fight him due to their <a href="/wiki/Blood_pact" title="Blood pact">blood pact</a>, met with Newt in <a href="/wiki/London" title="London">London</a> to ask him for help. He sent his former student to <a href="/wiki/Paris" title="Paris">Paris</a> to find <a href="/wiki/Aurelius_Dumbledore" title="Aurelius Dumbledore">Credence Barebone</a>, who had survived his supposed destruction in New York.<sup id="cite_ref-COG_37-7" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COG-37"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>37<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Albus told Newt <a href="/wiki/Corvus_Lestrange_(V)" title="Corvus Lestrange (V)">who</a> it was thought that Credence's true identity was. He then gave Scamander a <a href="/wiki/Nicolas_Flamel%27s_card" title="Nicolas Flamel's card">card</a> which directed straight to a '<a href="/wiki/Flamel_House" title="Flamel House">safe house</a>' in Paris, where he could go if he needed to hide for a time.<sup id="cite_ref-COG_37-8" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COG-37"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>37<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 250px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/ac/Travers_Admonitors.gif/revision/latest?cb=20190325025112" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Travers Admonitors" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="104" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Travers Admonitors.gif" data-image-key="Travers_Admonitors.gif" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/ac/Travers_Admonitors.gif/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20190325025112" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/ac/Travers_Admonitors.gif/revision/latest?cb=20190325025112" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Travers Admonitors" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/ac/Travers_Admonitors.gif/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20190325025112" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="104" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Travers Admonitors.gif" data-image-key="Travers_Admonitors.gif" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/ac/Travers_Admonitors.gif/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20190325025112" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Travers_Admonitors.gif" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Travers putting Dumbledore into Admonitors during interrogation</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>The rumours of Newt's potential travel to <a href="/wiki/France" title="France">France</a> reached the British Ministry of Magic, and a delegation of <a href="/wiki/Auror" title="Auror">Aurors</a>, including Newt's brother <a href="/wiki/Theseus_Scamander" title="Theseus Scamander">Theseus Scamander</a> and <a href="/wiki/Torquil_Travers" title="Torquil Travers">Torquil Travers</a>, was sent to Hogwarts Castle to question Dumbledore. Travers demanded that Dumbledore fight Grindelwald for him, but Albus refused, which angered Travers to the point that he cuffed Dumbledore into <a href="/wiki/Admonitor" title="Admonitor">Admonitors</a> and forbade him from ever teaching Defence Against the Dark Arts again. Dumbledore turned to Theseus, who was last in leaving the classroom, and warned him that if he'd ever trusted him, he should not let Travers send him to <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald%27s_Paris_rally" title="Gellert Grindelwald's Paris rally">Grindelwald's rally</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-COG_37-9" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COG-37"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>37<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>

<p>Moments later, in one of the classrooms, he met Leta Lestrange, who was also in the delegation, but had separated herself from the group of Aurors. Leta accused Albus of being the only one who did not consider her bad in her youth and stated that he was wrong about this. Dumbledore mentioned that rumours about her brother Corvus Lestrange, who was now believed to be Credence Barebone, must have been painful for her, which angered the witch, who interrupted his statement and added that he could not understand her, because he did not lose his brother. Dumbledore only replied that years ago he lost his sister, <a href="/wiki/Ariana_Dumbledore" title="Ariana Dumbledore">Ariana</a>. Ending the conversation, Albus advised her to get rid of regret because it was his inseparable companion since the death of his sister.<sup id="cite_ref-COG_37-10" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COG-37"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>37<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>

<p>One night, Dumbledore went to the <a href="/wiki/Room_of_Requirement" title="Room of Requirement">Room of Requirement</a>, where the <a href="/wiki/Mirror_of_Erised" title="Mirror of Erised">Mirror of Erised</a> was stored. At first, to his joy, he saw an old memory he still valued of himself and Grindelwald from the time when their friendship was at its peak that led to them sealing their bond with a blood pact in a barn, swearing to never fight each other. Dumbledore also saw Grindelwald himself from the present. Albus was longing for this meeting, while at the same time being very afraid of it, because he knew that he was the only person who could stop Grindelwald, and he could face the truth about who Ariana's killer was.<sup id="cite_ref-COG_37-11" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COG-37"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>37<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 250px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/e/e9/Newt_and_Dumbledore_talking_at_Hogwarts.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20190324230849" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Newt and Dumbledore talking at Hogwarts" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="104" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Newt and Dumbledore talking at Hogwarts.jpg" data-image-key="Newt_and_Dumbledore_talking_at_Hogwarts.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/e/e9/Newt_and_Dumbledore_talking_at_Hogwarts.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20190324230849" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/e/e9/Newt_and_Dumbledore_talking_at_Hogwarts.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20190324230849" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Newt and Dumbledore talking at Hogwarts" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/e/e9/Newt_and_Dumbledore_talking_at_Hogwarts.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20190324230849" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="104" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Newt and Dumbledore talking at Hogwarts.jpg" data-image-key="Newt_and_Dumbledore_talking_at_Hogwarts.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/e/e9/Newt_and_Dumbledore_talking_at_Hogwarts.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20190324230849" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Newt_and_Dumbledore_talking_at_Hogwarts.jpg" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Newt giving Dumbledore the blood pact pendant at Hogwarts</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>After the <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald%27s_Paris_rally" title="Gellert Grindelwald's Paris rally">battle of the</a> <a href="/wiki/Lestrange_Mausoleum" title="Lestrange Mausoleum">Lestrange family Mausoleum</a>, Dumbledore was waiting for Newt at Hogwarts. Albus expressed his sadness over Leta's death at Grindelwald's hands. Then, the magizoologist gave him an object stolen by <a href="/wiki/Teddy_(Niffler)" title="Teddy (Niffler)">Teddy</a>. It was the <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald%27s_pendant" title="Gellert Grindelwald's pendant">pendant</a> of his former teacher's blood pact with Grindelwald, leaving Albus to ponder if he could destroy it, which would allow him to finally participate in the war and defeat the Dark wizard once and for all. Dumbledore asked <a href="/wiki/Newton_Scamander" title="Newton Scamander">Newt</a> if his <a href="/wiki/Teddy_(Niffler)" title="Teddy (Niffler)">Niffler Teddy</a> would like a cup of tea and they went off to talk about what must be done.<sup id="cite_ref-COG_37-12" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COG-37"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>37<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span id="Reunion_with_Grindelwald_.281927.E2.80.931932.29"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="Reunion_with_Grindelwald_(1927–1932)">Reunion with Grindelwald <span class="template-c">(1927–1932)</span></span></h4>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Because I was in love with you."><b>Gellert</b>: "<i>Would this be one of your regular haunts?</i>"</span></dd>
<dd><b>Albus</b>: "<i>I don't have any regular haunts.</i>"</dd>
<dd><b>Gellert</b>: "<i>Let me see it. Sometimes I imagine I can still feel it around my neck, I carried it for so many years. How does it feel around yours?</i>"</dd>
<dd><b>Albus</b>: "<i>We can free each other of it.</i>"</dd>
<dd><b>Gellert</b>: "<i>Love to chatter, don't they, our Muggle friends. Though one must admit, they make a good cup of tea.</i>"</dd>
<dd><b>Albus</b>: "<i>What you're doing is madness.</i>"</dd>
<dd><b>Gellert</b>: "<i>It's what we said we'd do.</i>"</dd>
<dd><b>Albus</b>: "<i>Well, I was young, I was...</i>"</dd>
<dd><b>Gellert</b>: "<i>Committed, to me. To us.</i>"</dd>
<dd><b>Albus</b>: "<i>No. I went along because...</i>"</dd>
<dd><b>Gellert</b>: "<i>Because?</i>"</dd>
<dd><b>Albus</b>: "<i>Because I was in love with you.</i>"</dd>
<dd><b>Gellert</b>: "<i>Yes. But that's not why you went along. It was you who said we could reshape the world. That it was our birthright. Can you smell it? The stench. Do you really intend to turn your back on your own kind? For these animals? With or without you, I'll burn down their world, Albus. There's nothing you can do to stop me. Enjoy your cup of tea.</i>"</dd>
<dd>— Gellert and Albus's conversation at this meeting<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Fantastic_Beasts:_The_Secrets_of_Dumbledore" title="Fantastic Beasts: The Secrets of Dumbledore">[src]</a></sup></dd></dl>
</div>
<p>Sometime in between <a href="/wiki/1927" title="1927">1927</a> and <a href="/wiki/1932" title="1932">1932</a>, Albus planned to meet with his past boyfriend <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Gellert Grindelwald</a>. Albus took a train to the <a href="/wiki/London_Underground" title="London Underground">London Underground</a> and up to <a href="/wiki/Piccadilly_Circus" title="Piccadilly Circus">Piccadilly Circus</a> and pondered before walking off to a <a href="/wiki/Unidentified_London_restaurant" title="Unidentified London restaurant">London café</a> to have a <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore_and_Gellert_Grindelwald%27s_restaurant_meeting" title="Albus Dumbledore and Gellert Grindelwald's restaurant meeting">meeting</a> with his former partner, <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Gellert Grindelwald</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-SODS_32-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-SODS-32"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>32<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
