<p>He ordered a cup of tea for himself and informed the waitress that he was waiting for somebody, who was Gellert Grindelwald. Gellert came late to this meeting.<sup id="cite_ref-SODS_32-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-SODS-32"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>32<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> The two distant lovers, discussed their common past and goals. Albus claimed to only have followed Gellert due to being in love. Grindelwald expressed his <a href="/wiki/Wizarding_supremacy" title="Wizarding supremacy">distaste</a> for the Muggles present and informed Dumbledore of his intention to destroy their world, with or without Dumbledore's help, but he did acknowledge that they knew how to brew a good cup of <a href="/wiki/Tea" title="Tea">tea</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-SOD_16-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-SOD-16"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>16<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Forming_his_first_army">Forming his first army</span></h4>
<p>Knowing the dangers of Gellert Grindelwald were growing, Albus enlisted <a href="/wiki/Newton_Scamander" title="Newton Scamander">Newton Scamander</a> to assemble an <a href="/wiki/Newton_Scamander%27s_army" class="mw-redirect" title="Newton Scamander's army">army</a>, filled with intrepid <a href="/wiki/Wizardkind" title="Wizardkind">wizardkind</a>, while also trying to figure out a way to destroy the <a href="/wiki/Blood_pact" title="Blood pact">blood pact</a> <a href="/wiki/Blood_pact_between_Albus_Dumbledore_and_Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Blood pact between Albus Dumbledore and Gellert Grindelwald">created</a> by his lover and him in their youth.<sup id="cite_ref-SOD_16-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-SOD-16"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>16<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>

<p>Albus came to the <a href="/wiki/Hog%27s_Head_Inn" title="Hog's Head Inn">Hog's Head Inn</a> to meet with <a href="/wiki/Newton_Scamander" title="Newton Scamander">Newt Scamander</a> and <a href="/wiki/Theseus_Scamander" title="Theseus Scamander">Theseus Scamander</a>. In one of the rooms he demonstrated to the Scamander brothers that his blood pact was not only preventing him from attacking Grindelwald, but also was preventing him from thinking of attacking Gellert. After the thought of attacking Grindelwald flashed through his mind, the blood pact vial shot up and began to tear into the wall, then the chain it was hanging from was wrapped around Albus's wrists, deeply injuring him. If Albus hadn't pushed the forbidden thought out of his head, the chain would continue to hurt him, until he would eventually die of his wounds. Dumbledore stopped his demonstration and the chain loosened. He also told Theseus that he had to trust him. Albus explained to the Scamander brothers that the <a href="/wiki/Qilin" title="Qilin">Qilin</a> that Grindelwald stole had some special abilities and because of them Gellert could saw visions of the future, so the brothers had to be very careful.<sup id="cite_ref-SOD_16-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-SOD-16"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>16<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Before departing to Berlin, Dumbledore had given each of his army something to confuse Grindelwald, as they had to compensate for his ability to see the future. Newt gave them all the items Albus had entrusted to them: Theseus got a tie with a large gold pin, Jacob got a serpentine wand but with no core, so it had no power; Bunty was given a list of instructions that only she could see. In the instructions Dumbledore ordered her to make some copies of Newt's suitcase. After reading them, the instructions fell apart. Yusuf was ordered to go to Nurmengard and spy on Grindelwald, while Lally already had the Portkey book.<sup id="cite_ref-SOD_16-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-SOD-16"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>16<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Later Dumbledore arrived in Berlin himself, where he met with Newt, Lally and Jacob. Albus asked Lally and Jacob to go to the candidates dinner, as he suspected that there will be some kind of assassination attempt. Dumbledore also revealed to Newt the location of the mysterious German wizarding prison, <a href="/wiki/Erkstag" title="Erkstag">Erkstag</a>, where Theseus was being imprisoned.<sup id="cite_ref-SOD_16-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-SOD-16"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>16<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>

<p>Sometime after, he found <a href="/wiki/Aurelius_Dumbledore" title="Aurelius Dumbledore">Aurelius Dumbledore</a> in <a href="/wiki/Berlin" title="Berlin">Berlin</a> on a <a href="/wiki/Berlin_street" title="Berlin street">street</a>. Credence released his Obscurus and started the fight. Albus successfully defended himself, but Credence's condition did not allow him to win this fight. Dumbledore assured Credence that Grindelwald had lied to him, and that they were not brothers, but told him that they "do share the same", and he is a Dumbledore.<sup id="cite_ref-SOD_16-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-SOD-16"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>16<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 250px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/ad/The_Secrets_of_Dumbledore_-_Heroes.jpeg/revision/latest?cb=20211213162119" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="The Secrets of Dumbledore - Heroes" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="148" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="The Secrets of Dumbledore - Heroes.jpeg" data-image-key="The_Secrets_of_Dumbledore_-_Heroes.jpeg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/ad/The_Secrets_of_Dumbledore_-_Heroes.jpeg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20211213162119" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/ad/The_Secrets_of_Dumbledore_-_Heroes.jpeg/revision/latest?cb=20211213162119" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="The Secrets of Dumbledore - Heroes" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/ad/The_Secrets_of_Dumbledore_-_Heroes.jpeg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20211213162119" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="148" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="The Secrets of Dumbledore - Heroes.jpeg" data-image-key="The_Secrets_of_Dumbledore_-_Heroes.jpeg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/ad/The_Secrets_of_Dumbledore_-_Heroes.jpeg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20211213162119" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:The_Secrets_of_Dumbledore_-_Heroes.jpeg" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Albus with Newt's army in the Great Hall</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>After Newt put together his team of his chosen wizards, Albus invited them to Hogwarts and while in the <a href="/wiki/Great_Hall" title="Great Hall">Great Hall</a> showed them a sculpture of where they were heading. The destination of their journey was <a href="/wiki/Bhutan" title="Bhutan">Bhutan</a>. <a href="/wiki/The_walk_of_the_Qilin" title="The walk of the Qilin">The walk of the Qilin</a> was to be held there, and a new <a href="/wiki/Supreme_Mugwump" title="Supreme Mugwump">Supreme Mugwump</a> was to be elected.<sup id="cite_ref-SOD_16-7" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-SOD-16"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>16<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Dumbledore invited his crew to dinner at Hog's Head, where Aberforth prepared a meal for them. Albus explained to Aberforth that Credence was the son of Aberforth, the fruit of a relationship with a <a href="/wiki/Credence_Barebone%27s_mother" class="mw-redirect" title="Credence Barebone's mother">girl</a> from <a href="/wiki/Godric%27s_Hollow" title="Godric's Hollow">Godric's Hollow</a>. It turned out that Newt had overheard their conversation. After Aberforth left the room, Albus told Newt the truth about Credence and that the boy was dying and could not be saved. He also revealed that his sister, <a href="/wiki/Ariana_Dumbledore" title="Ariana Dumbledore">Ariana</a>, was an <a href="/wiki/Obscurial" title="Obscurial">Obscurial</a> like Credence, and that she died as a result of a fight between him, Aberforth and Grindelwald. Newt tried to cheer Albus, but to no avail, as Albus blamed himself for his sister's death.<sup id="cite_ref-SOD_16-8" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-SOD-16"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>16<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Later, Dumbledore waited with Bunty for Newt, Theseus, Jacob and Lally in the <a href="/wiki/Room_of_Requirement" title="Room of Requirement">Room of Requirement</a>. There were five identical suitcases waiting for them, in one of them was hidden Qilin. Dumbledore asked Newt if he knew which of the suitcases was real, to which Newt replied that he did not know. Dumbledore replied that it was good, because if he had known, the plan would not work. Dumbledore had successfully planned an escape plan in case Grindelwald's men would attack. The three suitcases contained enchanted books, <a href="/wiki/Quaffle" title="Quaffle">Quaffle</a>, <a href="/wiki/Bludger" title="Bludger">Bludgers</a>, and Jacob's pastries that would attack the Grindelwald's acolytes in case of trouble. Everyone, apart from Albus, took one suitcase and they all used a <a href="/wiki/Qilin_Ceremony_Portkey" title="Qilin Ceremony Portkey">Qilin Ceremony Portkey</a> to the <a href="/wiki/Magisterial_Chamber_of_Ancient_Wizardry" class="mw-redirect" title="Magisterial Chamber of Ancient Wizardry">Magisterial Chamber of Ancient Wizardry</a> in Bhutan. Dumbledore and Jacob went first, the rest followed.<sup id="cite_ref-SOD_16-9" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-SOD-16"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>16<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 250px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/82/The_Qilin_bows_before_Dumbledore.png/revision/latest?cb=20220620123455" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="The Qilin bows before Dumbledore" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="104" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="The Qilin bows before Dumbledore.png" data-image-key="The_Qilin_bows_before_Dumbledore.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/82/The_Qilin_bows_before_Dumbledore.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20220620123455" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/82/The_Qilin_bows_before_Dumbledore.png/revision/latest?cb=20220620123455" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="The Qilin bows before Dumbledore" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/82/The_Qilin_bows_before_Dumbledore.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20220620123455" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="104" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="The Qilin bows before Dumbledore.png" data-image-key="The_Qilin_bows_before_Dumbledore.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/82/The_Qilin_bows_before_Dumbledore.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20220620123455" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:The_Qilin_bows_before_Dumbledore.png" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">The <a href="/wiki/Qilin" title="Qilin">Qilin</a> bowing before Dumbledore</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>During the ceremony, Grindelwald used the revived Qilin, which bowed to him, making him the new Supreme Mugwump. Dumbledore witnessed how Grindelwald used the <a href="/wiki/Cruciatus_Curse" title="Cruciatus Curse">Cruciatus Curse</a> on Jacob. Newt, however, wanted to expose Grindelwald, and with the help of Credence, revealed that Grindelwald was a liar. When Bunty appeared, Newt pulled a second Qilin from the suitcase. The second <a href="/wiki/Qilin" title="Qilin">Qilin</a> bowed before Albus. While honoured by the Qilin's selection, he declined to assume office, saying there was a second person equally deserving to be Supreme Mugwump. Ultimately, <a href="/wiki/Vic%C3%AAncia_Santos" title="Vicência Santos">Vicência Santos</a> won the election, as the Qilin bowed to her. Out of anger, Grindelwald cast a <a href="/wiki/Killing_Curse" title="Killing Curse">Killing Curse</a> at Credence, which was deflected by Albus and Aberforth.<sup id="cite_ref-SOD_16-10" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-SOD-16"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>16<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>The deflected curse damaged the blood pact's pendant, which Dumbledore owned. The vial was destroyed, because neither Dumbledore nor <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Grindelwald</a> thought of attacking each other; one wanted to kill someone, the other wanted to defend. Immediately, both wizards duelled each other, which ended in an impasse. When the Aurors and the rest gathered to capture Grindelwald, he told Albus before Disapparating that he had never been their enemy, now or then.<sup id="cite_ref-SOD_16-11" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-SOD-16"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>16<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Later Dumbledore witnessed Newt, <a href="/wiki/Porpentina_Goldstein" title="Porpentina Goldstein">Tina Goldstein</a>, Theseus, and Lally attending Jacob's and <a href="/wiki/Queenie_Goldstein" title="Queenie Goldstein">Queenie Goldstein</a>'s wedding in New York City. Albus thanked Newt for his help, to which Newt replied that if Albus asked him again, he would help him.<sup id="cite_ref-SOD_16-12" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-SOD-16"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>16<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Meeting_Tom_Riddle">Meeting Tom Riddle</span></h4>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince"><b>Tom Riddle</b>: "<i>Who are you?</i>"</span></dd>
<dd><b>Albus Dumbledore</b>: "<i>I have told you. My name is Professor Dumbledore and I work at a school called Hogwarts. I have come to offer you a place at my school — your new school, if you would like to come.</i>"</dd>
<dd><b>Tom Riddle</b>: "<i>You can't kid me! The asylum, that's where you're from, isn't it? 'Professor,' yes, of course — well, I'm not going, see? That old cat's the one who should be in the asylum. I never did anything to little Amy Benson or Dennis Bishop, and you can ask them, they'll tell you!</i>"</dd>
<dd><b>Albus Dumbledore</b>: "<i>I am not from the asylum. I am a teacher and, if you will sit down calmly, I shall tell you about Hogwarts. Of course, if you would rather not come to the school, nobody will force you —</i>"</dd>
<dd>— Dumbledore offering a young Tom Riddle a place at Hogwarts<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">[src]</a></sup></dd></dl>
</div>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 250px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/aa/Dumbledore_visits_Wool%27s.png/revision/latest?cb=20210304003327" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Dumbledore visits Wool's" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="104" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Dumbledore visits Wool's.png" data-image-key="Dumbledore_visits_Wool%27s.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/aa/Dumbledore_visits_Wool%27s.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20210304003327" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/aa/Dumbledore_visits_Wool%27s.png/revision/latest?cb=20210304003327" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Dumbledore visits Wool's" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/aa/Dumbledore_visits_Wool%27s.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20210304003327" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="104" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Dumbledore visits Wool's.png" data-image-key="Dumbledore_visits_Wool%27s.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/aa/Dumbledore_visits_Wool%27s.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20210304003327" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Dumbledore_visits_Wool%27s.png" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Dumbledore arriving at Wool's Orphanage</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>At some point in his career, Albus also became involved with the recruitment of students for Hogwarts, becoming a <a href="/wiki/Special_messenger" title="Special messenger">special messenger</a> for the school whose job it was to visit the young witches and wizards whose names appeared in the <a href="/wiki/Book_of_Admittance" title="Book of Admittance">Book of Admittance</a> and came from <a href="/wiki/Non-magic_people" title="Non-magic people">Muggle</a> families in order to explain to their parents that magic existed and to deliver the <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_acceptance_letter" title="Hogwarts acceptance letter">acceptance letter</a> in person. Most prominent among the students he recruited was <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Tom Riddle</a> in <a href="/wiki/1938" title="1938">1938</a>, who resided at <a href="/wiki/Wool%27s_Orphanage" title="Wool's Orphanage">Wool's Orphanage</a> in <a href="/wiki/London" title="London">London</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-HBP13_47-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP13-47"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>47<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> For the purposes of fulfilling his duty as the school's messenger, Dumbledore wrote to the <a href="/wiki/Matron" title="Matron">matron</a>, <a href="/wiki/Cole" title="Cole">Mrs Cole</a>, to schedule a meeting with her to discuss arrangements for the boy's future. Because young Riddle was a ward of the state and she the custodian of the institution at which he lived rather than the boy's legal guardian, however, Albus was <a href="/wiki/International_Statute_of_Wizarding_Secrecy" title="International Statute of Wizarding Secrecy">purposefully vague</a> in his reasons for wanting to meet the boy.
</p><p>Thinking he might be a family member wanting to claim him, she accepted the preposition and, at the agreed upon time and date, Professor Dumbledore presented himself at the establishment in question. Shown in by one of the employees, Albus was formally introduced to Mrs Cole, who invited him to join him in her office to talk about the reasons for his visit. The news that Tom had been accepted to attend the school where Albus taught came as a surprise to Mrs Cole, who at Dumbledore's request recounted Tom Riddle's history at the orphanage, mostly notably the circumstances of Tom's birth, his anti-social behaviour and his extraordinary bad influence on the other children; including some very nasty incidents that resulted in the death of a pet rabbit and a gathering with several of his peers in a <a href="/wiki/The_Cave" title="The Cave">cave</a> that left them traumatised.<sup id="cite_ref-HBP13_47-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP13-47"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>47<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 250px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/2/23/B6C13M1_Tom_Riddle_as_a_child.png/revision/latest?cb=20181021171804" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="B6C13M1 Tom Riddle as a child" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="105" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="B6C13M1 Tom Riddle as a child.png" data-image-key="B6C13M1_Tom_Riddle_as_a_child.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/2/23/B6C13M1_Tom_Riddle_as_a_child.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20181021171804" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/2/23/B6C13M1_Tom_Riddle_as_a_child.png/revision/latest?cb=20181021171804" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="B6C13M1 Tom Riddle as a child" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/2/23/B6C13M1_Tom_Riddle_as_a_child.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20181021171804" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="105" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="B6C13M1 Tom Riddle as a child.png" data-image-key="B6C13M1_Tom_Riddle_as_a_child.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/2/23/B6C13M1_Tom_Riddle_as_a_child.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20181021171804" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:B6C13M1_Tom_Riddle_as_a_child.png" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Dumbledore meeting Tom Riddle</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Once it became clear that Albus would not be dissuaded from his mission, however, Mrs Cole agreed to let him meet the prospective student and escorted him to the upper floor to the boy's room, where the two were formally introduced. Initially suspicious and hostile towards him, Albus found himself having to assure the boy that he was not, in fact, a doctor that had come to lock him up at the asylum; showing his awareness of the matron's suspicions about his behaviour, and was finally able to extend the invitation to Hogwarts and inform him that he was, in fact, a wizard. And though he was impressed to hear, as Mrs Cole's testimony suggested, how well-developed his powers were for such a young wizard, as well as how his degree of control over them was such that he had already begun to use them intentionally. It was also during this encounter that Albus first learned that the boy was a <a href="/wiki/Parseltongue" title="Parseltongue">Parselmouth</a>; a fact that he did not find nearly as concerning as the boy's "<i>obvious instincts for cruelty, secrecy and domination</i>".<sup id="cite_ref-HBP_48-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP-48"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>48<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> 
</p><p>Upon <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore%27s_theft_sensory_spell" title="Albus Dumbledore's theft sensory spell">discovering</a> that Riddle had stolen from the other children at the orphanage, Dumbledore admonished him for his behaviour and instructed him to return the items to their rightful owners and apologise for taking them, warning him that he had exercised his abilities in a manner that would be unacceptable at Hogwarts, should he agree to attend. Thereafter, Dumbledore provided him with enough information to find <a href="/wiki/Diagon_Alley" title="Diagon Alley">Diagon Alley</a> and <a href="/wiki/Platform_Nine_and_Three-Quarters" title="Platform Nine and Three-Quarters">Platform Nine and Three-Quarters</a>, as well as a stipend from school funds so that he could purchase his books and other equipment. On account of his conduct around his peers, Dumbledore became immediately suspicious of and resolved to keep a close eye on him during his studies at the school.<sup id="cite_ref-HBP_48-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP-48"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>48<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Professor_of_Transfiguration">Professor of Transfiguration</span></h4>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets"><b>Albus Dumbledore</b>: "<i>What are you doing, wandering around this late, Tom?</i>"</span></dd>
<dd><b>Tom Riddle</b>: "<i>I had to see the headmaster, sir.</i>"</dd>
<dd><b>Albus Dumbledore</b>: "<i>Well, hurry off to bed. Best not to roam the corridors these days. Not since…</i>"</dd>
<dd>— Dumbledore speaking to a young Tom Riddle at Hogwarts<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Chamber_of_Secrets" title="Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets">[src]</a></sup></dd></dl>
</div>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 250px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/a6/Dumbledore_watching_Tom_Riddle.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180122221958" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Dumbledore watching Tom Riddle" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="107" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Dumbledore watching Tom Riddle.jpg" data-image-key="Dumbledore_watching_Tom_Riddle.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/a6/Dumbledore_watching_Tom_Riddle.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20180122221958" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/a6/Dumbledore_watching_Tom_Riddle.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180122221958" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Dumbledore watching Tom Riddle" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/a6/Dumbledore_watching_Tom_Riddle.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20180122221958" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="107" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Dumbledore watching Tom Riddle.jpg" data-image-key="Dumbledore_watching_Tom_Riddle.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/a6/Dumbledore_watching_Tom_Riddle.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20180122221958" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Dumbledore_watching_Tom_Riddle.jpg" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Professor Dumbledore talking with Tom Riddle during the first opening of the <a href="/wiki/Chamber_of_Secrets" title="Chamber of Secrets">Chamber of Secrets</a>, <a href="/wiki/1943" title="1943">1943</a></p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>At an unknown point in time, Dumbledore became the Professor of <a href="/wiki/Transfiguration_(class)" title="Transfiguration (class)">Transfiguration</a>. In the <a href="/wiki/1942%E2%80%931943_school_year" title="1942–1943 school year">1942–1943 school year</a>, several <a href="/wiki/Muggle-born" title="Muggle-born">Muggle-born</a> students were mysteriously <a href="/wiki/Petrification" title="Petrification">petrified</a> by a <a href="/wiki/Serpent_of_Slytherin" title="Serpent of Slytherin">beast</a> rumoured to have been released by the <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Heir of Slytherin</a> from the mythical Chamber of Secrets. Indeed, the final victim of the beast, <a href="/wiki/Myrtle_Warren" title="Myrtle Warren">Myrtle Warren</a>, was actually killed; this act seemed likely to ensure the permanent closure of the school, forcing Riddle to go back to the orphanage. While Dumbledore rightly suspected Riddle was behind the attacks, the aspiring Dark wizard expertly framed Gryffindor student <a href="/wiki/Rubeus_Hagrid" title="Rubeus Hagrid">Rubeus Hagrid</a> as the perpetrator.<sup id="cite_ref-COS_49-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COS-49"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>49<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Riddle was able to pass off Hagrid's tamed <a href="/wiki/Acromantula" title="Acromantula">Acromantula</a>, <a href="/wiki/Aragog" title="Aragog">Aragog</a>, as the beast attacking students, resulting in Hagrid's expulsion and ensuring that Hogwarts remained open. Dumbledore was never able to uncover hard evidence implicating Riddle, however, he nonetheless kept a very close watch over Riddle, preventing him from opening the Chamber of Secrets again during his remaining years at Hogwarts. He was also able to convince the Headmaster to allow Hagrid to remain at the school as the groundskeeper-in-training.<sup id="cite_ref-COS_49-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COS-49"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>49<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Defeat_of_Gellert_Grindelwald">Defeat of Gellert Grindelwald</span></h4>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone">"<i>Dumbledore is particularly famous for his defeat of the Dark wizard Grindelwald in 1945.</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— Info on Dumbledore's <a href="/wiki/Chocolate_Frog_Card" title="Chocolate Frog Card">Chocolate Frog Card</a><sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Philosopher%27s_Stone" title="Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 250px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/5/57/Dumbledore_Grindelwald_Duel.png/revision/latest?cb=20170512210203" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Dumbledore Grindelwald Duel" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="190" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Dumbledore Grindelwald Duel.png" data-image-key="Dumbledore_Grindelwald_Duel.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/5/57/Dumbledore_Grindelwald_Duel.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20170512210203" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/5/57/Dumbledore_Grindelwald_Duel.png/revision/latest?cb=20170512210203" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Dumbledore Grindelwald Duel" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/5/57/Dumbledore_Grindelwald_Duel.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20170512210203" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="190" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Dumbledore Grindelwald Duel.png" data-image-key="Dumbledore_Grindelwald_Duel.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/5/57/Dumbledore_Grindelwald_Duel.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20170512210203" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Dumbledore_Grindelwald_Duel.png" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Albus duelling his former lover</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>As Dumbledore was educating young wizards and witches, <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Gellert Grindelwald</a> was still at large in <a href="/wiki/Europe" title="Europe">Europe</a>, building up his army, and had already found one of the <a href="/wiki/Deathly_Hallows" title="Deathly Hallows">Deathly Hallows</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Elder_Wand" title="Elder Wand">Elder Wand</a>, which he used to continue terrorising the continent. Initially prevented from opposing Grindelwald directly because of the <a href="/wiki/Blood_pact" title="Blood pact">blood pact</a> they once made, even once that was destroyed, Dumbledore still felt conflicted about going after his old friend. In spite of himself, he still felt a lingering love for the man Grindelwald had been, or rather, the man he had once convinced himself Grindelwald was and/or could be. More than anything, however, Dumbledore feared facing Grindelwald. While secure in his ability to defeat him in battle if it came to it, more than anything, Dumbledore was afraid Grindelwald could reveal to him that it had in fact been he himself who had cast the curse that killed Ariana.
</p><p>Having delayed pursuing him as long as he could, however, at the height of Grindelwald's power, in <a href="/wiki/1945" title="1945">1945</a>, Albus could no longer in good conscience turn a blind eye to the many atrocities of Grindelwald and his followers, and so he finally tracked his old friend down. Upon finding Grindelwald, Dumbledore engaged him in what would later be widely considered <a href="/wiki/Duel_between_Albus_Dumbledore_and_Gellert_Grindelwald" class="mw-redirect" title="Duel between Albus Dumbledore and Gellert Grindelwald">the greatest duel</a> ever fought between two wizards. Dumbledore defeated Grindelwald and then brought him before the authorities of the magical world, and Grindelwald was imprisoned in the uppermost cell at <a href="/wiki/Nurmengard_Castle" title="Nurmengard Castle">Nurmengard</a>, while Dumbledore kept the Elder Wand for himself.<sup id="cite_ref-DH_28-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH-28"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>28<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Celebrated worldwide as the hero who put to rest the <a href="/wiki/Global_Wizarding_War" title="Global Wizarding War">Global Wizarding War</a> and ended Grindelwald's <i><a href="/wiki/For_the_Greater_Good" title="For the Greater Good">For the Greater Good</a></i> revolution of wizarding dominance over Muggles, Dumbledore was awarded the <a href="/wiki/Order_of_Merlin" title="Order of Merlin">Order of Merlin</a> (<a href="/wiki/Order_of_Merlin#Order_of_Merlin,_First_Class" title="Order of Merlin">First Class</a>), by <a href="/wiki/Leonard_Spencer-Moon" title="Leonard Spencer-Moon">Leonard Spencer-Moon</a>'s administration.<sup id="cite_ref-PMordermerlin_50-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PMordermerlin-50"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>50<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span id="Aftermath_.281946.E2.80.931969.29"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="Aftermath_(1946–1969)">Aftermath <span class="template-c">(1946–1969)</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Turning_down_power">Turning down power</span></h4>
<p>Resuming his career following this legendary event, Albus was offered the position of <a href="/wiki/Minister_for_Magic" title="Minister for Magic">Minister for Magic</a> several times, but he turned down the offer every time, remembering how his quest for power had been his weakness in the past. It was around this time that he encountered a <a href="/wiki/House-elf" title="House-elf">house-elf</a> named <a href="/wiki/Hokey" title="Hokey">Hokey</a>. Before she died, he took a memory from her, in which <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Tom Riddle</a> showed his interest towards the magical antiques of the recently deceased <a href="/wiki/Hepzibah_Smith" title="Hepzibah Smith">Hepzibah Smith</a>, whose death by a little-known poison had been blamed on Hokey. This memory was not sufficient evidence to show Hokey's innocence, as it only proved that Riddle was aware of the artefacts' existence.<sup id="cite_ref-HBP_48-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP-48"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>48<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>As though the opening of the legendary <a href="/wiki/Chamber_of_Secrets" title="Chamber of Secrets">Chamber of Secrets</a> some thirty odd years back had not been bad enough, however, a young witch by the name of <a href="/wiki/Patricia_Rakepick" title="Patricia Rakepick">Patricia Rakepick</a> arrived at Hogwarts and eventually caught Dumbledore's attention not only by virtue of the fact that she had been unusually gifted magically, but also due to her extensive research into the fabled <a href="/wiki/Cursed_Vaults" title="Cursed Vaults">Cursed Vaults</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-51" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-51"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>51<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Myth would have it that there were a number of concealed rooms hidden in and around Hogwarts Castle; each shielded by a different curse to guard priceless treasures of <a href="/wiki/Gold" title="Gold">gold</a>, <a href="/wiki/Prophecy" title="Prophecy">prophecies</a> and powerful magical artefacts dating back to before the school was founded.<sup id="cite_ref-HMy1ch63_52-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HMy1ch63-52"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>52<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Convinced that the vaults were real, Rakepick had tried to warn the staff about them, but seen as how neither she, nor anyone else for that matter, had ever come close enough to finding them to offer up any solid proof for their existence, her professors, Albus included, did not act on it at the time.<sup id="cite_ref-HMy4ch1_53-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HMy4ch1-53"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>53<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Becoming_Headmaster_of_Hogwarts">Becoming Headmaster of Hogwarts</span></h4>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 250px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/ab/Albus_Dumbledore_%28cutscene%29_PSG_PC.png/revision/latest?cb=20150627222611" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Albus Dumbledore (cutscene) PSG PC" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="195" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Albus Dumbledore (cutscene) PSG PC.png" data-image-key="Albus_Dumbledore_%28cutscene%29_PSG_PC.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/ab/Albus_Dumbledore_%28cutscene%29_PSG_PC.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20150627222611" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/ab/Albus_Dumbledore_%28cutscene%29_PSG_PC.png/revision/latest?cb=20150627222611" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Albus Dumbledore (cutscene) PSG PC" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/ab/Albus_Dumbledore_%28cutscene%29_PSG_PC.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20150627222611" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="195" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Albus Dumbledore (cutscene) PSG PC.png" data-image-key="Albus_Dumbledore_%28cutscene%29_PSG_PC.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/ab/Albus_Dumbledore_%28cutscene%29_PSG_PC.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20150627222611" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Albus_Dumbledore_(cutscene)_PSG_PC.png" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Headmaster Dumbledore welcoming students to the new school term</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>By the mid-<a href="/wiki/1960s" title="1960s">1960s</a>, the amount of Dark magical activity across the country was growing steadily, and while few knew what was behind the mounting attacks and sightings, this was but the precursor to <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a>'s first rise to power. Aware that it was only a matter of time before his former student made his presence and intent known to the wizarding community at large and already preparing to <a href="/wiki/Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Order of the Phoenix">actively oppose</a> him, by the time the <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eaters</a> began recruiting Dark creatures to help them overthrow the <a href="/wiki/British_Ministry_of_Magic" title="British Ministry of Magic">Ministry of Magic</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-PM_54-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PM-54"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>54<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> and the Ministry, in turn, started to call upon the services of authorities on such matters to help it understand and contain the threat, the old Transfiguration teacher already had spies in their midst reporting to him.
</p><p>It was through these contacts that Dumbledore first learned of the attack on a young boy by the name of <a href="/wiki/Remus_Lupin" title="Remus Lupin">Remus Lupin</a>, who had been infected with <a href="/wiki/Lycanthropy" title="Lycanthropy">lycanthropy</a> by a <a href="/wiki/Fenrir_Greyback" title="Fenrir Greyback">Fenrir Greyback</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-PM_54-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PM-54"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>54<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Rather than trying to manage his condition, however, the attacker had instead made it his mission in life to infect as many people as possible and was harbouring grand plans of raising an army of werewolves big enough to take over the wizarding community; and even earned quite a bit of notoriety for targeting children with the intent of raising them away from other witches and wizards in order to teach them to despise regular humans. Knowing how this would have had to have impacted the <a href="/wiki/Lupin_family" title="Lupin family">Lupin family</a>, the old Transfiguration teacher could not help but be sympathetic to their predicament. As fortune would have it, however, a blessing in disguise presented itself when the <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_Board_of_Governors" title="Hogwarts Board of Governors">Board of Governors</a> was faced with the decision of finding a suitable candidate to succeed <a href="/wiki/Armando_Dippet" title="Armando Dippet">Armando Dippet</a> and concluded that Professor Dumbledore was the best man for the job.<sup id="cite_ref-55" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-55"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>55<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>This, in turn, granted him the authority to properly accommodate the Lupins when the time came for Remus to attend school. Shortly after Dumbledore assumed the position, by which time he had already relocated to the <a href="/wiki/Headmaster%27s_Tower" title="Headmaster's Tower">Headmaster's Tower</a> and filled his new <a href="/wiki/Headmaster%27s_office" title="Headmaster's office">study</a> with a number of curious <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore%27s_silver_instruments" title="Albus Dumbledore's silver instruments">magical instruments</a> that had formerly been housed in his old classroom, Tom Riddle, now known exclusively as Lord Voldemort, approached him with the same request he had made to Dippet before him, to be allowed to return to Hogwarts as a teacher. Dumbledore, who knew of Voldemort's illicit activities since he left <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts</a> and suspected that he might have meant to use the position as means of recruiting more <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">followers</a>, turned down his application. This led Voldemort to angrily <a href="/wiki/Jinx_on_the_post_of_Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts_teacher" title="Jinx on the post of Defence Against the Dark Arts teacher">jinx</a> the position of <a href="/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts" title="Defence Against the Dark Arts">Defence Against the Dark Arts</a> instructor, preventing anyone from holding the position for more than a single school year. What was more; while being entrusted the stewardship of the school was, in and of itself, an honour and a privilege, it also meant that he was henceforth expected to shoulder the responsibility of making all the difficult decisions that came with leadership.
</p><p>On such occasions, Dumbledore would step out into the <a href="/wiki/Clock_Tower_Courtyard" title="Clock Tower Courtyard">Clock Tower Courtyard</a>, where he found the quiet, starry night and the crisp air helpful in regard to putting one's troubles in perspective,<sup id="cite_ref-HMy1ch6_56-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HMy1ch6-56"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>56<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> and developed a habit of pacing around his new office a lot, especially in troubled and trying times such as when the security of the castle was breached.<sup id="cite_ref-POA_57-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-POA-57"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>57<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-POAF_58-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-POAF-58"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>58<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> On occasion, he would also see students in his office, be it because of a misdemeanour that had to be addressed, or because one of the pupils sought redress during conflicts with their peers, such as <a href="/wiki/Bertha_Jorkins" title="Bertha Jorkins">Bertha Jorkins</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-GOF_59-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-GOF-59"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>59<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> At some point following his appointment, Professor Dumbledore began to offer to <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore_Homework_Help" title="Albus Dumbledore Homework Help">help students with their homework</a>, whom he would meet every Friday in <a href="/wiki/Classroom_E-13" title="Classroom E-13">Classroom E-13</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-HPPS_60-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HPPS-60"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>60<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Fond of festivities in general, he would also usually stand for the entertainment during the annual <a href="/wiki/Hallowe%27en_Feast" class="mw-redirect" title="Hallowe'en Feast">Hallowe'en Feast</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Great_Hall" title="Great Hall">Great Hall</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-HM_y1_Hallowe'en_61-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM_y1_Hallowe'en-61"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>61<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>As the day neared when young <a href="/wiki/Remus_Lupin" title="Remus Lupin">Remus Lupin</a> would be of an eligible age to begin his magical education, Dumbledore wasted little time in making the necessary preparations for the young man's arrival: To this end, Dumbledore arranged for a <a href="/wiki/Shrieking_Shack" title="Shrieking Shack">house</a> to be built a little way above the rest of the nearby <a href="/wiki/Hogsmeade" title="Hogsmeade">Hogsmeade</a>; perched atop a hill overlooking the village. Once finished, the Headmaster applied the appropriate spells to provide Remus with a safe and secure place for his transformations that could contain even a fully grown werewolf, if necessary. Next, he arranged for an underground passage <a href="/wiki/Gouging_Spell" title="Gouging Spell">to be made</a> on the school grounds to give Remus an easy and discreet way of accessing the building when necessary and had a <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_Whomping_Willow" title="Hogwarts Whomping Willow">Whomping Willow</a> planted over the opening; both to hide it from view, and as a security measure to stop anyone from coming across the future pupil whilst he was dangerous. Shortly before <a href="/wiki/10_March" title="10 March">10 March</a> <a href="/wiki/1971" title="1971">1971</a>, Dumbledore showed up unannounced at the doorstep of <a href="/wiki/Lyall_Lupin" title="Lyall Lupin">Lyall</a> and <a href="/wiki/Hope_Howell" title="Hope Howell">Hope Lupin</a> to invite their son to attend school. Well aware that their initial reaction, namely to try and keep him from entering their home, stemmed from fear more than anything else, the Headmaster took the liberty of finding his own way into the house. Five minutes later, Dumbledore was sitting on their living room floor by the fireplace, eating crumpets and playing <a href="/wiki/Gobstones" title="Gobstones">Gobstones</a> with Remus.
</p><p>After explaining to the three of them that he was aware of their situation and, more importantly, that as far as he was concerned, there was no reason why Remus should not be able to attend Hogwarts, as long as special precautions were taken to ensure the safety of both Remus and the other students, a mutual understanding was reached, and it was eventually agreed that young Mr Lupin would indeed present himself at <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_Castle" title="Hogwarts Castle">Hogwarts Castle</a> for the <a href="/wiki/Start-of-Term_Feast" title="Start-of-Term Feast">Start-of-Term</a>. This would forever earn Dumbledore Remus's gratitude, as most others would simply have forbidden the boy from even setting foot in the school. When <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Severus Snape</a> found out Remus's secret, Dumbledore forbade him from repeating it to anyone.
</p>
<h3><span id="First_Wizarding_War_.281970.E2.80.931981.29"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="First_Wizarding_War_(1970–1981)">First Wizarding War <span class="template-c">(1970–1981)</span></span></h3>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows"><b>Severus Snape</b>: "<i>Hide them all, then. Keep her — them — safe. Please.</i>"</span></dd>
<dd><b>Dumbledore</b>: "<i>And what will you give me in return, Severus?</i>"</dd>
<dd><b>Severus Snape</b>: "<i>In — in return? Anything.</i>"</dd>
<dd>— Snape pleading with Dumbledore to protect <a href="/wiki/Lily_Potter_(I)" title="Lily Potter (I)">Lily Potter</a><sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">[src]</a></sup></dd></dl>
</div>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 250px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/ad/The_Marauders_in_Order_of_the_Pheonix_image.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180720155740" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="The Marauders in Order of the Pheonix image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="104" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="The Marauders in Order of the Pheonix image.jpg" data-image-key="The_Marauders_in_Order_of_the_Pheonix_image.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/ad/The_Marauders_in_Order_of_the_Pheonix_image.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20180720155740" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/ad/The_Marauders_in_Order_of_the_Pheonix_image.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180720155740" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="The Marauders in Order of the Pheonix image" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/ad/The_Marauders_in_Order_of_the_Pheonix_image.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20180720155740" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="104" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="The Marauders in Order of the Pheonix image.jpg" data-image-key="The_Marauders_in_Order_of_the_Pheonix_image.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/ad/The_Marauders_in_Order_of_the_Pheonix_image.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20180720155740" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:The_Marauders_in_Order_of_the_Pheonix_image.jpg" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Some of the members of the original Order of the Phoenix</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>After <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a> started his first rise to power in 1970, Dumbledore, around whom opposition to the Dark Lord had always rallied,<sup id="cite_ref-62" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-62"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>62<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> founded and led the <a href="/wiki/Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Order of the Phoenix">Order of the Phoenix</a>, a secret society willing to risk their lives to fight Lord Voldemort and his <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eaters</a>. And despite the fact that the group suffered heavy losses during the conflict, it was also a significant contributor to the war effort. Throughout Dumbledore's efforts to undermine the Dark Lord's rise to power, a great many witches and wizards passed through the halls of Hogwarts: Some of these became staunchly loyal to him and what he stood for, whereas others would become enemies, allying themselves with <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a>. Among these students were future Order members <a href="/wiki/Arthur_Weasley" title="Arthur Weasley">Arthur Weasley</a> and <a href="/wiki/Molly_Weasley" title="Molly Weasley">Molly Prewett</a>, <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eaters</a>-to-be <a href="/wiki/Bellatrix_Lestrange" title="Bellatrix Lestrange">Bellatrix Black</a> and <a href="/wiki/Lucius_Malfoy" title="Lucius Malfoy">Lucius Malfoy</a>.
</p><p>Later on in the war,  Dumbledore discovered that a former Ministry employee by the name of <a href="/wiki/Antoine_Grimalkin" title="Antoine Grimalkin">Antoine Grimalkin</a> and his wife <a href="/wiki/Bedilia_Grimalkin" title="Bedilia Grimalkin">Bedilia</a> had joined the ranks of Lord Voldemort's followers. Once a respected researcher, Antoine had departed the Ministry after his experimental work was deemed too dangerous, and the couple had since turned their skills towards <a href="/wiki/Dark_Arts" title="Dark Arts">Dark magic</a>. Among their inventions was the <a href="/wiki/Frequensting" title="Frequensting">Frequensting</a>, a variant of the <a href="/wiki/Stinging_Hex" class="mw-redirect" title="Stinging Hex">Stinging Hex</a> that was designed to produce a relentless mental torment in its victims. Operating from their home in <a href="/wiki/Godric%27s_Hollow" title="Godric's Hollow">Godric’s Hollow</a>, the pair would travel between wizarding communities, deploying their curse through a <a href="/wiki/Antoine_Grimalkin%27s_cursed_gramophone" title="Antoine Grimalkin's cursed gramophone">bewitched gramophone</a> - a curious blending of Muggle technology and the Dark Arts - which allowed the spell to spread across wide areas. The resulting havoc rendered many victims incapacitated and sowed panic among the population.  Realising the gravity of their threat, Dumbledore intervened discreetly, providing key intelligence that ultimately led the Ministry to their location. His efforts were instrumental in Antoine’s capture and the dismantling of the couple’s operations. Antoine was later confined to <a href="/wiki/Azkaban" title="Azkaban">Azkaban</a>, although his wife evade arrest and fled abroad.<sup id="cite_ref-HMAROTP_63-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HMAROTP-63"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>63<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>  
</p><p>Sometime after this, Dumbledore was approached by another person who also wanted a job at Hogwarts: <a href="/wiki/Sybill_Trelawney" title="Sybill Trelawney">Sybill Trelawney</a>, who applied to become the new <a href="/wiki/Professor" title="Professor">professor</a> of <a href="/wiki/Divination_(class)" title="Divination (class)">Divination</a>, a subject Dumbledore disliked and barely considered a part of necessary education for young wizards and witches. Dumbledore gave her a chance because she was the great-great-granddaughter of the celebrated <a href="/wiki/Seer" title="Seer">Seer</a> <a href="/wiki/Cassandra_Trelawney" title="Cassandra Trelawney">Cassandra Trelawney</a>. To his disappointment, when he was interviewing Sybill at the <a href="/wiki/Hog%27s_Head_Inn" title="Hog's Head Inn">Hog's Head</a>, he came to the conclusion that she was not a real Seer. However, as Dumbledore was about to leave, Trelawney fell into a real trance and made a <a href="/wiki/Sybill_Trelawney%27s_first_prophecy" class="mw-redirect" title="Sybill Trelawney's first prophecy">prophecy</a> about the birth of the one that would have the power to vanquish the Dark Lord, who would be born to those "who have thrice defied him, born as the seventh month dies".<sup id="cite_ref-OOTP_64-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OOTP-64"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>64<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> This astonished Dumbledore, but as it turned out, the Death Eater <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Severus Snape</a> had overheard most of the prophecy but had been caught in the act of spying and ejected from the tavern by <a href="/wiki/Aberforth_Dumbledore" title="Aberforth Dumbledore">Aberforth Dumbledore</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-HBP_48-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP-48"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>48<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Dumbledore hired Trelawney in order to protect her from the Death Eaters.
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="The_Cursed_Vaults">The Cursed Vaults</span></h4>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-right show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 250px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/4/41/Jacob_%28student%29.png/revision/latest?cb=20200707203946" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Jacob (student)" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="195" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Jacob (student).png" data-image-key="Jacob_%28student%29.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/4/41/Jacob_%28student%29.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20200707203946" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/4/41/Jacob_%28student%29.png/revision/latest?cb=20200707203946" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Jacob (student)" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/4/41/Jacob_%28student%29.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20200707203946" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="195" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Jacob (student).png" data-image-key="Jacob_%28student%29.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/4/41/Jacob_%28student%29.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20200707203946" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Jacob_(student).png" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption"><a href="/wiki/Jacob_(Hogwarts_expellee)" title="Jacob (Hogwarts expellee)">Jacob</a> in <a href="/wiki/Jacob%27s_room" title="Jacob's room">his room</a></p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>No sooner had Rakepick completed her tutelage and left her school days behind, however, before her <a href="/wiki/Jacob_(Hogwarts_expellee)" title="Jacob (Hogwarts expellee)">spiritual successor</a> arrived to begin his own. Over the course of his school career, young Jacob earned a steadily increasing notoriety by not only having picked up where she had left off, but even succeeding where she failed; a feat he accomplished with the help of two of his classmates, <a href="/wiki/Duncan_Ashe" title="Duncan Ashe">Duncan Ashe</a> and <a href="/wiki/Olivia_Green" title="Olivia Green">Olivia Green</a> of <a href="/wiki/Slytherin" title="Slytherin">Slytherin</a> and <a href="/wiki/Ravenclaw" title="Ravenclaw">Ravenclaw House</a>, respectively.<sup id="cite_ref-HM53_65-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM53-65"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>65<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Between the latter's arrival in <a href="/wiki/1974" title="1974">1974</a> and his eventual banishment from the castle in <a href="/wiki/1980" title="1980">1980</a>, not only had this trio of friends managed to penetrate one of the oldest and most dangerous secrets that the ancient castle, but they had also broken countless school rules and inadvertently endangered their peers by tampering with the vaults by unleashing a myriad devastating <a href="/wiki/Curse" title="Curse">curses</a> upon the school. This did not, however, discourage the Headmaster from taking a personal interest in Jacob, who was both one of the most rebellious and most talented students at the time.<sup id="cite_ref-HM12_66-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM12-66"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>66<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> 
</p><p>Having sensed his underlying decency of instinct despite his disregard for the school rules and, more importantly, fully recongised that there had been no malintent on his part when he accidentally triggered the safeguards of the vaults, Dumbledore was very lenient with the boy. Even so, he still kept a close eye on him and had even gone to some lengths to help him, which included giving him private lessons to help him nurture his gift as a born <a href="/wiki/Legilimency" title="Legilimency">Legilimens</a>. He did not, however, condone their continued fixation with the Cursed Vaults; particularly in the case of Jacob himself, who eventually grew dangerously obsessive with opening all of the vaults. Having grown concerned that this fixation might even drive him <a href="/wiki/Insanity" title="Insanity">mad</a>, and finally unable to overlook their pursuit for the vaults for these reasons, he was known to have reprimanded both Jacob and Mr Ashe for their many indiscretions on at least one occasion.<sup id="cite_ref-HM519_67-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM519-67"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>67<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Despite his best efforts to help Jacob, however, and even though Dumbledore and the rest of the staff ultimately got the situation under control, their hunt for the vaults ended in tragedy when Duncan Ashe was killed while attempting to brew a particularly potent <a href="/wiki/Erumpent_Potion" title="Erumpent Potion">Erumpent Potion</a> in an effort to get past one of the obstacles standing between them and one of the Cursed Vaults. Neither the first, nor the last casualty at the school as a result of Jacob's extra-curricular activities, Olivia Green also endured hardships as a result.<sup id="cite_ref-HM57_68-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM57-68"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>68<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> With the death of a student on their hands as a direct result of their search for the vaults, Dumbledore notified the <a href="/wiki/British_Ministry_of_Magic" title="British Ministry of Magic">Ministry of Magic</a> about Duncan's untimely demise, at which point two <a href="/wiki/Auror" title="Auror">Aurors</a> were sent to bring Jacob in for questioning. Having found him at the <a href="/wiki/Three_Broomsticks_Inn" title="Three Broomsticks Inn">Three Broomsticks Inn</a>, they promptly "grabbed him by the hood of his robes and dragged him out the door".<sup id="cite_ref-HM33_69-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM33-69"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>69<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Having been informed of Jacob's subsequent confession that he had pressured his friend into making the potion as part of their bid for the vaults,<sup id="cite_ref-HM57_68-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM57-68"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>68<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Dumbledore had no other choice but to <a href="/wiki/Discipline_at_Hogwarts#Expulsion" title="Discipline at Hogwarts">expel</a> him from the school.<sup id="cite_ref-HM11_70-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM11-70"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>70<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> And even though Jacob's removal was prominently covered at the time in the <i><a href="/wiki/Daily_Prophet" title="Daily Prophet">Daily Prophet</a>,</i><sup id="cite_ref-HM26_71-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM26-71"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>71<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> the faculty still denied any knowledge that the vaults' existence, both to dissuade students from pursuing them, and to prevent the Ministry and concerned parents from inserting themselves into Hogwarts affairs.<sup id="cite_ref-IHLD_72-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-IHLD-72"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>72<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Discovering_The_Cabal">Discovering The Cabal</span></h4>
<p>Several months after Dumbledore was forced to terminate his enrolment, however, not only did word reach him that Jacob had ran away from home and, rumours had it, earned notoriety in the figurative underworld as the "most feared wizard in <a href="/wiki/Knockturn_Alley" title="Knockturn Alley">Knockturn Alley</a>";<sup id="cite_ref-HM57_68-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM57-68"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>68<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> which led to the misconception that he had even become a follower of <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-HM13_73-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM13-73"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>73<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> After a subsequent discussion with the late <a href="/wiki/Duncan_Ashe" title="Duncan Ashe">Duncan Ashe</a>, however, who had returned as a <a href="/wiki/Ghost" title="Ghost">ghost</a> following his unfortunate passing, not only was it established beyond any reasonable doubt that Jacob had never been <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eater</a> material, but more importantly, the Headmaster learned about the horrible truth behind the highly significant and mitigating circumstances surrounding Jacob's obsession with the vaults, as well as the part he had played in the events that had led up to his expulsion from the school in the first place.<sup id="cite_ref-HM57_68-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM57-68"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>68<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Throughout their attendance at Hogwarts, Jacob, Duncan and Olivia had all been on the receiving end of a series of threatening messages from a secret society of <a href="/wiki/Dark_wizard" title="Dark wizard">Dark witches and wizards</a> calling itself <a href="/wiki/R" title="R">The Cabal</a>, which had coerced them into becoming unwilling pawns in the group's bid for the Cursed Vaults by informing them that failure to cooperate would have meant their deaths.<sup id="cite_ref-HM57_68-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM57-68"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>68<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Their involvement had been a covert one indeed, as not only had all of this taken place right under the noses of Dumbledore and the rest of the faculty, but it had even been sulte enough that Jacob's search for the vaults had seemed, to the castle's other inhabitants, like nothing more the self-seeking exploit of a reckless youth.<sup id="cite_ref-HM16_74-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM16-74"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>74<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Only then was Dumbledore made aware that the true driving force behind Jacob's obsession with was his <a href="/wiki/Love" title="Love">love</a> for <a href="/wiki/Jacob%27s_family" title="Jacob's family">his family</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-HM57_68-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM57-68"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>68<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Even under duress, Jacob had actually gone to some lengths to try and protect the school, and defied the group by moving all of their research into the vaults from the <a href="/wiki/Boathouse" title="Boathouse">Boathouse</a> - where he and his accomplices had been holding secret meetings while they were still under R's heel<sup id="cite_ref-HM626_75-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM626-75"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>75<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> - to a <a href="/wiki/Jacob%27s_room" title="Jacob's room">new home</a> in order to hide it from them.<sup id="cite_ref-HM35_76-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM35-76"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>76<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In response to which The Cabal had raised the stakes and threatened to make his <a href="/wiki/Jacob%27s_mother" title="Jacob's mother">mother</a> and his <a href="/wiki/Jacob%27s_sibling" title="Jacob's sibling">younger sibling</a> "<a href="/wiki/Death" title="Death">disappear</a>" if he refused to cooperate. This effectively forced Jacob's compliance, and explained his urgency with which he pursued the Cursed Vaults in the later parts of his education. Jacob had even taken the blame for the very potion that it in truth had been The Cabal that had forced Duncan to make, as he feared that they would go after his family had he tried to expose them.<sup id="cite_ref-HM57_68-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM57-68"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>68<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Even though Dumbledore was fully prepared to take the mitigating circumstances of Jacob's transgressions into account going forward, any decision the Headmaster might have meant to make about revoking Jacob's expulsion or help to fight The Cabal ultimately became rather inappreciable when Jacob went mysteriously missing shortly thereafter.<sup id="cite_ref-HM11_70-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM11-70"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>70<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> With Jacob gone and unable to protect his kin, and given the possibility that The Cabal - whose members were still unknown and very much at large - might make good on their threats had he began to move against them prematurely, Dumbledore kept most of his findings to himself. As such, there were only three people who knew the full story once the dust had settled: <a href="/wiki/Jacob_(Hogwarts_expellee)" title="Jacob (Hogwarts expellee)">Jacob</a>, <a href="/wiki/Duncan_Ashe" title="Duncan Ashe">Duncan Ashe</a>, and the Headmaster himself.<sup id="cite_ref-HM57_68-7" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM57-68"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>68<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Certain that Hogwarts had not seen the last of The Cabal, however, he tasked his old friend, veteran <a href="/wiki/Auror" title="Auror">Auror</a> and brother-in-arms in the <a href="/wiki/Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Order of the Phoenix">Order of the Phoenix</a>, <a href="/wiki/Alastor_Moody" title="Alastor Moody">Alastor Moody</a>, with investigating The Cabal, who henceforth monitored their activities off-the-books.<sup id="cite_ref-BHR_77-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BHR-77"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>77<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-HM36_78-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM36-78"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>78<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-HM5OWL_79-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM5OWL-79"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>79<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span id="Between_the_wars_.281981.E2.80.931995.29"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="Between_the_wars_(1981–1995)">Between the wars <span class="template-c">(1981–1995)</span></span></h3>

<p>Still, the wizarding war raged beyond the walls of Hogwarts: Shortly before the Potters' deaths, Dumbledore discovered that James's <a href="/wiki/Cloak_of_Invisibility" title="Cloak of Invisibility">Cloak of Invisibility</a> was, in fact, one of the <a href="/wiki/Deathly_Hallows" title="Deathly Hallows">Deathly Hallows</a>. Although Dumbledore had long given up his desire to unite the Hallows and become Master of Death, he could not resist the thought of studying the Cloak. To that end, he borrowed it from James while James and Lily were in hiding. Later, Severus Snape approached Dumbledore, having already told Voldemort about the Prophecy. Snape was shocked by the fact that Voldemort had concluded that the prophecy was about <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a>, the son of <a href="/wiki/James_Potter_(I)" title="James Potter (I)">James Potter</a>, and Snape's own beloved childhood friend, Lily Evans. Dumbledore agreed, on the basis that Snape worked as a double agent for the Order. Dumbledore made arrangements to ensure the safety of the three; he advised them to stay hidden in their house in <a href="/wiki/Godric%27s_Hollow" title="Godric's Hollow">Godric's Hollow</a>, which was protected by a <a href="/wiki/Fidelius_Charm" title="Fidelius Charm">Fidelius Charm</a>. However, their <a href="/wiki/Secret_Keeper" title="Secret Keeper">Secret-Keeper</a> (believed by Dumbledore and everyone else to be <a href="/wiki/Sirius_Black" title="Sirius Black">Sirius Black</a>, but was in truth <a href="/wiki/Peter_Pettigrew" title="Peter Pettigrew">Peter Pettigrew</a>) betrayed them, resulting in James and Lily's deaths at Voldemort's hands. However, as Voldemort attempted to murder Harry the curse backfired due to the protection provided by Lily Potter's love for her son and destroyed his body. This unfortunate occurrence provided Dumbledore with ownership of two of the Hallows, having already confirmed James's old cloak was indeed the one of legend.
</p>

<p>Presumably well aware that Lord Voldemort wasn't truly vanquished, Dumbledore made sure that Harry would be kept safe with his family, the <a href="/wiki/Dursley_family" title="Dursley family">Dursleys</a>, despite them not being selected as his guardians in the event of James and Lily's death, as his spells ensured that Voldemort could not harm Harry there as long as he could have a home with those with whom he was related by blood. Specifically, while Lily's initial sacrifice saved Harry from Voldemort, in order for the charm to continue protecting him, his Aunt Petunia would have had to take Harry into her home to seal the charm. Dumbledore himself would later tell Harry that this was the strongest protection he could provide for Harry over the long term, and not even the most powerful complex protection spells could be guaranteed to work. Dumbledore, while noting the reason why Harry had to live with the Dursleys, also expressed regret that Harry was denied a more loving home. He convinced Snape to help him protect Harry, although years later Dumbledore secretly planned to allow Voldemort to kill Harry in the end, which would destroy the piece of Voldemort's <a href="/wiki/Soul" title="Soul">soul</a> inside Harry. However, he also hoped to influence Harry into such a person who would willingly sacrifice his life for the greater good, allowing him the chance to choose between life and death in the end, guessing correctly the significance of such an act. Shortly thereafter, Dumbledore gave Snape employment at Hogwarts as the <a href="/wiki/Potions_(class)" title="Potions (class)">Potions</a> master, and later defended Snape against the <a href="/wiki/British_Ministry_of_Magic" title="British Ministry of Magic">Ministry of Magic</a>, who were rounding up and arresting remaining Death Eaters. Dumbledore attended many <a href="/wiki/Council_of_Magical_Law" title="Council of Magical Law">Death Eater trials</a>, including that of the <a href="/wiki/Lestrange_family" title="Lestrange family">Lestranges</a> and <a href="/wiki/Bartemius_Crouch_Junior" title="Bartemius Crouch Junior">Barty Crouch Jnr</a>. He was also a witness to Igor Karkaroff's testimony which secured his release from Azkaban in return for the names of fellow Death Eaters. With Harry safe and <a href="/wiki/Arabella_Figg" title="Arabella Figg">certain</a> <a href="/wiki/Dedalus_Diggle" title="Dedalus Diggle">members</a> of the <a href="/wiki/Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Order of the Phoenix">Order of the Phoenix</a> and <a href="/wiki/Minerva_McGonagall" title="Minerva McGonagall">allies of their cause</a> keeping watch over him and reporting back to Dumbledore, he continued his work as the brilliant if eccentric Headmaster of his beloved school.
</p>
<h4><span id="1984.E2.80.931985"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="1984–1985">1984–1985</span></h4>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter: Hogwarts Mystery">"<i>Welcome! Welcome to another year at Hogwarts. The past few years have seen a great weight lifted from our world. The Boy Who Lived, Harry Potter, is safe. Years from now, young Harry Potter will be old enough to attend Hogwarts... But for now, it's your turn!</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— Professor Dumbledore at the 1984 Start-of-Term Feast<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter:_Hogwarts_Mystery" title="Harry Potter: Hogwarts Mystery">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
