<p>At the <a href="/wiki/Start-of-Term_Feast" title="Start-of-Term Feast">Start-of-Term Feast</a> during the <a href="/wiki/1984%E2%80%931985_school_year" title="1984–1985 school year">1984–1985 school year</a>, Professor Dumbledore witnessed the <a href="/wiki/Sorting_Ceremony" title="Sorting Ceremony">Sorting Ceremony</a> of <a href="/wiki/First_year" title="First year">first-year</a> students, including <a href="/wiki/Charles_Weasley" title="Charles Weasley">Charlie Weasley</a>, <a href="/wiki/Nymphadora_Tonks" title="Nymphadora Tonks">Nymphadora Tonks</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Jacob_(Hogwarts_expellee)" title="Jacob (Hogwarts expellee)">Jacob</a>'s <a href="/wiki/Jacob%27s_sibling" title="Jacob's sibling">younger sibling</a>, after which he stood behind the <a href="/wiki/Owl_Lecturn" title="Owl Lecturn">Owl Lecturn</a> and gave a traditional welcoming speech. In his speech, he mentioned how <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a> was safe and would himself attend Hogwarts when old enough, along with <a href="/wiki/House_points" title="House points">House points</a> and the yearly <a href="/wiki/House_Cup" title="House Cup">House Cup</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-HM12_66-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM12-66"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>66<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>At some point during the school year, Dumbledore was informed by <a href="/wiki/Professor" title="Professor">Professor</a> <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Severus Snape</a> about <a href="/wiki/Cursed_ice" title="Cursed ice">cursed ice</a> resurfacing in <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_Castle" title="Hogwarts Castle">Hogwarts Castle</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-HM16_74-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM16-74"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>74<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> and a <a href="/wiki/Locked_Room" title="Locked Room">Locked Room</a> which possibly contained the source of it.<sup id="cite_ref-HM19_80-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM19-80"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>80<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>After Jacob's sibling and <a href="/wiki/Merula_Snyde" title="Merula Snyde">Merula Snyde</a> duelled in the <a href="/wiki/Courtyard" title="Courtyard">Courtyard</a> without permission or supervision, Dumbledore introduced the students to the <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_Duelling_Club_(1980s)" title="Hogwarts Duelling Club (1980s)">Hogwarts Duelling Club</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Dungeons" title="Dungeons">Dungeons</a>, where duelling could be practised safely. He made certain to impress on the students how the destruction caused by these duels was left there so other students who wanted to duel could see how dangerous duelling could be, and consider the implications of casting unfriendly spells.<sup id="cite_ref-DC_81-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DC-81"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>81<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>

<p>Before this year's <a href="/wiki/Hallowe%27en_Feast" class="mw-redirect" title="Hallowe'en Feast">Hallowe'en Feast</a>, several students volunteered to help Dumbledore with decorations, such as the carving of jack-o'-lanterns and crafting hats for a <a href="/wiki/Troupe_of_dancing_skeletons" title="Troupe of dancing skeletons">troupe of dancing skeletons</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-HD_82-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HD-82"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>82<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Near the end of the feast, however, the school was under attack by a pack of <a href="/wiki/Werewolf" title="Werewolf">werewolves</a>, and after Dumbledore successfully removed five that had almost overran <a href="/wiki/Hagrid%27s_Hut" title="Hagrid's Hut">Hagrid's Hut</a>, he came back to the <a href="/wiki/Training_Grounds" title="Training Grounds">Training Grounds</a> in time to save Jacob's sibling and another unconscious student from three more, including <a href="/wiki/Fenrir_Greyback" title="Fenrir Greyback">Fenrir Greyback</a>, who caught the scent of Dumbledore and left. The Headmaster examined the unconscious student, who was <a href="/wiki/Chiara_Lobosca" title="Chiara Lobosca">Chiara Lobosca</a>, and concluded that she had not been bitten. He then informed the Ministry of Magic about the incident, and as a result, <a href="/wiki/Cecil_Lee" title="Cecil Lee">Cecil Lee</a> was sent to investigate.<sup id="cite_ref-HH_83-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HH-83"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>83<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>A month later, the castle was under another attack by Greyback's army, during which Chiara fought as a werewolf to protect Jacob's sibling. The Headmaster came to know this identity of Chiara, and extended her the same offer he had done <a href="/wiki/Remus_Lupin" title="Remus Lupin">Remus Lupin</a> years before. When this whole incident was over, Dumbledore held another Hallowe'en Feast to finish what had been left out.<sup id="cite_ref-HH_83-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HH-83"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>83<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-right show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 250px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/b/bb/Hagrid%27s_birthday.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180929211342" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Hagrid's birthday" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="95" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Hagrid's birthday.jpg" data-image-key="Hagrid%27s_birthday.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/b/bb/Hagrid%27s_birthday.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20180929211342" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/b/bb/Hagrid%27s_birthday.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180929211342" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Hagrid's birthday" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/b/bb/Hagrid%27s_birthday.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20180929211342" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="95" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Hagrid's birthday.jpg" data-image-key="Hagrid%27s_birthday.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/b/bb/Hagrid%27s_birthday.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20180929211342" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Hagrid%27s_birthday.jpg" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Dumbledore attending Hagrid's birthday celebration</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Before <a href="/wiki/Rubeus_Hagrid" title="Rubeus Hagrid">Rubeus Hagrid</a>'s birthday, Dumbledore decided to throw him a surprise birthday party. He first contacted Jacob's sibling, who was already a friend of Hagrid, and then went to find <a href="/wiki/Amos_Diggory" title="Amos Diggory">Amos Diggory</a>, who agreed to drop by the castle with a selection of magical creatures for them to pick from as a birthday gift. In order to distract Hagrid, Dumbledore asked him to meet at the Training Grounds and help take care of some "urgent business" in <a href="/wiki/Hogsmeade" title="Hogsmeade">Hogsmeade</a>, while Jacob's sibling stayed behind and babysat <a href="/wiki/Fang" title="Fang">Fang</a>. When they returned, Dumbledore instructed Jacob's sibling to invite Professor Snape next, even if they had to bribe him with a gift. The <a href="/wiki/Rubeus_Hagrid%27s_birthday_celebration" title="Rubeus Hagrid's birthday celebration">birthday party</a> was held as scheduled and turned out to be a huge success.<sup id="cite_ref-HM_Party_Planner_84-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM_Party_Planner-84"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>84<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Around Christmas, students continued to help Dumbledore with festive decorations. This tradition would be continued for the following few years.<sup id="cite_ref-85" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-85"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>85<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>When Dumbledore found out Jacob's sibling and their friends had broken into the Locked Room, he talked to Jacob's sibling in the Courtyard. Instead of handing out punishment, Dumbledore awarded them 100 <a href="/wiki/House_points" title="House points">House points</a> for their brave acts. Nevertheless, he reminded them that the impact on others should be kept in mind in their coming years.<sup id="cite_ref-HM19_80-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM19-80"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>80<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>At the end of the school year, Dumbledore announced the winner of the <a href="/wiki/House_Cup" title="House Cup">House Cup</a> as usual.<sup id="cite_ref-HM110_86-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM110-86"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>86<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span id="1985.E2.80.931986"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="1985–1986">1985–1986</span></h4>
<p>Dumbledore spent most of the <a href="/wiki/1985%E2%80%931986_school_year" title="1985–1986 school year">1985–1986 school year</a> outside Hogwarts, looking for a professional <a href="/wiki/Curse-Breaker" title="Curse-Breaker">Curse-Breaker</a>, <a href="/wiki/Patricia_Rakepick" title="Patricia Rakepick">Patricia Rakepick</a>, whose help he needed for finding the <a href="/wiki/Cursed_Vaults" title="Cursed Vaults">Cursed Vaults</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-HM29_87-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM29-87"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>87<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>He was present at the <a href="/wiki/Start-of-Term_Feast" title="Start-of-Term Feast">Start-of-Term Feast</a>, delivering his welcoming speech while also offering a word of caution. <a href="/wiki/Ben_Copper" title="Ben Copper">Ben Copper</a> was soon found missing, and Dumbledore was possibly paid a visit by <a href="/wiki/Minerva_McGonagall" title="Minerva McGonagall">Professor McGonagall</a>, who informed him the secret message Jacob's sibling had found in the <a href="/wiki/Locked_Room" title="Locked Room">Locked Room</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-HM21_88-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM21-88"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>88<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> After Dumbledore was gone, he possibly received an owl from one of the professors alerting him to the activities of <a href="/wiki/R" title="R">R</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-HM23_89-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM23-89"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>89<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>When he was back at Hogwarts, he found that the <a href="/wiki/Vault_of_Ice" title="Vault of Ice">Vault of Ice</a> had again been broken into by <a href="/wiki/Jacob%27s_sibling" title="Jacob's sibling">Jacob's sibling</a> and their friends, which led to the disappearance of the <a href="/wiki/Cursed_ice" title="Cursed ice">cursed ice</a>. He required to see them in the <a href="/wiki/Headmaster%27s_office" title="Headmaster's office">Headmaster's office</a> and rewarded them another 50 points, but warned them never to go near the Cursed Vaults again.<sup id="cite_ref-HM210_90-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM210-90"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>90<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>At some point while he was at Hogwarts, the Headmaster presided over this year's <a href="/wiki/Teacher_Appreciation_Celebration" title="Teacher Appreciation Celebration">Teacher Appreciation Celebration</a>, with the <a href="/wiki/Guest_of_Honour" title="Guest of Honour">Guest of Honour</a> being McGonagall.<sup id="cite_ref-ASCHT_91-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ASCHT-91"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>91<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> At another point, Dumbledore arranged for <a href="/wiki/Olympe_Maxime" title="Olympe Maxime">Olympe Maxime</a>, the Headmistress of <a href="/wiki/Beauxbatons_Academy_of_Magic" title="Beauxbatons Academy of Magic">Beauxbatons Academy of Magic</a>, to visit Hogwarts to discuss school matters, and Maxime brought <a href="/wiki/Aur%C3%A9lie_Dumont" title="Aurélie Dumont">Aurélie Dumont</a>, a student of her who came to search for <a href="/wiki/Nicolas_Flamel%27s_chalice" title="Nicolas Flamel's chalice">Nicolas Flamel's chalice</a>. When Dumbledore met Aurélie, he talked about his own experience of learning <a href="/wiki/Alchemy" title="Alchemy">Alchemy</a> with <a href="/wiki/Nicolas_Flamel" title="Nicolas Flamel">Nicolas Flamel</a> and denied the existence of such item at Hogwarts, but nevertheless encouraged her not to give up on her goals.<sup id="cite_ref-HM_Beauxbatons_33-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM_Beauxbatons-33"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>33<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span id="1986.E2.80.931987"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="1986–1987">1986–1987</span></h4>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 250px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/1b/DumbledoreHMY3.png/revision/latest?cb=20200409044257" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="DumbledoreHMY3" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="92" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="DumbledoreHMY3.png" data-image-key="DumbledoreHMY3.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/1b/DumbledoreHMY3.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20200409044257" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/1b/DumbledoreHMY3.png/revision/latest?cb=20200409044257" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="DumbledoreHMY3" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/1b/DumbledoreHMY3.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20200409044257" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="92" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="DumbledoreHMY3.png" data-image-key="DumbledoreHMY3.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/1b/DumbledoreHMY3.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20200409044257" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:DumbledoreHMY3.png" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Dumbledore greeting the students</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Before the <a href="/wiki/Start-of-Term_Feast" title="Start-of-Term Feast">Start-of-Term Feast</a> of the <a href="/wiki/1986%E2%80%931987_school_year" title="1986–1987 school year">1986–1987 school year</a>, Professor Dumbledore spoke to the students, confirming the existence of the <a href="/wiki/Cursed_Vaults" title="Cursed Vaults">Cursed Vaults</a> and imposing a blanket ban on all future attempts to look for the rest of them.<sup id="cite_ref-HM31_92-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM31-92"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>92<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> It was most likely also Dumbledore who instructed <a href="/wiki/Jacob%27s_sibling" title="Jacob's sibling">Jacob's sibling</a>'s <a href="/wiki/Head_of_House" title="Head of House">Head of House</a> to not permit them to go on <a href="/wiki/Hogsmeade" title="Hogsmeade">Hogsmeade</a> trips due to them breaking school rules and not focusing on their studies.<sup id="cite_ref-HM32_93-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM32-93"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>93<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>During a <a href="/wiki/Third_year" title="Third year">third-year</a> <a href="/wiki/Herbology" title="Herbology">Herbology</a> class, a <a href="/wiki/Boggart" title="Boggart">Boggart</a> manifested in one of the <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_greenhouses" title="Hogwarts greenhouses">greenhouses</a>, assuming the form of a <a href="/wiki/Werewolf" title="Werewolf">werewolf</a> and terrifying students. <a href="/wiki/Professor" title="Professor">Professor</a> <a href="/wiki/Pomona_Sprout" title="Pomona Sprout">Pomona Sprout</a> reported the incident to Dumbledore immediately after taking care of the Boggart.<sup id="cite_ref-HM31_92-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM31-92"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>92<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-right show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 250px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/2/2c/Dumbledore_and_Snape_evaluating_potion_HM.jpeg/revision/latest?cb=20200601003513" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Dumbledore and Snape evaluating potion HM" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="141" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Dumbledore and Snape evaluating potion HM.jpeg" data-image-key="Dumbledore_and_Snape_evaluating_potion_HM.jpeg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/2/2c/Dumbledore_and_Snape_evaluating_potion_HM.jpeg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20200601003513" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/2/2c/Dumbledore_and_Snape_evaluating_potion_HM.jpeg/revision/latest?cb=20200601003513" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Dumbledore and Snape evaluating potion HM" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/2/2c/Dumbledore_and_Snape_evaluating_potion_HM.jpeg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20200601003513" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="141" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Dumbledore and Snape evaluating potion HM.jpeg" data-image-key="Dumbledore_and_Snape_evaluating_potion_HM.jpeg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/2/2c/Dumbledore_and_Snape_evaluating_potion_HM.jpeg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20200601003513" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Dumbledore_and_Snape_evaluating_potion_HM.jpeg" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Dumbledore and Snape evaluating Merula Snyde's Wit-Sharpening Potion</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>At some point during the school year, Dumbledore was approached by <a href="/wiki/Merula_Snyde" title="Merula Snyde">Merula Snyde</a>, who showed him the <a href="/wiki/Wit-Sharpening_Potion" title="Wit-Sharpening Potion">Wit-Sharpening Potion</a> she had allegedly been working on. He also spoke to Jacob's sibling, who was disguised as <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Professor Snape</a>, about various businesses. During the conversation, he even indirectly revealed the <a href="/wiki/Patricia_Rakepick" title="Patricia Rakepick">identity</a> of the <a href="/wiki/Curse-Breaker" title="Curse-Breaker">Curse-Breaker</a> he had been finding in the past year, who had some school years overlapping with Snape's. Though he wasn't aware of who he was actually talking to, he still figured something was off. When "Professor Snape" asked Merula to come forward and admit her wrongdoing of claiming credit for the potion actually brewed by <a href="/wiki/Penny_Haywood" title="Penny Haywood">Penny Haywood</a>, Dumbledore invited Penny up on the podium to receive the credit she deserved. It was also at this moment that he realised the true identity of "Snape". He awarded them 10 <a href="/wiki/House_points" title="House points">House points</a> for their loyalty and cheerfully advised them to leave before the effects of the <a href="/wiki/Polyjuice_Potion" title="Polyjuice Potion">Polyjuice Potion</a> wore off.<sup id="cite_ref-HM_Polyjuice_Potion_94-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM_Polyjuice_Potion-94"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>94<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Before Dumbledore left Hogwarts again to search for <a href="/wiki/Patricia_Rakepick" title="Patricia Rakepick">Rakepick</a>, he gave <a href="/wiki/Rita_Skeeter" title="Rita Skeeter">Rita Skeeter</a> "periodical permission" to visit <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_Castle" title="Hogwarts Castle">Hogwarts Castle</a> to observe the students, and to invite them to partake in a "friendly competition" where the winner would receive a first-page article in the <i><a href="/wiki/Daily_Prophet" title="Daily Prophet">Daily Prophet</a></i>.<sup id="cite_ref-95" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-95"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>95<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> During this search, Dumbledore was finally able to track down Rakepick, who was investigating some ancient ruins that had recently been discovered beneath <a href="/wiki/Castelobruxo" title="Castelobruxo">Castelobruxo</a>. Unable to leave <a href="/wiki/Brazil" title="Brazil">Brazil</a> until her work there was finished, an arrangement was made where she would instead come to Hogwarts at the beginning of the next term. Dumbledore doubted whether the elusiveness of Rakepick indicated problems regarding her trustworthiness, but eventually chose to give her the benefit of the doubt due to the lack of real evidence.<sup id="cite_ref-HM310_96-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM310-96"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>96<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 250px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/e/e4/DumbledoreHM.png/revision/latest?cb=20200401230617" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="DumbledoreHM" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="141" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="DumbledoreHM.png" data-image-key="DumbledoreHM.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/e/e4/DumbledoreHM.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20200401230617" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/e/e4/DumbledoreHM.png/revision/latest?cb=20200401230617" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="DumbledoreHM" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/e/e4/DumbledoreHM.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20200401230617" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="141" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="DumbledoreHM.png" data-image-key="DumbledoreHM.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/e/e4/DumbledoreHM.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20200401230617" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:DumbledoreHM.png" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Dumbledore back at Hogwarts</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>When Dumbledore was back, he paid Jacob's sibling and their friends a visit in the <a href="/wiki/Three_Broomsticks_Inn" title="Three Broomsticks Inn">Three Broomsticks Inn</a>, where they were celebrating their success regarding the <a href="/wiki/Break-in_of_the_Vault_of_Fear" title="Break-in of the Vault of Fear">break-in</a> of the <a href="/wiki/Vault_of_Fear" title="Vault of Fear">Vault of Fear</a>. Back at <a href="/wiki/Headmaster%27s_office" title="Headmaster's office">his office</a>, Dumbledore listened to Jacob's sibling's vault-breaking story and talked about his own adventure. Despite them breaking the rules again, Dumbledore still awarded Jacob's sibling 100 House points, but warned them never to do it again.<sup id="cite_ref-HM310_96-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM310-96"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>96<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>At some point during the school year, the <a href="/wiki/International_Confederation_of_Wizards" title="International Confederation of Wizards">International Confederation of Wizards</a> was due to convene for a conference somewhere in <a href="/wiki/Great_Britain" title="Great Britain">Great Britain</a>, for which <a href="/wiki/Rubeus_Hagrid" title="Rubeus Hagrid">Rubeus Hagrid</a> was invited to give a demonstration on <a href="/wiki/Thestral" title="Thestral">Thestrals</a> to clear up misconceptions involving them, specifically by showing that even a Thestral that had had limited exposure to strangers could be comfortable working with several of them. To help him prepare his speech, the Headmaster advised him to solicit the assistance of Jacob's sibling and Merula Snyde, hoping that working with Thestrals could help Merula, who had seen <a href="/wiki/Merula_Snyde%27s_mother" title="Merula Snyde's mother">her mother</a> murdering an <a href="/wiki/Auror" title="Auror">Auror</a> thus enabling her to see Thestrals, confront her past and move on. Once he had given Hagrid adequate time to get ready and time came for them to depart for the meeting, Dumbledore went to the <a href="/wiki/Training_Grounds" title="Training Grounds">Training Grounds</a> to collect him, and was delighted to find that both his attempt to help the troubled pupil and the aforementioned assembly had been an immense success, the latter of which had inspired many in the crowd to start treating the "dark horses" with kindness and respect.<sup id="cite_ref-HM_Dark_Horses_97-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM_Dark_Horses-97"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>97<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span id="1987.E2.80.931988"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="1987–1988">1987–1988</span></h4>
<p>At the start of the <a href="/wiki/1987%E2%80%931988_school_year" title="1987–1988 school year">1987–1988 school year</a>, Professor Dumbledore introduced Madam <a href="/wiki/Patricia_Rakepick" title="Patricia Rakepick">Patricia Rakepick</a> to the entire school, charging her with everything related to the <a href="/wiki/Cursed_Vaults" title="Cursed Vaults">Cursed Vaults</a> and making her an official non-teaching staff member capable of docking <a href="/wiki/House_points" title="House points">House points</a>. Soon, it was found that <a href="/wiki/Tulip_Karasu" title="Tulip Karasu">Tulip Karasu</a> and a couple of other students were inflicted with a <a href="/wiki/Sleepwalking_curse" title="Sleepwalking curse">sleepwalking curse</a>, which was inevitably caused by someone tampering with <a href="/wiki/Forest_Vault" title="Forest Vault">another Cursed Vault</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-HM41_98-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM41-98"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>98<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 250px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/4/46/CelestialBall2.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20191130224620" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="CelestialBall2" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="121" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="CelestialBall2.jpg" data-image-key="CelestialBall2.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/4/46/CelestialBall2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20191130224620" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/4/46/CelestialBall2.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20191130224620" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="CelestialBall2" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/4/46/CelestialBall2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20191130224620" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="121" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="CelestialBall2.jpg" data-image-key="CelestialBall2.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/4/46/CelestialBall2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20191130224620" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:CelestialBall2.jpg" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">The faculty chaperoning the Celestial Ball</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Despite the difficulty the school was experiencing, Dumbledore and the rest of the faculty decided it needed distraction and some happy memory, so they arranged an <a href="/wiki/Astronomy" title="Astronomy">Astronomy</a>-themed social gathering for the students in the <a href="/wiki/Great_Hall" title="Great Hall">Great Hall</a> known as the <a href="/wiki/Celestial_Ball" title="Celestial Ball">Celestial Ball</a>. Dumbledore was able to persuade <a href="/wiki/Irma_Pince" title="Irma Pince">Madam Pince</a> to allow the election for the head of a <a href="/wiki/Celestial_Ball_decorating_committee" title="Celestial Ball decorating committee">student committee</a> that would be in charge of the decorations to take place in the <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_Library" title="Hogwarts Library">Library</a>. He then summoned the students to the Great Hall and announced the event, encouraging students to partake in the election for the decorating committee. Dumbledore attended the Celestial Ball with other faculty members, at the start of which he gave a short speech commending the decorating committee's success.<sup id="cite_ref-HM4CB_99-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM4CB-99"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>99<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>After <a href="/wiki/Jacob%27s_sibling" title="Jacob's sibling">Jacob's sibling</a> and their friends got out of the <a href="/wiki/Forest_Vault" title="Forest Vault">Forest Vault</a> which they had successfully broken into, Dumbledore and <a href="/wiki/Argus_Filch" title="Argus Filch">Filch</a> greeted them in the <a href="/wiki/Forbidden_Forest" title="Forbidden Forest">Forbidden Forest</a>. Dumbledore told Jacob's sibling they continued to exhibit little respect for Hogwarts's rules and himself, and gave them detention in the <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_kitchens" title="Hogwarts kitchens">Kitchens</a> under <a href="/wiki/Pitts" title="Pitts">Pitts</a>'s supervision for the <a href="/wiki/1988%E2%80%931989_school_year" title="1988–1989 school year">next school year</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-HM416_100-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM416-100"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>100<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span id="1988.E2.80.931989"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="1988–1989">1988–1989</span></h4>

<p>Dumbledore's decision to appoint Rakepick proved a costly one as Rakepick turned out to be one of R's members and nearly managed to kill Jacob's sibling and their friends before being defeated by a Garroting Gas and forced to flee but left Merula Snyde traumatised with the betrayal and use of the Cruciatus Curse when they went to the Cursed Vault. Dumbledore was away at the time and unable to stop it and was left responsible with what had happened, admitting regret for being outside to deal with threats and promising to prioritise capturing Rakepick.
</p>

<p>The next year was by no means any less troublesome than the previous year, with Jacob's sibling and their friends more determined than ever to stop R and find the last Cursed Vault, despite Dumbledore's attempts to make them focus on their studies. He was even more disturbed with how Ben Cooper and Merula Snyde had become different due to the events of last year and that an Azkaban escapee who turned out to be an expelled student of Mahoutokoro School of Magic was working with R. When Rowan Khanna was killed by Rakepick, Dumbledore led a huge memorial to their noble sacrifice.
</p>
<h4><span id="1990.E2.80.931991"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="1990–1991">1990–1991</span></h4>
<p>In this school year, Dumbledore sent several <a href="/wiki/Seventh_year" title="Seventh year">seventh-year</a> students to the <a href="/wiki/British_Ministry_of_Magic" title="British Ministry of Magic">British Ministry of Magic</a> as a part of a <a href="/wiki/Ministry_of_Magic_student_programme" class="mw-redirect" title="Ministry of Magic student programme">student programme</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-HM75_101-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM75-101"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>101<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-HM76_102-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HM76-102"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>102<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span id="1991.E2.80.931992"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="1991–1992">1991–1992</span></h4>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone"><b>Harry Potter</b>: "<i>But why couldn't Quirrell touch me?</i>"</span></dd>
<dd><b>Albus Dumbledore</b>: "<i>Your mother died to save you. If there is one thing Voldemort cannot understand, it is love. He didn't realise that love as powerful as your mother's for you leaves its own mark. Not a scar, no visible sign... to have been loved so deeply, even though the person who loved us is gone, will give us some protection forever. It is in your very skin. Quirrell, full of hatred, greed, and ambition, sharing his soul with Voldemort, could not touch you for this reason. It was agony to touch a person marked by something so good.</i>"</dd>
<dd>— Dumbledore and <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry</a> discussing the power of <a href="/wiki/Love" title="Love">love</a><sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Philosopher%27s_Stone" title="Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone">[src]</a></sup></dd></dl>
</div>
<p>Ten years after Dumbledore left Harry Potter with his uncle and aunt, the <a href="/wiki/Dursley_family" title="Dursley family">Dursleys</a>, Harry started attending <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts</a>, not as emotionally healthy as Dumbledore might have hoped, considering the neglect he had faced at the hands of his intolerant aunt and uncle, but alive and well, and happy to be away from his horrible relatives. That year, <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a> formulated a plan to regain human form. Dumbledore and his friend <a href="/wiki/Nicolas_Flamel" title="Nicolas Flamel">Nicolas Flamel</a> (the only known maker of the <a href="/wiki/Philosopher%27s_Stone" title="Philosopher's Stone">Philosopher's Stone</a>) began to suspect that the disembodied Dark Lord was plotting to steal the invaluable object, which would be capable of restoring him to full power. Dumbledore had the stone moved to a medium security vault at <a href="/wiki/Gringotts_Wizarding_Bank" title="Gringotts Wizarding Bank">Gringotts Wizarding Bank</a>, but later had it moved to Hogwarts itself; coincidentally, on the same day that an attempted break-in was made upon the vault. It was retrieved by Hagrid, who was also taking Harry to buy his school supplies.
</p>

<p>Dumbledore and several teachers (<a href="/wiki/Minerva_McGonagall" title="Minerva McGonagall">McGonagall</a>, <a href="/wiki/Filius_Flitwick" title="Filius Flitwick">Flitwick</a>, <a href="/wiki/Pomona_Sprout" title="Pomona Sprout">Sprout</a>, <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Snape</a> and, dubiously, <a href="/wiki/Quirinus_Quirrell" title="Quirinus Quirrell">Quirrell</a>) at Hogwarts planted magical security methods to protect the stone. Dumbledore was behind the final, and most powerful protection placed upon the stone. He enchanted the <a href="/wiki/Mirror_of_Erised" title="Mirror of Erised">Mirror of Erised</a> to contain the Philosopher's Stone, only to be removed by someone who did not intend to use or possess it, but only to keep it from the hands of evil. Dumbledore suspected that the <a href="/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts" title="Defence Against the Dark Arts">Defence Against the Dark Arts</a> Professor Quirinus Quirrell was behind the plot to steal the Philosopher's Stone, while working for the weakened Lord Voldemort, and as such he asked Snape to keep an eye on him. He also anonymously returned James's <a href="/wiki/Cloak_of_Invisibility" title="Cloak of Invisibility">Cloak of Invisibility</a> to Harry as a Christmas present.<sup id="cite_ref-PS_8-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PS-8"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>8<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>

<p>Over a series of nights, Harry Potter proceeded to visit the <a href="/wiki/Mirror_of_Erised" title="Mirror of Erised">Mirror of Erised</a> as often as he could to see <a href="/wiki/James_and_Lily_Potter" class="mw-disambig" title="James and Lily Potter">his parents</a>' faces. Dumbledore found Harry visiting the mirror one night, and after explaining to Harry what the mirror was all about, told him that the mirror was to be <a href="/wiki/Underground_Chambers" title="Underground Chambers">moved</a> and requested that Harry not go looking for it. Before heading back to bed, Harry asked Dumbledore what he saw when he looked into the mirror. Dumbledore claimed to see himself holding a pair of thick, woollen socks, telling Harry that "<i>one can never have enough socks.</i>"<sup id="cite_ref-PS_8-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PS-8"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>8<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> However, Dumbledore was joking — the matter being a very personal one. At first, still yearning for Grindelwald's love, Albus saw himself with his former lover in the Mirror. However, after Grindelwald's defeat and having come to terms with his past guilt over his sister's death, later in his life Dumbledore would see <a href="/wiki/Dumbledore_family" title="Dumbledore family">his family</a> whole and intact, free of any pain or suffering.<sup id="cite_ref-DH_28-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH-28"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>28<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> It is unknown if Grindelwald, as a redeemed man, was included in these later reflections.
</p><p>When Quirrell decided to make his move on getting the Philosopher's Stone, he lured Dumbledore away from the school using a false letter from the Ministry for Magic. The moment Dumbledore was on his way, he was intercepted by an owl from Ron and Hermione, which carried a letter that explained the whole situation. Dumbledore hurried back to the <a href="/wiki/Underground_Chambers" title="Underground Chambers">Underground Chambers</a> and saved an unconscious Harry from Quirrell.
</p>

<p>In the end it was Harry who <a href="/wiki/Skirmish_in_the_Underground_Chambers" title="Skirmish in the Underground Chambers">protected</a> the Philosopher's Stone from Quirrell and Voldemort. Voldemort failed for the same reasons he had failed to murder Harry previously: due to <a href="/wiki/Lily_Potter_(I)" title="Lily Potter (I)">Lily Potter</a>'s love for Harry. When Voldemort, who had possessed the body of Quirrell, ordered his servant to attack the young boy, the <a href="/wiki/Sacrificial_protection" title="Sacrificial protection">sacrificial protection</a> instilled within him at the point of his mother's death killed him and forced the Dark Lord's spirit to flee. When Harry recovered from the ordeal in the hospital wing, he questioned Dumbledore about why Voldemort had tried to murder him as a baby.<sup id="cite_ref-PS_8-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PS-8"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>8<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Dumbledore did not believe that Harry was ready to know the truth about the <a href="/wiki/Sybill_Trelawney%27s_first_prophecy" class="mw-redirect" title="Sybill Trelawney's first prophecy">Prophecy</a> <a href="/wiki/Sybill_Trelawney" title="Sybill Trelawney">Sybill Trelawney</a> had made and told him he would know when he was older (although this would actually later turn out to be a mistake).<sup id="cite_ref-OOTP_64-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OOTP-64"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>64<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>At the end-of-year feast, Dumbledore awarded an extra 170 house points to <a href="/wiki/Gryffindor" title="Gryffindor">Gryffindor</a> students, Harry Potter (60), Ron Weasley (50), Hermione Granger (50) and <a href="/wiki/Neville_Longbottom" title="Neville Longbottom">Neville Longbottom</a> (10), respectively for bravery and logical skills, prompting Gryffindor to win the <a href="/wiki/House_Cup" title="House Cup">House Cup</a>, ruining Slytherin's chance of the cup for the seventh year in a row. This may have shown an amount of bias towards Gryffindor to announce their win in such unusual circumstances.<sup id="cite_ref-PS_8-7" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PS-8"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>8<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Sometime before the next year began, Dumbledore, having never been fooled by <a href="/wiki/Gilderoy_Lockhart" title="Gilderoy Lockhart">Gilderoy Lockhart</a>'s tall tales, figured out the truth soon when Lockhart erased the memories of two wizards that Dumbledore personally knew. He realised that Lockhart had gone too far in his desire for fame and decided to track him down and make him pay for his crimes. Having the position of the <a href="/wiki/Professor" title="Professor">Professor</a> of the <a href="/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts" title="Defence Against the Dark Arts">Defence Against the Dark Arts</a> vacant proved to be useful for Dumbledore, as he offered Lockhart the job and although Lockhart was reluctant as his career as an author was progressing very well, successfully convinced him by slyly hinting that <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a> was a second-year student in <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts</a>, causing Lockhart to accept.<sup id="cite_ref-lockhart_103-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-lockhart-103"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>103<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Having intended for Lockhart to show his ineptitude and fraudulence to the students and thus expose him to the public secretly, Dumbledore's decision was shocking to take by the other staff members as they never forgot Lockhart as the obnoxious attention seeker back then despite his achievements, with <a href="/wiki/Minerva_McGonagall" title="Minerva McGonagall">McGonagall</a> asking what the students could possibly learn under a man as vain and celebrity-hungry as Lockhart. Dumbledore, however, skilfully talked himself out by pointing out that Lockhart was the only one who was willing to take it and also saying that there was a lot to learn from even a bad teacher: what not to do, how not to be.<sup id="cite_ref-lockhart_103-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-lockhart-103"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>103<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span id="1992.E2.80.931993"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="1992–1993">1992–1993</span></h4>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets">"<i>It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— Dumbledore's advice to Harry Potter<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Chamber_of_Secrets" title="Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>

<p>Shortly into the school year of 1992, students again fell under attack from a beast allegedly released from the <a href="/wiki/Chamber_of_Secrets" title="Chamber of Secrets">Chamber of Secrets</a>. Under the influence of <a href="/wiki/Lucius_Malfoy" title="Lucius Malfoy">Lucius Malfoy</a>, the Hogwarts board of governors voted to remove Dumbledore from his position as Headmaster when he proved unable to uncover the culprit; <a href="/wiki/Minister_for_Magic" title="Minister for Magic">Minister for Magic</a> <a href="/wiki/Cornelius_Fudge" title="Cornelius Fudge">Cornelius Fudge</a> also had the groundskeeper <a href="/wiki/Rubeus_Hagrid" title="Rubeus Hagrid">Rubeus Hagrid</a> taken to Azkaban, acting under the theory that it had been he who opened the Chamber in 1943.<sup id="cite_ref-COS_49-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COS-49"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>49<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>It was later revealed that first year student, <a href="/wiki/Ginevra_Weasley" title="Ginevra Weasley">Ginny Weasley</a>, had come into possession of <a href="/wiki/T._M._Riddle%27s_Diary" title="T. M. Riddle's Diary">Tom Riddle's Diary</a>, a bewitched object capable of interacting with whoever wrote in it. The diary slowly drained the life force from Ginny, and when the memory it contained was nearly strong enough to take physical form, it had her journey into the heart of the Chamber. However, <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a> was able to <a href="/wiki/Skirmish_in_the_Chamber_of_Secrets" title="Skirmish in the Chamber of Secrets">find the Chamber</a> himself, and there, defeated the beast that dwelt within; <a href="/wiki/Salazar_Slytherin" title="Salazar Slytherin">Salazar Slytherin</a>'s basilisk. He also destroyed the diary with one of the basilisk's fangs, saving Ginny and defeating the nearly fully formed memory of Riddle. Harry was only able to achieve these feats by displaying an extreme amount of loyalty to Dumbledore; for only someone truly loyal to the Headmaster would be capable of summoning his pet <a href="/wiki/Phoenix" title="Phoenix">phoenix</a> <a href="/wiki/Fawkes" title="Fawkes">Fawkes</a>, who provided the tools needed for Potter to defeat Riddle and the basilisk.<sup id="cite_ref-COS_49-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COS-49"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>49<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>

<p>Dumbledore mysteriously returned to his position as <a href="/wiki/Headteacher" title="Headteacher">Headmaster</a> after the memory of Riddle was revealed as being behind the attacks. He commended both Harry and Ron for solving the mystery with the <a href="/wiki/Special_Award_for_Services_to_the_School" title="Special Award for Services to the School">Special Award for Services to the School</a> and two hundred points each for them. This secured Gryffindor for the House Cup for the second year running and again ruined Slytherin's chances, fuelling the hatred and rivalry between the two houses. He also secured Hagrid's release from <a href="/wiki/Azkaban" title="Azkaban">Azkaban</a> by having Ron deliver his release papers via owl and cancelled exams as a special treat, much to the delight of the students and the dismay of Hermione Granger. <a href="/wiki/Lucius_Malfoy" title="Lucius Malfoy">Lucius Malfoy</a> was also sacked from his position as a governor of Hogwarts, much to Draco's dismay and Harry's satisfaction.<sup id="cite_ref-COS_49-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COS-49"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>49<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 250px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/f/f8/Dumbledore_diary.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20161012000239" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Dumbledore diary" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="104" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Dumbledore diary.jpg" data-image-key="Dumbledore_diary.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/f/f8/Dumbledore_diary.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20161012000239" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/f/f8/Dumbledore_diary.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20161012000239" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Dumbledore diary" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/f/f8/Dumbledore_diary.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20161012000239" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="104" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Dumbledore diary.jpg" data-image-key="Dumbledore_diary.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/f/f8/Dumbledore_diary.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20161012000239" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Dumbledore_diary.jpg" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Dumbledore contemplating Tom Riddle's diary</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>However, Dumbledore was privately concerned by the phenomena that Harry described; a mere memory capable of taking physical form was unheard of. Dumbledore then began to suspect that Riddle's diary was in fact a <a href="/wiki/Horcrux" title="Horcrux">Horcrux</a>, and furthermore, considering the lack of care the Dark Lord had taken in protecting the diary, that he had created more than one.<sup id="cite_ref-COS_49-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COS-49"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>49<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>During his final talk with Harry in his office, Dumbledore came close to telling Harry about his connection with Voldemort but refrained from doing so as he felt that twelve years old was still too young to learn the truth and he wanted Harry to enjoy this night of triumph.<sup id="cite_ref-OOTP_64-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OOTP-64"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>64<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span id="1993.E2.80.931994"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="1993–1994">1993–1994</span></h4>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban">"<i>Now, pay attention. Sirius is locked in Professor Flitwick's office on the seventh floor. Thirteenth window from the right of the West Tower. If all goes well, you will be able to save more than one innocent life tonight. But remember this, both of you: you must not be seen. Miss Granger, you know the law — you know what is at stake... I am going to lock you in. It is — five minutes to midnight. Miss Granger, three turns should do it. Good luck.</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— Dumbledore giving instructions to save Sirius<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban" title="Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<p>The year after, the <a href="/wiki/British_Ministry_of_Magic" title="British Ministry of Magic">Ministry of Magic</a> took it upon itself to increase security around <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts</a>. Sirius Black, who had been sentenced to life in <a href="/wiki/Azkaban" title="Azkaban">Azkaban</a> for murdering <a href="/wiki/Peter_Pettigrew" title="Peter Pettigrew">Peter Pettigrew</a> and twelve <a href="/wiki/Non-magic_people" title="Non-magic people">Muggles</a> with a single curse, had escaped from the wizarding prison. The Ministry, afraid that he was going after <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a>, placed a large number of <a href="/wiki/Dementor" title="Dementor">Dementors</a> at Hogwarts to try to recapture him. Dumbledore reluctantly tolerated the Dementors on school grounds but refused to allow them within the school itself.<sup id="cite_ref-POA_57-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-POA-57"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>57<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>However, the Dementors violated Dumbledore's decree when they entered the <a href="/wiki/Quidditch" title="Quidditch">Quidditch</a> match between <a href="/wiki/Gryffindor" title="Gryffindor">Gryffindor</a> and <a href="/wiki/Hufflepuff" title="Hufflepuff">Hufflepuff</a>, causing Harry to fall unconscious and fall from the sky. Dumbledore was able to prevent Harry from hitting the ground and repelled the Dementors with a <a href="/wiki/Patronus_Charm#The_Patronus" title="Patronus Charm">Patronus</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-POA_57-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-POA-57"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>57<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>

<p>As the school year drew to its close, it became clear to Harry and his friends that <a href="/wiki/Sirius_Black" title="Sirius Black">Sirius Black</a> had been framed for his crimes, committed by Pettigrew, who has been disguised as Scabbers for twelve years. But Sirius was captured, locked in the highest tower, and sentenced to the <a href="/wiki/Dementor%27s_Kiss" title="Dementor's Kiss">Dementor's Kiss</a>. Dumbledore instantly believed Harry and his friends about Sirius's innocence, but the Minister did not. Dumbledore was incapable of over-ruling the Ministry's decision despite him being <a href="/wiki/Chief_Warlock" title="Chief Warlock">Chief Warlock</a> of the <a href="/wiki/Wizengamot" title="Wizengamot">Wizengamot</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-POA_57-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-POA-57"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>57<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Instead, Dumbledore told <a href="/wiki/Hermione_Granger" title="Hermione Granger">Hermione Granger</a> to use her <a href="/wiki/Time-Turner" title="Time-Turner">Time-Turner</a> to save Sirius and in the process Buckbeak as well. Harry and Hermione's rescue mission was a success, Sirius escaped on <a href="/wiki/Buckbeak" title="Buckbeak">Buckbeak</a>. The Dementors were removed from the grounds for their attack on Harry and the attempted removal of his soul. During the rescue Harry also conjured a powerful corporeal <a href="/wiki/Patronus_Charm" title="Patronus Charm">Patronus</a>, that Dumbledore later commented on.<sup id="cite_ref-POA_57-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-POA-57"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>57<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>

<p>Dumbledore saw Remus Lupin (the new <a href="/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts" title="Defence Against the Dark Arts">Defence Against the Dark Arts</a> teacher) off after Snape leaked his identity as a werewolf to the school. Harry was also seeing Lupin off too and Dumbledore could tell that Harry was troubled. Harry explained how guilty he felt allowing Pettigrew, the real culprit who had framed Sirius, to escape, which coincides with a prediction <a href="/wiki/Trelawney_family" title="Trelawney family">Trelawney</a> made. Therefore, he feared that he may have indirectly given Voldemort a servant to return him to power. Dumbledore assured Harry that he did a noble thing in saving Pettigrew's life, forging a deep, magical bond between them, and he promised Harry that one day he'd be glad he spared Pettigrew.<sup id="cite_ref-POA_57-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-POA-57"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>57<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>At the end of the year Dumbledore began to feel uneasy about concealing the truth of <a href="/wiki/Sybill_Trelawney%27s_first_prophecy" class="mw-redirect" title="Sybill Trelawney's first prophecy">Sybill Trelawney's prophecy</a> because even though Harry was still young, he had proven himself to be exceptional, and he would have to be told soon.<sup id="cite_ref-OOTP_64-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OOTP-64"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>64<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span id="1994.E2.80.931995"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="1994–1995">1994–1995</span></h4>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire">"<i>It is my belief — and never have I so hoped that I am mistaken — that we are all facing dark and difficult times. Some of you in this Hall have already suffered directly at the hands of <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a>... A week ago, a student was taken from our midst. Remember Cedric. Remember, if the time should come when you have to make a choice between what is right and what is easy, remember what happened to a boy who was good, and kind, and brave, because he strayed across the path of Lord Voldemort. Remember Cedric Diggory.</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— Dumbledore giving respect to Cedric Diggory<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire" title="Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<p>Before the beginning of the new school year, the first <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eater</a> activity in years broke out at the <a href="/wiki/Quidditch_World_Cup" title="Quidditch World Cup">Quidditch World Cup</a>, causing Dumbledore to suspect that the second rise of Lord Voldemort was near. Later, Hogwarts played host to the first <a href="/wiki/Triwizard_Tournament" title="Triwizard Tournament">Triwizard Tournament</a> since 1792. It was decided that only students of age would be allowed to enter their names to the Goblet of Fire, because of the dangers the tournament represented and its high death toll. Dumbledore personally drew an <a href="/wiki/Age_Line" title="Age Line">Age Line</a> around the magical artefact to ensure that this rule would be impossible to break. During this year, Dumbledore employed his old friend, <a href="/wiki/Alastor_Moody" title="Alastor Moody">Alastor Moody</a>, an ex-<a href="/wiki/Auror" title="Auror">Auror</a>, as the new <a href="/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts" title="Defence Against the Dark Arts">Defence Against the Dark Arts</a> Professor. Moody took this position only as a personal favour to Dumbledore.<sup id="cite_ref-GOF_59-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-GOF-59"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>59<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 250px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/b/b3/B4C16M1_Champions_chosen_v1.png/revision/latest?cb=20190326015217" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="B4C16M1 Champions chosen v1" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="91" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="B4C16M1 Champions chosen v1.png" data-image-key="B4C16M1_Champions_chosen_v1.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/b/b3/B4C16M1_Champions_chosen_v1.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20190326015217" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/b/b3/B4C16M1_Champions_chosen_v1.png/revision/latest?cb=20190326015217" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="B4C16M1 Champions chosen v1" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/b/b3/B4C16M1_Champions_chosen_v1.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20190326015217" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="91" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="B4C16M1 Champions chosen v1.png" data-image-key="B4C16M1_Champions_chosen_v1.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/b/b3/B4C16M1_Champions_chosen_v1.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20190326015217" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:B4C16M1_Champions_chosen_v1.png" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Albus Dumbledore withdrawing Harry's name from the <a href="/wiki/Goblet_of_Fire" title="Goblet of Fire">Goblet of Fire</a></p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>However, unknown to anybody, a day before Moody was set to arrive at Hogwarts, he was overpowered by Death Eaters <a href="/wiki/Bartemius_Crouch_Junior" title="Bartemius Crouch Junior">Barty Crouch Jnr</a> and <a href="/wiki/Peter_Pettigrew" title="Peter Pettigrew">Peter Pettigrew</a>. On the orders of Voldemort, Crouch brewed <a href="/wiki/Polyjuice_Potion" title="Polyjuice Potion">Polyjuice Potion</a>, which he used to impersonate Moody and take his place at Hogwarts. Crouch, in the guise of Moody, successfully fooled the Goblet of Fire and ensured that <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a> was chosen as the fourth champion of the Triwizard Tournament. Crouch secretly aided Potter throughout the tournament, so that in the final task it would be him to touch the Triwizard trophy first, which he had <a href="/wiki/Portkey_Spell" title="Portkey Spell">bewitched</a> to become a <a href="/wiki/Portkey" title="Portkey">Portkey</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-GOF_59-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-GOF-59"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>59<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>When Harry and fellow champion <a href="/wiki/Cedric_Diggory" title="Cedric Diggory">Cedric Diggory</a> touched the trophy at the same time, they were transported to the graveyard of <a href="/wiki/Little_Hangleton" title="Little Hangleton">Little Hangleton</a>. There, Diggory was killed on the orders of Lord Voldemort, and Harry's blood was taken as the final ingredient in a potion the Dark Lord used to <a href="/wiki/Return_of_Lord_Voldemort" title="Return of Lord Voldemort">turn to full power</a>. Using the Portkey, Harry was able to escape Voldemort and return to Hogwarts.<sup id="cite_ref-GOF_59-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-GOF-59"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>59<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> The entire school was shocked to witness an exhausted and injured Harry return with Diggory’s body.
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 250px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/3/36/B4C35M1_Barty_Crouch_Jnr_exposed_PM.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20241201181153" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="B4C35M1 Barty Crouch Jnr exposed PM" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="98" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="B4C35M1 Barty Crouch Jnr exposed PM.jpg" data-image-key="B4C35M1_Barty_Crouch_Jnr_exposed_PM.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/3/36/B4C35M1_Barty_Crouch_Jnr_exposed_PM.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20241201181153" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/3/36/B4C35M1_Barty_Crouch_Jnr_exposed_PM.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20241201181153" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="B4C35M1 Barty Crouch Jnr exposed PM" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/3/36/B4C35M1_Barty_Crouch_Jnr_exposed_PM.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20241201181153" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="98" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="B4C35M1 Barty Crouch Jnr exposed PM.jpg" data-image-key="B4C35M1_Barty_Crouch_Jnr_exposed_PM.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/3/36/B4C35M1_Barty_Crouch_Jnr_exposed_PM.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20241201181153" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:B4C35M1_Barty_Crouch_Jnr_exposed_PM.jpg" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Dumbledore and Harry discovering the location of the real Alastor Moody</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>It was when Crouch, still in the guise of Moody, took Harry from out of Dumbledore's presence (something the real Moody never would have done in such a traumatic situation) that the headmaster realised that it was not Moody who had been at the school the whole year. Dumbledore, Snape and <a href="/wiki/Minerva_McGonagall" title="Minerva McGonagall">Minerva McGonagall</a> quickly overpowered the Death Eater. It was in that moment that Harry realised exactly why Dumbledore was the only wizard that Voldemort ever feared. Barty then truthfully revealed the entirety of Voldemort's plot and his participation in it under the influence of <a href="/wiki/Veritaserum" title="Veritaserum">Veritaserum</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-GOF_59-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-GOF-59"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>59<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Dumbledore then took Harry to his office to meet Sirius and there he asked Harry to fill him in on what had happened. He then took Harry to the hospital wing to recover.
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 250px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/78/B4C36M1_Snape_Dark_Mark_reveal.png/revision/latest?cb=20241212174609" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="B4C36M1 Snape Dark Mark reveal" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="102" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="B4C36M1 Snape Dark Mark reveal.png" data-image-key="B4C36M1_Snape_Dark_Mark_reveal.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/78/B4C36M1_Snape_Dark_Mark_reveal.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20241212174609" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/78/B4C36M1_Snape_Dark_Mark_reveal.png/revision/latest?cb=20241212174609" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="B4C36M1 Snape Dark Mark reveal" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/78/B4C36M1_Snape_Dark_Mark_reveal.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20241212174609" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="102" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="B4C36M1 Snape Dark Mark reveal.png" data-image-key="B4C36M1_Snape_Dark_Mark_reveal.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/78/B4C36M1_Snape_Dark_Mark_reveal.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20241212174609" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:B4C36M1_Snape_Dark_Mark_reveal.png" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Dumbledore with Harry in the hospital wing</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Despite all evidence to the contrary, Minister for Magic <a href="/wiki/Cornelius_Fudge" title="Cornelius Fudge">Cornelius Fudge</a> refused to believe that Lord Voldemort had returned to power and had Crouch subjected to the <a href="/wiki/Dementor%27s_Kiss" title="Dementor's Kiss">Dementor's Kiss</a> before he could be forced to stand trial before the <a href="/wiki/Wizengamot" title="Wizengamot">Wizengamot</a>. Despite this, Dumbledore knew that Voldemort's return was real and, in response to Fudge's failure to act, reformed the <a href="/wiki/Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Order of the Phoenix">Order of the Phoenix</a>, an alliance brought together during the <a href="/wiki/First_Wizarding_War" title="First Wizarding War">First Wizarding War</a> to fight against Voldemort and his followers. Dumbledore chose to reform the Order as he feared that the start of the <a href="/wiki/Second_Wizarding_War" title="Second Wizarding War">Second Wizarding War</a> was lingering and inevitable to happen.<sup id="cite_ref-GOF_59-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-GOF-59"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>59<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Again, Dumbledore was reminded of Harry's exceptional skill and knew that he would surely have to be told of the prophecy soon, but again he chose not to, out of a desire to spare Harry an additional burden.<sup id="cite_ref-OOTP_64-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OOTP-64"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>64<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span id="Second_Wizarding_War_.281995.E2.80.931997.29"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="Second_Wizarding_War_(1995–1997)">Second Wizarding War <span class="template-c">(1995–1997)</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Evading_Cornelius_Fudge">Evading Cornelius Fudge</span></h4>
<dl><dd><div class="noprint"><i>Main article: <a href="/wiki/Campaign_to_discredit_Albus_Dumbledore_and_Harry_Potter" title="Campaign to discredit Albus Dumbledore and Harry Potter">Campaign to discredit Albus Dumbledore and Harry Potter</a></i></div></dd></dl>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">"<i>They're trying to discredit him. Didn't you see the </i>Daily Prophet<i> last week? They reported that he'd been voted out of the <a href="/wiki/International_Confederation_of_Wizards" title="International Confederation of Wizards">International Confederation of Wizards</a> because he's getting old and losing his grip, but it's not true; he was voted out by Ministry wizards after he made a speech announcing Voldemort's return. They've demoted him from Chief Warlock on the Wizengamot, and they're thinking of removing his <a href="/wiki/Order_of_Merlin" title="Order of Merlin">Order of Merlin</a>, First Class too.</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— Dumbledore's discredit at the hands of the Ministry<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
