<p>Albus Dumbledore's legacy was hugely significant and entailed by decades of suffering, torture, tragedy, success, love, prosperity, and everything in between.
</p><p>He was destined for glory by what he dreamed of and the aspirations he had during his youth including what he accomplished in his early youth. Though in his youth he wanted to rule over the world of the <a href="/wiki/Non-magic_people" title="Non-magic people">non-magic people</a>, he didn't do it in any bad matter like his boyfriend, <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Gellert Grindelwald</a> tended to. He learned early in his teenage years that power and being the best could end very badly and was always not the best result. Though he did learn many things, for instance, he used the way he worded things for his own good as using and manipulating people for instance, "<a href="/wiki/For_the_Greater_Good" title="For the Greater Good">For The Greater Good</a>".
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Funeral">Funeral</span></h4>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">"<i><a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts</a> should be Dumbledore's final resting place.</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— <a href="/wiki/Filius_Flitwick" title="Filius Flitwick">Filius Flitwick</a> regarding Dumbledore's burial<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 250px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/0/06/B6C30M1_funeral_of_Albus_Dumbledore.png/revision/latest?cb=20161209004341" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="B6C30M1 funeral of Albus Dumbledore" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="98" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="B6C30M1 funeral of Albus Dumbledore.png" data-image-key="B6C30M1_funeral_of_Albus_Dumbledore.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/0/06/B6C30M1_funeral_of_Albus_Dumbledore.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20161209004341" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/0/06/B6C30M1_funeral_of_Albus_Dumbledore.png/revision/latest?cb=20161209004341" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="B6C30M1 funeral of Albus Dumbledore" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/0/06/B6C30M1_funeral_of_Albus_Dumbledore.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20161209004341" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="98" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="B6C30M1 funeral of Albus Dumbledore.png" data-image-key="B6C30M1_funeral_of_Albus_Dumbledore.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/0/06/B6C30M1_funeral_of_Albus_Dumbledore.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20161209004341" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:B6C30M1_funeral_of_Albus_Dumbledore.png" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Dumbledore's funeral</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Sometime in early July, a funeral was held for him, attended by Hogwarts students and staff, Ministry of Magic officials (including <a href="/wiki/Cornelius_Fudge" title="Cornelius Fudge">Cornelius Fudge</a>, <a href="/wiki/Rufus_Scrimgeour" title="Rufus Scrimgeour">Rufus Scrimgeour</a>, <a href="/wiki/Dolores_Umbridge" title="Dolores Umbridge">Dolores Umbridge</a> and <a href="/wiki/Percy_Weasley" title="Percy Weasley">Percy Weasley</a>), centaurs, members of the Order of the Phoenix (except Severus Snape, due to his covert status, and <a href="/wiki/Mundungus_Fletcher" title="Mundungus Fletcher">Mundungus Fletcher</a>, due to his imprisonment in <a href="/wiki/Azkaban" title="Azkaban">Azkaban</a>), Hogsmeade residents including Dumbledore's brother <a href="/wiki/Aberforth_Dumbledore" title="Aberforth Dumbledore">Aberforth</a>, <a href="/wiki/Fawkes" title="Fawkes">Fawkes</a>, Hagrid's half-brother Grawp, Merpeople, <a href="/wiki/Tom" title="Tom">Tom</a> the landlord of the <a href="/wiki/Leaky_Cauldron" title="Leaky Cauldron">Leaky Cauldron</a>, <a href="/wiki/Olympe_Maxime" title="Olympe Maxime">Madame Maxime</a> from <a href="/wiki/Beauxbatons_Academy_of_Magic" title="Beauxbatons Academy of Magic">Beauxbatons Academy of Magic</a>, Bass player of the <a href="/wiki/Weird_Sisters" title="Weird Sisters">Weird Sisters</a> <a href="/wiki/Donaghan_Tremlett" title="Donaghan Tremlett">Donaghan Tremlett</a>, driver of the <a href="/wiki/Knight_Bus" title="Knight Bus">Knight Bus</a> <a href="/wiki/Ernest_Prang" title="Ernest Prang">Ernie Prang</a>, <a href="/wiki/Malkin" title="Malkin">Madam Malkin</a> of the robe shop in <a href="/wiki/Diagon_Alley" title="Diagon Alley">Diagon Alley</a>, the lady who pushed the trolley on the Hogwarts Express, as well as many other witches and wizards.<sup id="cite_ref-HBP_48-18" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP-48"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>48<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>It was Dumbledore's wish to be <a href="/wiki/Funeral_of_Albus_Dumbledore" title="Funeral of Albus Dumbledore">laid to rest</a> within Hogwarts grounds, and his supporters, friends, and colleagues ensured that his wish was carried out. Despite the fact that no other <a href="/wiki/Headteacher" title="Headteacher">Headmasters</a> or Headmistresses had ever been laid to rest at Hogwarts before, the <a href="/wiki/British_Ministry_of_Magic" title="British Ministry of Magic">Ministry</a> respected Dumbledore's wishes due to his great standing in the wizarding community. During his funeral, directly after a <a href="/wiki/Ceremony_official" title="Ceremony official">ceremony official</a> gave his eulogy, his body was encased in bright white <a href="/wiki/Fire" title="Fire">flames</a> that gave off smoke in strange patterns, and Harry Potter thought he saw the form of a phoenix fly out of the blaze. When it subsided, Dumbledore was closed in this tomb.<sup id="cite_ref-HBP30_104-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP30-104"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>104<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Biography_published">Biography published</span></h4>
<p>After his death, Dumbledore's reputation was smeared somewhat by <a href="/wiki/Rita_Skeeter" title="Rita Skeeter">Rita Skeeter</a>, who wrote an insulting biography called <i><a href="/wiki/The_Life_and_Lies_of_Albus_Dumbledore" title="The Life and Lies of Albus Dumbledore">The Life and Lies of Albus Dumbledore</a></i>. This depicted him in a highly unfavourable light, including suggesting that he delayed his attack on <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Gellert Grindelwald</a> because he still held lingering affection for him.<sup id="cite_ref-DH_28-7" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH-28"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>28<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Elder_Wand_taken">Elder Wand taken</span></h4>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 250px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/f/f7/Normal_face2face-pg-horizontal.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20141122213433" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Normal face2face-pg-horizontal" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="149" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Normal face2face-pg-horizontal.jpg" data-image-key="Normal_face2face-pg-horizontal.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/f/f7/Normal_face2face-pg-horizontal.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20141122213433" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/f/f7/Normal_face2face-pg-horizontal.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20141122213433" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Normal face2face-pg-horizontal" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/f/f7/Normal_face2face-pg-horizontal.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20141122213433" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="149" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Normal face2face-pg-horizontal.jpg" data-image-key="Normal_face2face-pg-horizontal.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/f/f7/Normal_face2face-pg-horizontal.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20141122213433" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Normal_face2face-pg-horizontal.jpg" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Voldemort breaking into Dumbledore's tomb</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/2/2a/White_Tomb.png/revision/latest?cb=20250421205331" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="White Tomb" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="155" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="White Tomb.png" data-image-key="White_Tomb.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/2/2a/White_Tomb.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250421205331" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/2/2a/White_Tomb.png/revision/latest?cb=20250421205331" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="White Tomb" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/2/2a/White_Tomb.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250421205331" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="155" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="White Tomb.png" data-image-key="White_Tomb.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/2/2a/White_Tomb.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250421205331" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:White_Tomb.png" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">The White Tomb after being broken open</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>In <a href="/wiki/1998" title="1998">1998</a>, Lord Voldemort, during his search for the <a href="/wiki/Elder_Wand" title="Elder Wand">Elder Wand</a>, demanded the location of the wand from <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Gellert Grindelwald</a> in his cell in <a href="/wiki/Nurmengard_Castle" title="Nurmengard Castle">Nurmengard</a> prison. Grindelwald refused to tell him anything, possibly out of a desire not to see his old friend's grave desecrated, or as a sign of remorse for all the atrocities he committed earlier in his life. However, Voldemort eventually deduced that Dumbledore had <a href="/wiki/Duel_between_Albus_Dumbledore_and_Gellert_Grindelwald" class="mw-redirect" title="Duel between Albus Dumbledore and Gellert Grindelwald">won</a> the Elder Wand from Grindelwald, who himself <a href="/wiki/Theft_of_the_Elder_Wand_(Global_Wizarding_War)" title="Theft of the Elder Wand (Global Wizarding War)">stole it</a> from <a href="/wiki/Mykew_Gregorovitch" title="Mykew Gregorovitch">Gregorovitch</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-DH23_105-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH23-105"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>105<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Voldemort <a href="/wiki/Flight" title="Flight">flew</a> to Hogwarts and used <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle%27s_wand" title="Tom Riddle's wand">his own wand</a> to crack open the White Tomb from head to foot, and then removed the sheets from around Dumbledore's body, allowing him to take the wand within, which had been buried with its owner. He did not realise that <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a> had won the allegiance of the wand from Draco during a skirmish in the Malfoy Manor not long before.<sup id="cite_ref-DH24_18-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH24-18"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>18<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="In_Limbo">In Limbo</span></h4>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span><b>Albus Dumbledore</b>: "<i>Harry. You wonderful boy. You brave, brave man. Let us walk.</i>"</span></dd>
<dd><b>Harry Potter</b>: "<i>But you're dead.</i>"</dd>
<dd><b>Albus Dumbledore</b>: "<i>Oh yes.</i>"</dd>
<dd><b>Harry Potter</b>: "<i>Then... I'm dead too?</i>"</dd>
<dd><b>Albus Dumbledore</b>: "<i>Ah. That is the question, isn't it? On the whole, dear boy, I think not.</i>"</dd>
<dd>— Dumbledore greeting Harry Potter in Limbo<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">[src]</a></sup></dd></dl>
</div>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 250px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/6/61/DumbledoreHarryLimbo.gif/revision/latest?cb=20190326005857" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="DumbledoreHarryLimbo" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="104" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="DumbledoreHarryLimbo.gif" data-image-key="DumbledoreHarryLimbo.gif" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/6/61/DumbledoreHarryLimbo.gif/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20190326005857" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/6/61/DumbledoreHarryLimbo.gif/revision/latest?cb=20190326005857" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="DumbledoreHarryLimbo" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/6/61/DumbledoreHarryLimbo.gif/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20190326005857" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="104" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="DumbledoreHarryLimbo.gif" data-image-key="DumbledoreHarryLimbo.gif" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/6/61/DumbledoreHarryLimbo.gif/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20190326005857" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:DumbledoreHarryLimbo.gif" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Harry Potter speaking with Albus Dumbledore in <a href="/wiki/Limbo" title="Limbo">Limbo</a></p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>As it turned out, the night of Dumbledore's death was not the last time Harry saw him. After finding out he was one of <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Voldemort</a>'s Horcruxes (Voldemort having accidentally made him one the night he tried to kill him), Harry bravely walked into Voldemort's camp to be killed, just as Dumbledore had (reluctantly) <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore_and_Harry_Potter%27s_Horcrux_hunt" title="Albus Dumbledore and Harry Potter's Horcrux hunt">planned</a>. But Voldemort's <a href="/wiki/Killing_Curse" title="Killing Curse">Killing Curse</a> once again failed to kill Harry. Instead, Harry entered a limbo state, where he spoke with Dumbledore's spirit. Dumbledore explained to Harry everything he had not told him when he was alive: the nature of the <a href="/wiki/Deathly_Hallows" title="Deathly Hallows">Deathly Hallows</a>, his friendship with <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Gellert Grindelwald</a> and a number of other things.<sup id="cite_ref-DH_28-8" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH-28"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>28<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Most significantly, he revealed that Harry was not dead because, when Voldemort had used Harry's blood to restore his body, he had unintentionally linked Harry's life to his own, with the result that Voldemort's curse had "killed" only the fragment of his <a href="/wiki/Soul" title="Soul">soul</a> that had remained in Harry all these years. Despite the anger and resentment he felt toward his old mentor, Harry also attempted to console Dumbledore when asked if he had been any better than Voldemort in his quest for power; Harry pointed out that Dumbledore had never killed if he could avoid it, and argued that Dumbledore's search for the Hallows, as opposed to any attempts to create <a href="/wiki/Horcrux" title="Horcrux">Horcruxes</a>, made him completely different from Voldemort, fully reconciling with his protégé.<sup id="cite_ref-DH_28-9" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH-28"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>28<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>After he had finished their talk, Dumbledore and Harry parted ways for the time being: Harry returned to the mortal world and Dumbledore moved, as he would put it, "on". He was the only Headmaster to be laid to rest on the <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts</a> grounds, after Hagrid argued that no other Headmaster had ever given as much to the school as Dumbledore had. His <a href="/wiki/Headmaster_portraits" class="mw-redirect" title="Headmaster portraits">portrait</a> also remained at Hogwarts. After Voldemort's death and Harry revealing that he was the true master of the Elder Wand, he said to <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore%27s_portrait" title="Albus Dumbledore's portrait">Dumbledore's portrait</a> that he was going to return the wand to his tomb where it would remain until he died and should he be undefeated, he would be the wand's last master which would break its power. He only used the wand for one feat: to repair his own wand which had been broken earlier.<sup id="cite_ref-DH_28-10" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH-28"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>28<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Harry and <a href="/wiki/Ginevra_Weasley" title="Ginevra Weasley">Ginny Potter</a>'s second son was named <a href="/wiki/Albus_Potter" title="Albus Potter">Albus Severus Potter</a>, after Dumbledore and Severus Snape.<sup id="cite_ref-DH_28-11" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH-28"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>28<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Portrait_at_Hogwarts">Portrait at Hogwarts</span></h4>
<dl><dd><div class="noprint"><i>Main article: <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore%27s_portrait" title="Albus Dumbledore's portrait">Albus Dumbledore's portrait</a></i></div></dd></dl>
<p>The portrait of Dumbledore had also spoken to a new generation of Hogwarts students in the <a href="/wiki/2000s" title="2000s">2000s</a> and <a href="/wiki/2010s" title="2010s">2010s</a> when they were in the <a href="/wiki/Headmaster%27s_office" title="Headmaster's office">Headmistress's office</a>. He was known to have talked to three students, <a href="/wiki/Daniel_Page" title="Daniel Page">Daniel Page</a>, <a href="/wiki/Ivy_Warrington" title="Ivy Warrington">Ivy Warrington</a> and <a href="/wiki/Tiburon_Merriweather%27s_great-grandchild" title="Tiburon Merriweather's great-grandchild">their friend</a> at least twice during their years at the school.<sup id="cite_ref-MA_106-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-MA-106"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>106<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 200px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/82/Albus_Dumbledore%27s_Portrait.gif/revision/latest?cb=20170428141922" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Albus Dumbledore's Portrait" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="200" height="241" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Albus Dumbledore's Portrait.gif" data-image-key="Albus_Dumbledore%27s_Portrait.gif" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/82/Albus_Dumbledore%27s_Portrait.gif/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/200?cb=20170428141922" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/82/Albus_Dumbledore%27s_Portrait.gif/revision/latest?cb=20170428141922" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Albus Dumbledore's Portrait" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/82/Albus_Dumbledore%27s_Portrait.gif/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/200?cb=20170428141922" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="200" height="241" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Albus Dumbledore's Portrait.gif" data-image-key="Albus_Dumbledore%27s_Portrait.gif" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/82/Albus_Dumbledore%27s_Portrait.gif/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/200?cb=20170428141922" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Albus_Dumbledore%27s_Portrait.gif" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Dumbledore's moving portrait, featuring Fawkes</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>In <a href="/wiki/2020" title="2020">2020</a>, after his son, Albus Potter, got injured due to using a prototype <a href="/wiki/Time-Turner" title="Time-Turner">Time-Turner</a> to save Cedric Diggory, Harry visited the portrait of Dumbledore. He gave Harry advice of trying to see his son the way he is rather than make him be something he cannot be and later departed.<sup id="cite_ref-CC_107-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-CC-107"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>107<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Harry approached him again after hearing Albus and <a href="/wiki/Scorpius_Malfoy" title="Scorpius Malfoy">Scorpius Malfoy</a>, the son of <a href="/wiki/Draco_Malfoy" title="Draco Malfoy">Draco Malfoy</a>, are kidnapped by <a href="/wiki/Delphini" title="Delphini">Delphini</a>, the daughter of Lord Voldemort, where he asked Harry what he was doing and answered Harry's questions. Feeling like he was left "cleaning after the messes" Dumbledore left after he died, Harry asked him to leave. In response, Dumbledore tried to justify his actions. He stated that he wanted to fight Voldemort on his behalf but he "felt like he loved Harry too much to not realise that he should have trusted Harry more". He later gave Harry advice and left his portrait once more.<sup id="cite_ref-CC_107-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-CC-107"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>107<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Dumbledore's reputation was so significant that even years after his death, the only reason Albus and Scorpius avoided contacting him for help when they found themselves stuck in 1981 was because they were concerned that even the knowledge of their existence would taint Dumbledore's future plans, as it was agreed that he had always known enough to know what to do or not to do and awareness of details such as Harry's future son might impact his plans.<sup id="cite_ref-CC_107-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-CC-107"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>107<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Physical_description">Physical description</span></h2>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone">"<i>He was tall, thin, and very old, judging by the silver of his hair and beard, which were both long enough to tuck into his belt. He was wearing long robes, a purple cloak that swept the ground, and high-heeled, buckled boots. His blue eyes were light, bright, and sparkling behind half-moon spectacles and his nose was very long and crooked, as though it had been broken at least twice.</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— Dumbledore's physical appearance<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Philosopher%27s_Stone" title="Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<p>Albus Dumbledore was tall and thin, with silver hair and beard (auburn in his youth) so long that they could be tucked into his belt. He had a very long and crooked nose that looked as if it had been broken at least twice. (It is implied that his <a href="/wiki/Aberforth_Dumbledore" title="Aberforth Dumbledore">brother</a>'s punch during their <a href="/wiki/Ariana_Dumbledore" title="Ariana Dumbledore">sister</a>'s <a href="/wiki/Muggle_duelling" title="Muggle duelling">funeral</a> played a role in shaping his nose.) He was also said to have long and skilful fingers. His eyes were described to be a brilliant, soul-piercing shade of blue, and usually twinkled with kindness and mischief.
</p><p>When he became genuinely angry, however, Dumbledore would transform from a benign-looking, bright-eyed old man into a wizard even more terrifying than Lord Voldemort himself, with a face that was a classic portrait of cold fury and an aura of power that made him seem as if he was giving off burning heat. Indeed, Harry had — after witnessing a rare moment of Dumbledore's furious rage — confessed to fully understanding why people always said that Dumbledore was the only wizard Voldemort had ever feared.
</p><p>Dumbledore wore half-moon spectacles and a colourful array of robes, ranging from purple to crimson-red. He once claimed to have a scar above his left knee in the precise shape of a map of the London Underground, but whether or not he actually did is unknown. His demeanour was often — if not always — serene and ethereal, and he usually spoke in a calm, pleasant voice even when Harry thought that he was actually furious.
</p><p>During the last year of his life, Dumbledore's right hand was scarred when he donned the cursed Marvolo Gaunt's Ring. Had Severus Snape not intervened with a counter-curse, Dumbledore would have died within minutes. Regardless, the curse left his hand blackened and dead-looking, and no amount of healing could repair the appearance. According to Snape, the curse would eventually spread itself from the contained hand and Dumbledore was doomed to die in no more than one year's time. Whether this means the blackening dead-look appearance would spread throughout the entire body is unknown. Death, however, served to restore him to full health and strength: his spirit was described as walking sprightly and upright, with hands that were both whole and white and undamaged, and looking exactly how Harry remembered him to be.
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Personality_and_traits">Personality and traits</span></h2>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone"><b>Albus Dumbledore</b>: "<i>Welcome! Welcome to a new year at Hogwarts! Before we begin our banquet, I would like to say a few words. And here they are: Nitwit! Blubber! Oddment! Tweak! Thank you!</i>"</span></dd>
<dd><b>Harry Potter</b>: "<i>Is he — a bit mad?</i>"</dd>
<dd><b>Percy Weasley</b>: "<i>Mad? He's a genius! Best wizard in the world! But he is a bit mad, yes.</i>"</dd>
<dd>— <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a> and <a href="/wiki/Percy_Weasley" title="Percy Weasley">Percy Weasley</a> about Albus Dumbledore<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Philosopher%27s_Stone" title="Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone">[src]</a></sup></dd></dl>
</div>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 200px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/8c/Albus_Dumbledore_-_Richard_Harris_profile.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180510170158" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Albus Dumbledore - Richard Harris profile" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="200" height="282" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Albus Dumbledore - Richard Harris profile.jpg" data-image-key="Albus_Dumbledore_-_Richard_Harris_profile.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/8c/Albus_Dumbledore_-_Richard_Harris_profile.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/200?cb=20180510170158" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/8c/Albus_Dumbledore_-_Richard_Harris_profile.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180510170158" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Albus Dumbledore - Richard Harris profile" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/8c/Albus_Dumbledore_-_Richard_Harris_profile.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/200?cb=20180510170158" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="200" height="282" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Albus Dumbledore - Richard Harris profile.jpg" data-image-key="Albus_Dumbledore_-_Richard_Harris_profile.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/8c/Albus_Dumbledore_-_Richard_Harris_profile.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/200?cb=20180510170158" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Albus_Dumbledore_-_Richard_Harris_profile.jpg" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Dumbledore's flamboyant attire</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Considered by many to be "the most powerful <a href="/wiki/Wizardkind" title="Wizardkind">wizard</a> of all time", Dumbledore was benevolent and wise, a great wizard in the vein of <a href="/wiki/Merlin" title="Merlin">Merlin</a>. He had an almost unearthly calm and relaxed demeanour and almost constantly gave off an aura of serenity and composure, rarely displaying intense emotions of anger or fear. He was known for typically speaking in a calm, collected voice, and being firm, but reasonable and kind. He was always courteous, even to people who he found rude or in the case of Fenrir Greyback, disgusting. However, despite his benign nature, it is said that Dumbledore was the only wizard <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a> ever truly feared.
</p><p>Dumbledore was notably eccentric. He was quite fond of knitting patterns and frequently wore flamboyant clothing (at one point, he is seen wearing a flowered <a href="/wiki/Bonnet" title="Bonnet">bonnet</a> that he received from a <a href="/wiki/Wizard_Cracker" title="Wizard Cracker">Wizard Cracker</a>). In particular, he had a somewhat odd taste in sweets: he enjoyed Muggle sweets relatively unknown in the wizarding world (particularly <a href="/wiki/Sherbet_lemon" title="Sherbet lemon">sherbet lemons</a>) and the password to his office, supposedly that of his current favourite sweet, was often peculiar choices such as <a href="/wiki/Acid_Pops" title="Acid Pops">Acid Pops</a> and <a href="/wiki/Cockroach_Clusters" title="Cockroach Clusters">Cockroach Clusters</a>. In addition, he had a liking for <a href="/wiki/Chamber_music" title="Chamber music">chamber music</a> as well as <a href="/wiki/Ten-pin_bowling" title="Ten-pin bowling">ten-pin bowling</a>. He often used humour to make people feel comfortable in his presence. In fact, his noted eccentricity may have been at least partly his using humour to appear less threatening. Dumbledore has been known to be quite philosophical; often, very few people have the understanding (or patience) to comprehend his philosophies.
</p><p>He was apparently a fan of the <a href="/wiki/Puddlemere_United" title="Puddlemere United">Puddlemere United</a> <a href="/wiki/Quidditch" title="Quidditch">Quidditch</a> team, as he wished them luck in the upcoming season in his introduction to <i><a href="/wiki/Quidditch_Through_the_Ages_(real)" title="Quidditch Through the Ages (real)">Quidditch Through the Ages</a></i>.
</p><p>As a supremely talented wizard, Dumbledore showed numerous examples of extraordinary abilities. His capabilities as a <a href="/wiki/Wizardkind" title="Wizardkind">wizard</a> were combined with his extraordinary intellect and extremely cunning and subtle mind that allowed him to comprehend human nature and turn the better aspects of humanity (trust, <a href="/wiki/Love" title="Love">love</a> and friendship) to Voldemort's disadvantage in particular. Due to this, Dumbledore wielded extraordinary powers of deduction that allowed him to be completely unfooled by any charades who could fool even the entire wizarding world and recognise instantly any deception that may have initially fooled him at the slightest of slip-ups, as shown repeatedly when he quickly figured out Quirrell was distracting him with a letter he faked was from the Minister for Magic, was never fooled by Lockhart's books due to having knew what he truly was and quickly realised the truth, and deduced that Moody was actually Crouch Jnr the moment he asked Harry to be brought to his office. 
</p><p>During his Hogwarts career, especially as Headmaster, Dumbledore always maintained his composure, even in situations that would terrify others. Being attacked by Ministry officials, the opening/reopening of the Chamber of Secrets, having Dementors at the school, being surrounded by a plethora of Inferi and soon thereafter, staring death in the face (although they may have made him uneasy for the safety of others) did not frighten him. This was shown best at his duel with Voldemort, when he engaged in small talk with him in a calm, almost sardonically humourous way, despite Voldemort's tremendous duelling prowess and his attempts to murder him. Dumbledore was verbally and utterly unafraid of death and was obviously never scared of Voldemort himself, but rather what he may/could do to those he cared for, and he was also not afraid of being exposed to great torment. 
</p><p>An example of this was in <a href="/wiki/The_Cave" title="The Cave">The Cave</a>, when knowing that the <a href="/wiki/Emerald_Potion" title="Emerald Potion">Potion</a> would cause him severe pain and distress without knowing exactly what would happen to him, Dumbledore did not hesitate to drink it. Despite this, Dumbledore was capable of fear and feared, above all else, that he had actually cast the spell that ended his sister <a href="/wiki/Ariana_Dumbledore" title="Ariana Dumbledore">Ariana</a>'s life. However, he was capable of facing his fears, as shown by how he indirectly confessed his guilt to <a href="/wiki/Leta_Lestrange" title="Leta Lestrange">Leta Lestrange</a>, and by how he later ultimately mustered the strength to confront Grindelwald and end the <a href="/wiki/Global_Wizarding_War" title="Global Wizarding War">Global Wizarding War</a> after years of watching Grindelwald's rampage. Therefore, Dumbledore's Boggart is said to be his sister's corpse.<sup id="cite_ref-JKR_17-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-JKR-17"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>17<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>While Dumbledore (at least in his later years) never displayed arrogance or conceit, he had no use for false modesty either. If a situation warranted it, he was perfectly willing to acknowledge his virtually peerless intelligence and power. He once told Harry that he was fairly confident in his ability to defeat Gellert Grindelwald despite the latter's own great skill and possession of the <a href="/wiki/Elder_Wand" title="Elder Wand">Elder Wand</a>. Dumbledore's portrait also professed to Harry that he had considered personally fighting Voldemort for Harry, further showing Dumbledore's self-confidence. On the one occasion where he did confront Voldemort, he appeared entirely unconcerned throughout the entirety of their duel. However, Dumbledore also understood that he had his weaknesses and blind spots just as any other man and worked hard to keep them in check.
</p>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">"<i>As I have already proven to you, I make mistakes like the next man. In fact, being — forgive me — rather cleverer than most men, my mistakes tend to be correspondingly huger.</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— Dumbledore talks to Harry about his Horcrux theory, and the possibility of his making a mistake<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 250px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/8d/Tom_and_Dumbledore.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20081012184300" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Tom and Dumbledore" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="107" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Tom and Dumbledore.jpg" data-image-key="Tom_and_Dumbledore.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/8d/Tom_and_Dumbledore.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20081012184300" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/8d/Tom_and_Dumbledore.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20081012184300" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Tom and Dumbledore" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/8d/Tom_and_Dumbledore.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20081012184300" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="107" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Tom and Dumbledore.jpg" data-image-key="Tom_and_Dumbledore.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/8d/Tom_and_Dumbledore.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20081012184300" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Tom_and_Dumbledore.jpg" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Albus Dumbledore proving to a young <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Tom Riddle</a> that the Headmaster was a wizard</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>More than anything else, Dumbledore was motivated by his belief in the power of the human spirit. He also had a deep capacity for love, frequently reminding Harry that love was the greatest magic of all. Dumbledore believed in the good in everyone and insisted on giving second chances. He notably argued strongly against the expulsions of <a href="/wiki/Newton_Scamander" title="Newton Scamander">Newton Scamander</a>, and later <a href="/wiki/Rubeus_Hagrid" title="Rubeus Hagrid">Rubeus Hagrid</a>, as well as refraining from expelling <a href="/wiki/Jacob%27s_sibling" title="Jacob's sibling">Jacob's sibling</a>, despite the latter repeatedly breaking school rules. Dumbledore also allowed <a href="/wiki/Remus_Lupin" title="Remus Lupin">Remus Lupin</a> to be a pupil at his school and later a professor, despite the fact that Remus was a werewolf. He had a great friendship with Hagrid, despite many not trusting the half-Giant. The greatest example of this, however, is Dumbledore's relationship with <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Severus Snape</a>, in whom Dumbledore was willing to hold a considerable amount of faith after Severus had shown remorse. Dumbledore even saw a possibility for good in <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Tom Riddle</a> as a child, and was open to giving him a second chance, despite the fact that Tom had already revealed himself to be a cruel sociopath and bully even at a young age, though he kept a careful eye on Tom Riddle during his Hogwarts career rather than simply hoping for the best. 
</p><p>Although he was devoted to Riddle's defeat after he became Voldemort, Dumbledore was genuinely regretful on how the days he could have easily intimidated Riddle into admitting his wrongdoings and taking responsibility for them were long gone, proving he felt a level of remorse for never managing to do anything significant to change Riddle. In addition, Dumbledore also believed the rumours of Grindelwald showing remorse for his crimes during his time in prison and showed a level of respect and gratitude for Grindelwald's concealment of the true location of the Elder Wand for a shred of redemption even if it was in vain.
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 250px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/0/04/Albus_Dumbledore_%28HBP_promo%29_1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20130804143113" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Albus Dumbledore (HBP promo) 1" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="334" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Albus Dumbledore (HBP promo) 1.jpg" data-image-key="Albus_Dumbledore_%28HBP_promo%29_1.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/0/04/Albus_Dumbledore_%28HBP_promo%29_1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20130804143113" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/0/04/Albus_Dumbledore_%28HBP_promo%29_1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20130804143113" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Albus Dumbledore (HBP promo) 1" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/0/04/Albus_Dumbledore_%28HBP_promo%29_1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20130804143113" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="334" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Albus Dumbledore (HBP promo) 1.jpg" data-image-key="Albus_Dumbledore_%28HBP_promo%29_1.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/0/04/Albus_Dumbledore_%28HBP_promo%29_1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20130804143113" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Albus_Dumbledore_(HBP_promo)_1.jpg" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Albus Dumbledore in thought</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Dumbledore was highly perceptive and psychologically canny; his knowledge of people's true personality went beyond being simply a good judge of character. This was never more apparent than in his complex insights into Voldemort's psyche, which he pieced together with Harry to deduce where the Horcruxes were hidden. However, this insight also made him extraordinarily good at manipulating people, which he was perfectly willing to do if he thought it necessary. Perhaps the most blatant example of this was with regard to Severus Snape, as he used Snape's love for the late Lily Evans to manipulate him into helping him protect Harry Potter, her son, despite all the risks it entailed and despite Snape's bitterness and hatred towards Harry's father. Another note worth mentioning in this area, is Dumbledore conjured a bottle of gin to help ease <a href="/wiki/Cole" title="Cole">Mrs Cole</a> during their conversation. He did not offer her a glass, but simply produced it, knowing she would drink it. A lesser note of his emotional insight was with Gilderoy Lockhart: despite Lockhart having fooled every inhabitant in the wizarding world with his books, Dumbledore, having knew what he truly was, was completely unable to be tricked by Lockhart and he was able to effortlessly manipulate Lockhart into taking the job of DADA Professor by slyly hinting Harry Potter was in Hogwarts attending his second year so he can expose him. He was also the only person ever encountered by the young Tom Riddle who the latter was not able to charm.
</p><p>In spite of Dumbledore's many extraordinary qualities, he was also a somewhat Machiavellian figure.<sup id="cite_ref-108" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-108"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>108<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He could be stoically pragmatic and was extremely prone to secrecy. He spent a short portion of his youth concocting plans with <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Gellert Grindelwald</a> for global domination over <a href="/wiki/Non-magic_people" title="Non-magic people">Muggles</a>, in the process treating his ill sister with neglect. Whilst Dumbledore was never a deliberately cruel man, at times, he was too far-sighted, making choices that he believed to be for the greater good and overall benefit of humanity even if it deeply hurt some of the people around him in the immediate short-term. For example, he placed Harry Potter with the Dursley family despite knowing that they would be unlikely to treat him well, as pointed out by Professor McGonagall, all for the sake of keeping him alive.
</p>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">"<i>I knew my brother, Potter. He learned secrecy at our mother's knee. Secrets and lies, that's how we grew up, and Albus... he was a natural... How can you be sure, Potter, that my brother wasn't more interested in the greater good than in you? How can you be sure you aren't dispensable, just like my little sister?</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— Aberforth Dumbledore bitterly describes his brother's inner nature<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<p>Dumbledore's greatest personality flaw, which he explained to <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry</a> in 1998,<sup id="cite_ref-DH_28-12" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH-28"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>28<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> was his desire for power. Particularly in his younger days, he acknowledged that he had been quite selfish and that because of his extraordinary abilities, he had wanted fame, power, and glory for himself. When he and <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Gellert Grindelwald</a> were in school, they made plans to enslave Muggles and re-establish wizards as the natural rulers of the world. However, when his sister <a href="/wiki/Ariana_Dumbledore" title="Ariana Dumbledore">Ariana Dumbledore</a> was killed during a duel between himself, <a href="/wiki/Aberforth_Dumbledore" title="Aberforth Dumbledore">Aberforth Dumbledore</a>, and Grindelwald, any desire to accomplish this goal left him. The incident led to him declining any attempts by others to offer him positions of great political authority, and he refused to take the post of Minister for Magic at least three times. Though he did accept the positions of Supreme Mugwump and Chief Warlock of the Wizengamot, both of these were tempered by checks and balances from contemporaries and colleagues rather than positions of absolute power which could seduce him back into his old ways. 
</p><p>Dumbledore, while often kind and calm, did have a very serious side of himself and was capable of a terrifying wrath. This was rarely seen but appears to be well known and combined with his exceptional magical abilities, made very few of his allies willing to cross him and almost all of his enemies feared him, to the point that even <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a> and <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Gellert Grindelwald</a> were known for fearing him, despite their own incredible magical powers, wrath and status as the two most dangerous Dark wizards in history. Even a slight exertion of Dumbledore's serious side and anger could intimidate the likes of <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a>, and even the Minister for Magic <a href="/wiki/Cornelius_Fudge" title="Cornelius Fudge">Cornelius Fudge</a>, evidenced when they both were shocked when Dumbledore made it clear quite firmly that Hagrid did not open the Chamber of Secrets, despite Dumbledore not openly showing anger. Additionally, rather than shouting when Harry entered Hogwarts with the <a href="/wiki/Flying_Ford_Anglia" title="Flying Ford Anglia">Ford Anglia</a>, and when Harry failed to get <a href="/wiki/Horace_Slughorn" title="Horace Slughorn">Slughorn</a>'s memory, just an expression of calm disappointment on both occasions was enough to make Harry feel ashamed to the point that he found it preferable if Dumbledore shouted at him. Additionally he was able to reduce Snape to ashamed and pitiful grovelling with a single sentence proclaiming his disgust at the former's willingness to let Lily Potter's husband and son die so he could have a chance at rekindling his relationship with her, speaking with a tone of contempt the likes of which Harry (when witnessing the memory of this encounter) had never heard nor thought him capable of. 
</p><p>At the apex of Dumbledore's wrath, which happened extremely rarely, such as when he apprehended <a href="/wiki/Bartemius_Crouch_Junior" title="Bartemius Crouch Junior">Barty Crouch Jnr</a>, who impersonated Moody and almost killed Harry, Dumbledore was described as "being struck with cold, ancient fury". In fact, during this rare moment of intense anger (caused by Dumbledore's realisation that, not only had Voldemort been resurrected, but also that he had been expertly deceived by the guise of a close and trusted friend for an entire year), Dumbledore was so terrifying that even <a href="/wiki/Minerva_McGonagall" title="Minerva McGonagall">Minerva McGonagall</a> and <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Severus Snape</a>, both extremely powerful and stern wizards who rarely displayed emotions, were clearly uneasy. Harry himself (who was also rather terrified of his reaction) fully understood then why Dumbledore was the only wizard that Voldemort ever feared. In addition to being completely unintimidated but rather saddened by Harry's profound bursts of rage regarding Sirius (though Dumbledore knew full well he completely deserved Harry's anger), in all the other times Harry unleashed his anger, Dumbledore proved himself capable of quelling even Harry's anger with just a slight exertion of his dark side, as he silenced Harry's questions regarding his judgement of Draco and Snape and even silenced Harry's anger with just indicating he had crossed the line, showing even Harry's rage could not match the seriousness and fury the old but extraordinarily powerful wizard was capable of. As a somewhat interesting side note, his displays of rage were virtually opposite in character to those of Voldemort. Where Voldemort's temper was seen to be highly volatile, impulsive, and somewhat random, Dumbledore's most angry moments were characterised by cold, deliberate, highly controlled action.
</p>
