<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Fantastic Beasts: The Crimes of Grindelwald - The Original Screenplay">"<i>Regret is my constant companion. Do not let it become yours.</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— Albus Dumbledore on the nature of regret<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Fantastic_Beasts:_The_Crimes_of_Grindelwald_-_The_Original_Screenplay" title="Fantastic Beasts: The Crimes of Grindelwald - The Original Screenplay">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<p>Dumbledore was haunted by his traumatic family history. In particular, he was riddled with guilt over the circumstances surrounding the death of his sister. He felt enormous remorse for his selfishness and was tortured for the rest of his life by the possibility that he might have been the one who cast the spell that killed his sister, to the point that he delayed facing Grindelwald until there was no other choice, due to him fearing what his former friend might have known about the death of Ariana. However, he had enough sense to realise that he will inevitably have to duel Grindelwald and therefore he took the position as the Professor of DADA to prepare students for the upcoming dark times. Additionally, Dumbledore's own guilt allowed him to comfort <a href="/wiki/Leta_Lestrange" title="Leta Lestrange">Leta Lestrange</a> over her own guilt in the role she had in her brother <a href="/wiki/Corvus_Lestrange_(V)" title="Corvus Lestrange (V)">Corvus</a>' death. Indeed, it was Dumbledore's advice to Leta that induced her to save <a href="/wiki/Aurelius_Dumbledore" title="Aurelius Dumbledore">Credence Barebone</a> from <a href="/wiki/Yusuf_Kama" title="Yusuf Kama">Yusuf Kama</a>'s revenge.
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 250px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/f/f8/Albuson.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20190404220237" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Albuson" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="104" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Albuson.jpg" data-image-key="Albuson.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/f/f8/Albuson.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20190404220237" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/f/f8/Albuson.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20190404220237" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Albuson" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/f/f8/Albuson.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20190404220237" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="104" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Albuson.jpg" data-image-key="Albuson.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/f/f8/Albuson.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20190404220237" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Albuson.jpg" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Dumbledore's excitement</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Dumbledore wasn't afraid of death as he believed "to the well organised mind, death was but "<a href="/wiki/Afterlife" title="Afterlife">the next great adventure</a>". Even during his short time in Limbo, he expressed his excitement to Harry for what awaits him. At times, Dumbledore could feel the pressure of his role in the world acutely and relied on his Pensieve to deal with them. He kept vials of memories which he could view in his Pensieve, some of which were his own. He often used this to find connections he might have missed before, and also when he felt he had "too many memories".
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Magical_abilities_and_skills">Magical abilities and skills</span></h2>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Frame" style="width: 245px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/5/52/Firestorm.gif/revision/latest?cb=20140408213652" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Firestorm" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="245" height="150" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Firestorm.gif" data-image-key="Firestorm.gif" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/5/52/Firestorm.gif/revision/latest?cb=20140408213652" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/5/52/Firestorm.gif/revision/latest?cb=20140408213652" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Firestorm" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/5/52/Firestorm.gif/revision/latest?cb=20140408213652" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="245" height="150" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Firestorm.gif" data-image-key="Firestorm.gif" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/5/52/Firestorm.gif/revision/latest?cb=20140408213652" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Firestorm.gif" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Dumbledore casting a very powerful <a href="/wiki/Firestorm" title="Firestorm">firestorm</a></p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">"<i>Examined him personally in Transfiguration and Charms when he did N.E.W.T.s ... Did things with a wand I'd never seen before ...</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— <a href="/wiki/Griselda_Marchbanks" title="Griselda Marchbanks">Griselda Marchbanks</a> regarding Dumbledore's exceptional magical skills <sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div><p>Dumbledore was an outstandingly talented wizard. Even while still only a student of <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts</a>, his prodigious brilliance excelled in all fields of magic to the point of being recognised by his friend Elphias Doge as the most brilliant student to ever attend the school, possibly rivalled only by the equally prodigious <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Tom Riddle</a>, and attaining many awards and prizes that required incredible magical capability to obtain. As an adult, Dumbledore had become an extraordinarily powerful and accomplished wizard, deeply knowledgeable and also proficient in all areas of magic. Nearly unrivalled in abilities and powers, he was admired and feared by even others of outstanding magical talent, considered to be "the greatest wizard of all time" by many. Indeed, Dumbledore was the only wizard capable of defeating <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Gellert Grindelwald</a>, and later, even in his extremely advanced age, intimidated and surpassed Lord Voldemort himself.</p><div class="quote">
<dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">"<i>Harry turned to look where Neville was staring. Directly above them, framed in the doorway from the Brain Room, stood Albus Dumbledore, his wand aloft, his face white and furious. Harry felt a kind of electric charge surge through every particle of his body — they were saved!</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— Harry Potter's complete confidence in the Order's at Dumbledore's arrival at the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Department_of_Mysteries" title="Battle of the Department of Mysteries">Battle of the Department of Mysteries</a>.<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></div>
<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Magic" title="Magic">Magical</a> mastery</b>: After his first year at <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts</a>, Dumbledore was already known to be outstandingly talented and prodigiously accomplished in the magical arts and seen by some as nothing less than the most gifted student the school had ever seen, winning many awards and prizes that required magical capability beyond his age. As an adult, Albus Dumbledore was considered by many to be the greatest <a href="/wiki/Wizardkind" title="Wizardkind">wizard</a> in modern history, and he lived up to this assessment on many occasions with his exemplary mastery of magic. He returned to the school to teach first <a href="/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts" title="Defence Against the Dark Arts">Defence Against the Dark Arts</a>, excelling to the point that he was considered by many of his pupils as the best teacher in Hogwarts. During the earlier stages of <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Gellert Grindelwald</a>'s rise to power, even former Head of the Department of Magical Law Enforcement, <a href="/wiki/Torquil_Travers" title="Torquil Travers">Torquil Travers</a>, begrudgingly admitted that he considered Dumbledore the only wizard with the skill and power needed to defeat Grindelwald, despite his own personal dislike of the Professor. Indeed, even Grindelwald himself acknowledged that Dumbledore posed a bigger threat to his <a href="/wiki/For_the_Greater_Good" title="For the Greater Good">cause</a> than any other living wizard and believed that only the extremely powerful Obscurial <a href="/wiki/Aurelius_Dumbledore" title="Aurelius Dumbledore">Credence Barebone</a> could possibly be capable of killing him. Ultimately, it was Dumbledore's own, direct involvement that ultimately ended the <a href="/wiki/Global_Wizarding_War" title="Global Wizarding War">Global Wizarding War</a> when Albus engaged Grindelwald and ultimately prevailed despite Grindelwald's mastery of the Elder Wand, with <a href="/wiki/Duel_between_Albus_Dumbledore_and_Gellert_Grindelwald" class="mw-redirect" title="Duel between Albus Dumbledore and Gellert Grindelwald">their legendary duel</a> being such an amazing display of power and skill that, according to the eyewitnesses at the time, it was considered as the greatest wizarding battle ever fought between two wizards, with Albus admitting that he had ultimately been a "shade more skilful” than Grindelwald. Later in his teaching career, he taught <a href="/wiki/Transfiguration_(class)" title="Transfiguration (class)">Transfiguration</a>, a notably complex and difficult branch of magic, and soon rose to the position of the <a href="/wiki/Head_of_Transfiguration" title="Head of Transfiguration">Head of Transfiguration</a> of the school. He would eventually become the <a href="/wiki/Head_of_Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Head of Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Headmaster of the highly prestigious wizarding school</a> and soon established a well-deserved reputation as the most capable headmaster to ever lead Hogwarts, with even Tom Riddle acknowledging Dumbledore as being a worthy choice of the title of Headmaster and going so far as to ask why he would not take the position of the <a href="/wiki/Minister_for_Magic" title="Minister for Magic">Minister for Magic</a>, which he openly admitted Dumbledore to be fully capable of excelling in, with his ability to uphold the defences of the school being such that not even Voldemort could have ever breached the school or even dared to attempt to do so while it was under Dumbledore's protection, as Dumbledore was the only wizard that the Dark Lord ever feared, with Hogwarts being considered the only safe place left in the wizarding world that was safe from the most powerful Dark wizard of all time. When they faced each other in magical combat, Dumbledore proved capable of pressuring Voldemort's overwhelming magical skill and powers with his own while, in Voldemort's own admission, not even fighting to kill, forcing Voldemort on the defensive and to eventually disapparate. Dumbledore also expressed full confidence that he could easily break out from the notoriously secure <a href="/wiki/Azkaban" title="Azkaban">Azkaban</a> even if he was imprisoned. When everything was said and done, Dumbledore had such a profound understanding and knowledge of how magic worked, even at his younger days, that he stood above nearly every other wizard alive, and earned the respect of many famously accomplished wizards, such as the magical theoretician <a href="/wiki/Adalbert_Waffling" title="Adalbert Waffling">Adalbert Waffling</a> and the magical historian, <a href="/wiki/Bathilda_Bagshot" title="Bathilda Bagshot">Bathilda Bagshot</a>. and the alchemist, <a href="/wiki/Nicolas_Flamel" title="Nicolas Flamel">Nicholas Flamel</a>. Throughout his life, he greatly contributed to the advancement of magical knowledge in modern times and became a famous contributor to many magical scholarly journals. Dumbledore also proved capable of overcoming the powerful Dark wards placed by Voldemort on the hiding place of his Horcruxes, effortlessly bypassing the enchantments he placed on the <a href="/wiki/Gaunt_Shack" title="Gaunt Shack">Gaunt Shack</a> and doing the same to all but the enchantment on the <a href="/wiki/Emerald_Potion" title="Emerald Potion">Potion of Despair</a> in the Horcrux Cave. In the latter, he showed the currently unmatched ability to detect and analyse magic seemingly upon merely touching or laying his hands, which he used to pass through all of Voldemort's defences.</li>
<li><b>Intellectual genius</b>: Dumbledore was not only a great wizard, but also possessed a tremendous intellect, being considered to be among the most brilliant students to ever attend Hogwarts (rivalled only by Tom Riddle), and, as an adult, was regarded by many as being cleverer than almost any other wizard alive. His intelligence was especially evident through his tactical and strategic genius, proving himself capable of devising elaborate master plans to defeat the most powerful <a href="/wiki/Dark_wizard" title="Dark wizard">Dark wizards</a> seen for centuries and oppose their seemingly unstoppable ascensions to power. Particularly good at guessing, hypothesising, and predicting, Dumbledore informed his former student <a href="/wiki/Newton_Scamander" title="Newton Scamander">Newt Scamander</a> about where he could find an illegally trafficked <a href="/wiki/Thunderbird" title="Thunderbird">Thunderbird</a>, knowing that Newt would make haste to save it and take it to <a href="/wiki/United_States_of_America" title="United States of America">America</a> to set it free once it was nursed back to health, and, aware of Grindelwald's intention of infiltrating <a href="/wiki/Magical_Congress_of_the_United_States_of_America" title="Magical Congress of the United States of America">MACUSA</a> while looking for the Obscurial in New York, hoping his former student would find a way to thwart him. The results of this ploy ultimately culminated in the capture of <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Gellert Grindelwald</a> and the nine months-delay<sup id="cite_ref-109" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-109"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>109<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> in Grindelwald getting his hand on <a href="/wiki/Aurelius_Dumbledore" title="Aurelius Dumbledore">Credence Barebone</a>, and the prevention of the exposure of wizardkind to the non-magical world following the <a href="/wiki/Obscurial_attack_on_New_York" title="Obscurial attack on New York">Obscurial attack on New York</a> of <a href="/wiki/1926" title="1926">1926</a>. Following this, he was also able to follow Grindelwald's train of thought in regard to how he would go about recruiting his followers and guessed correctly that his old friend would set up the <a href="/wiki/International_Statute_of_Wizarding_Secrecy" title="International Statute of Wizarding Secrecy">International Statute of Wizarding Secrecy</a> to be this tool of suppression and offer people freedom from it. Despite his <a href="/wiki/Blood_pact" title="Blood pact">blood pact</a> with Grindelwald limiting Dumbledore's ability to get directly involved, as well as the constant Ministry surveillance of him, Dumbledore's tactical advice to then Head of the <a href="/wiki/Auror_Office" class="mw-redirect" title="Auror Office">Auror Office</a>, <a href="/wiki/Theseus_Scamander" title="Theseus Scamander">Theseus Scamander</a>, that if he and his men resorted to excessive force to deal with Grindelwald and his followers during the latter's <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald%27s_Paris_rally" title="Gellert Grindelwald's Paris rally">rally</a>, it would only serve to reinforce the point Grindelwald was making about the supposed totalitarian regime of the <a href="/wiki/International_Confederation_of_Wizards" title="International Confederation of Wizards">International Confederation of Wizards</a> and the magical governments that supported it in the minds of those who chose to follow him. Dumbledore was later able to successfully and effectively plan to thwart <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald%27s_campaign_for_Supreme_Mugwump" title="Gellert Grindelwald's campaign for Supreme Mugwump">Grindelwald's attempt to become the Supreme Mugwump</a>, masterfully using Grindelwald's arrogance and his limits in seeing the future to confuse him and ultimately win decisively despite Grindelwald having the unfair support of <a href="/wiki/Anton_Vogel" title="Anton Vogel">Anton Vogel</a> and <a href="/wiki/German_Ministry_of_Magic" title="German Ministry of Magic">German Ministry of Magic</a>, successfully installing <a href="/wiki/Yusuf_Kama" title="Yusuf Kama">Yusuf Kama</a> as a spy and thwarting Grindelwald's attempt to assassinate Vicencia Santos, before ending with him creating a plan that flawlessly allowed him and his allies to defeat Grindelwald's followers and expose Grindelwald for the terrorist he truly was, accurately predicting Grindelwald's reanimation of the Qilin and his perception of Theseus, Newt, and Eulalie as the real threats to allow Bunty to reveal the qilin and give Newt the proof needed to rightfully incriminate Grindelwald. When <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a> rose to power one generation later, Dumbledore's strategic brilliance successfully lead the <a href="/wiki/Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Order of the Phoenix">Order of the Phoenix</a> against <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a>'s forces for eleven years during the <a href="/wiki/First_Wizarding_War" title="First Wizarding War">First Wizarding War</a>. This was seen quite predominantly again during the events surrounding the <a href="/wiki/Second_Wizarding_War" title="Second Wizarding War">Second Wizarding War</a>, when Dumbledore, through various strategic plans and an almost Machiavellian manipulation of key persons (such as <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Severus Snape</a> and <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a>) before his death, was able to set the path for <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a> to locate Lord Voldemort's <a href="/wiki/Horcrux" title="Horcrux">Horcruxes</a>, and defeat the Dark Lord. Dumbledore's intellect, his strategic thinking in particular, is one of his key talents. A lesser but still very remarkable testament to his strategic aptitude was his ability to come up with a master plan to save Sirius immediately after learning of his innocence by giving subtle hints to Hermione Granger regarding the Time Turner and later effectively avoiding capture from the Ministry while doing jobs for the Order. His genius was also noticeable even after his death, through his will. Dumbledore displayed himself to be immensely foresightful, as he was able to accurately predict the possibility of <a href="/wiki/Ronald_Weasley" title="Ronald Weasley">Ron Weasley</a> initially walking out on the <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore_and_Harry_Potter%27s_Horcrux_Hunt" class="mw-redirect" title="Albus Dumbledore and Harry Potter's Horcrux Hunt">Horcrux hunt</a> and understand that he would be just as likely to return to it and gave him his <a href="/wiki/Deluminator" title="Deluminator">Deluminator</a> to help him find his way back to Harry and Hermione and use <a href="/wiki/Hermione_Granger" title="Hermione Granger">Hermione Granger</a>'s thirst for knowledge to lead her to becoming curious about the symbol of the Deathly Hallows by drawing it in the copy of that he left her, which ultimately led to Harry not only learning of the <a href="/wiki/Deathly_Hallows" title="Deathly Hallows">Deathly Hallows</a> and finally having inserted the <a href="/wiki/Resurrection_Stone" title="Resurrection Stone">Resurrection Stone</a> into the <a href="/wiki/Golden_Snitch" title="Golden Snitch">Golden Snitch</a> that Harry first caught, learned on how to remove it, thus giving Harry the emotional support he needed to sacrifice himself to the Dark Lord. Dumbledore also possessed an exceptional amount of emotional intelligence, deductive abilities and immense intellectual perception, as he was able to completely see through Voldemort's charismatic mask of being a model student and had a considerable understanding of Voldemort's nature, something that allowed him to accurately deduce the location of his Horcruxes. In addition, he was intelligent enough to keep such a watchful eye over Riddle ever since his first opening of the Chamber of Secrets that he effectively kept the Heir of Slytherin from opening the Chamber the second time. He was also the only wizard who was not fooled by <a href="/wiki/Gilderoy_Lockhart" title="Gilderoy Lockhart">Gilderoy Lockhart</a>'s tall tales and was able to easily work out that Lockhart was a fraud from his personal knowledge of him and of two wizards whose memories had been modified by Lockhart. Dumbledore was also not fooled by <a href="/wiki/Quirinus_Quirrell" title="Quirinus Quirrell">Quirinus Quirrell</a>'s timid guise, correctly deducing that he had been working for Voldemort ever since he finished his journey, and although he was initially fooled by Quirrell's false letter that said the Ministry needed him, Dumbledore was able to quickly figure it out and return to Hogwarts in time to save Harry. He managed to eventually see through <a href="/wiki/Bartemius_Crouch_Junior" title="Bartemius Crouch Junior">Bartemius Crouch Junior</a>'s disguise as <a href="/wiki/Alastor_Moody" title="Alastor Moody">Alastor Moody</a> when he took Harry from him, which he said the real Moody never would have done, whereas Snape and McGonagall couldn't see through the disguise, and only followed Dumbledore when he ordered it, coming up with a clever plan to overpower the latter's <a href="/wiki/Occlumency" title="Occlumency">Occlumency</a> by first heavily weakening him with his Stunning Spell before having him exposed to <a href="/wiki/Veritaserum" title="Veritaserum">Veritaserum</a> and also swiftly deducing the pieces of the simple but brilliant plan Crouch used to disguise himself by keeping Moody alive but Imperiused and very weakened in order to ensure he couldn't overpower him and also insert the Polyjuice Potion inside his flask to drink without suspicion. He could easily identify whatever form <a href="/wiki/Jacob%27s_sibling" title="Jacob's sibling">Jacob's sibling</a> took using the <a href="/wiki/Polyjuice_Potion" title="Polyjuice Potion">Polyjuice Potion</a>, even if said disguise could fool the likes of McGonagall and Snape and was able to easily help them get away unpunished by slyly revealing his knowledge of their disguise and even rewarding as well as warning them without any suspicion. He was also able to easily outwit the notoriously famous hack journalist <a href="/wiki/Rita_Skeeter" title="Rita Skeeter">Rita Skeeter</a>, having easily caught up with all her escapades at Hogwarts and quickly luring her into a position where he could have easily had her arrested by revealing his knowledge of her Animagus power, therefore leaving Rita effectively at his mercy and preventing her from writing anything directly antagonising towards him, doing so much faster than the also highly intelligent Hermione Granger. Additionally, even <a href="/wiki/Cornelius_Fudge" title="Cornelius Fudge">Cornelius Fudge</a> admired Dumbledore's genius, and thus bombarded Dumbledore with letters asking for advice early into his Minister of Magic career.</li>
<li><b>Charisma</b>: While not famous for his abilities as a manipulator, due to Dumbledore's exceptional amount of emotional intelligence, he was nevertheless exceptionally adept at manipulating others, which he was perfectly willing to do for the greater good, and displayed an immense amount of charisma, able to effectively use a person's characteristics to his advantage to get them to do what must be done and inspire loyalty in others. Unlike <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Voldemort</a>, Dumbledore always sought and used the best within people to get them to do his good-intended bidding and used his charisma to get many to the side of good instead of evil. He was able to effortlessly manipulate <a href="/wiki/Newton_Scamander" title="Newton Scamander">Newton Scamander</a> into believing his intentions when telling him about the illegally trafficked <a href="/wiki/Thunderbird" title="Thunderbird">Thunderbird</a> were purely to just safe the poor creature while actually, he was also intending for Newt to stop <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Grindelwald</a> from discovering the <a href="/wiki/Obscurial" title="Obscurial">Obscurial</a>'s identity. He could also successfully convince the people he met to tell him about Voldemort and his time outside school despite the fear Voldemort inflicted upon them. The most notable display of his masterful manipulating abilities was when he was able to effectively manipulate <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Severus Snape</a> into agreeing to protect <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a> and act as a spy in Voldemort's ranks for Dumbledore despite Snape's bitterness and hatred towards Harry's father and full knowledge of the risks his job had by using Snape's love for <a href="/wiki/Lily_Potter_(I)" title="Lily Potter (I)">Lily Evans</a>. Another display of his consummate manipulation skills was when he effortlessly manipulated <a href="/wiki/Gilderoy_Lockhart" title="Gilderoy Lockhart">Gilderoy Lockhart</a> into becoming a teacher at Hogwarts by just slyly hinting that Harry Potter was a second-year student at the school, and being a teacher to the "famous Harry" would propel Lockhart's fame into the stratosphere, notably taking advantage of Lockhart's hunger for more fame and ego to get him to agree to take the job so he could expose him, despite Lockhart not being eager to take the job due to being more interested in his career as an author. Dumbledore's charisma garnered him so much respect and loyalty from his allies that most of them still proved loyal to Dumbledore even after his death and valiantly fought in the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Hogwarts" title="Battle of Hogwarts">Battle of Hogwarts</a> for him. Indeed, Dumbledore was able to quickly befriend Harry Potter and inspired so much loyalty from his protégé that he was able to successfully get him to continue the hunt for <a href="/wiki/Horcrux" title="Horcrux">Horcruxes</a>, despite Harry's resentment of Dumbledore's secrecy, and even eventually sacrifice himself as Dumbledore had planned.</li>
<li><b>Teaching skills</b>: Having reportedly been interested in becoming a teacher from a young age, Dumbledore was a model student, as noted by <a href="/wiki/Elphias_Doge" title="Elphias Doge">Elphias Doge</a>, and as an adult, Dumbledore's teaching talents coupled with his extraordinary magical capabilities made him fully capable of managing the position of the Professor of <a href="/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts" title="Defence Against the Dark Arts">Defence Against the Dark Arts</a> and of <a href="/wiki/Transfiguration" title="Transfiguration">Transfiguration</a> at Hogwarts so well as to be considered the greatest teacher at Hogwarts during his time as an instructor. Indeed, his status on the staff was such that he even earned the confidence of his predecessor as Headmaster, Professor <a href="/wiki/Armando_Dippet" title="Armando Dippet">Armando Dippet</a>, and was able to persuade him to allow <a href="/wiki/Rubeus_Hagrid" title="Rubeus Hagrid">Rubeus Hagrid</a> to stay at Hogwarts as an assistant to Mr <a href="/wiki/Ogg" title="Ogg">Ogg</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Keeper_of_Keys_and_Grounds" class="mw-redirect" title="Keeper of Keys and Grounds">Groundskeeper</a> of the day, thus henceforth earning the undying respect and loyalty of his former student. Dumbledore also successfully guided <a href="/wiki/Minerva_McGonagall" title="Minerva McGonagall">Minerva McGonagall</a> into becoming an <a href="/wiki/Animagus" title="Animagus">Animagus</a>, which was known to be very difficult to do, by the age of 17. He also noted that he was fully confident that had he been the one who taught <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a> <a href="/wiki/Occlumency" title="Occlumency">Occlumency</a>, he would have been able to mould Harry into a successful enough of an Occlumens to resist <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Voldemort</a>. Hermione and Ron were also sure that when Dumbledore gave Harry private lessons, he wanted to teach Harry the most advanced martial magic and was confident that Harry would have learned enough from Dumbledore to be capable of fulfilling the Prophecy. Due to his emotional wisdom and ability to show compassion to all, Dumbledore was also highly adept at offering emotional guidance and also teaching certain people how to perceive the emotional state of others to the point of making even some of the most reclusive students opening up to him, as displayed by his ability to get <a href="/wiki/Leta_Lestrange" title="Leta Lestrange">Leta Lestrange</a> to open up about her brother's death by revealing his own mistakes of not loving <a href="/wiki/Ariana_Dumbledore" title="Ariana Dumbledore">Ariana</a> enough, which ultimately allowed Leta to save <a href="/wiki/Aurelius_Dumbledore" title="Aurelius Dumbledore">Credence Barebone</a> from <a href="/wiki/Yusuf_Kama" title="Yusuf Kama">Yusuf Kama</a>'s revenge, and gave her the mental fortitude to resist <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Gellert Grindelwald</a>'s persuasive speech, and also effectively teach Harry into understanding Voldemort from their private lessons together, which was undoubtedly helpful in Harry's victory over the Dark Lord, as well as grant him the fortitude needed to remain steadfast against Voldemort no matter what happened. As <a href="/wiki/Headteacher" title="Headteacher">Headmaster</a>, Dumbledore even agreed to admit <a href="/wiki/Werewolf" title="Werewolf">werewolf</a> <a href="/wiki/Remus_Lupin" title="Remus Lupin">Remus Lupin</a> to Hogwarts, taking the necessary precautions to avoid Remus' monthly transformations from endangering the other students, and forbidding <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Severus Snape</a> to reveal Remus's secret, which made Remus fully loyal and highly respectful to him. Dumbledore was also partly responsible (along with some other Hogwarts staff) for teaching and training Lord Voldemort himself, who, while at Hogwarts was considered the most brilliant student to ever attend the school (by Dumbledore) and who later, despite his evil, grew up to be the most powerful Dark wizard of all time, and was considered to be the one of the most powerful wizards in history, rivalled only by Dumbledore himself.</li></ul>
<p><b>Leadership skills</b>: Even during his youth, Dumbledore was already an excellent leader, having been good enough to be appointed the <a href="/wiki/British_Youth_Representative_to_the_Wizengamot" title="British Youth Representative to the Wizengamot">British Youth Representative to the Wizengamot</a> and he and Grindelwald were confident they would be fully capable of quickly starting the <a href="/wiki/For_the_Greater_Good" title="For the Greater Good">For the Greater Good</a> revolution to conquer the wizarding world and put down the Muggles. However, he quickly learned his lesson from this mistake and while he had acquired the understanding of what being a leader truly was, he still acknowledged the potential of <a href="/wiki/Newton_Scamander" title="Newton Scamander">Newton Scamander</a> and Harry Potter as being greater than his, as they quickly proved themselves to be more qualified from the beginning due to their lack of lust for power and their willingness to accept any responsibility given to them no matter how large. Nevertheless, the lessons he had learned from his youthful mistakes made him an extraordinarily skilful leader indeed and he was well-respected and feared by many and with his uncanny ability to quickly get his followers to trust him, to the point his skills as a leader was held in such a high regard that he was even offered the position of <a href="/wiki/Minister_for_Magic" title="Minister for Magic">Minister for Magic</a> many times and would have most definitely greatly excelled, with Harry adamantly acknowledging that Dumbledore would have been a far better Minister than <a href="/wiki/Cornelius_Fudge" title="Cornelius Fudge">Cornelius Fudge</a> and <a href="/wiki/Rufus_Scrimgeour" title="Rufus Scrimgeour">Rufus Scrimgeour</a> without hesitation, despite his great anger at Dumbledore at the time, therefore acknowledging his inferiority to Dumbledore as a leader despite Dumbledore's own acknowledgment of Harry being more gifted than he was. Fudge himself held Dumbledore's leadership brilliance in such a high regard to the point that he would often ask for his advice. During the <a href="/wiki/Global_Wizarding_War" title="Global Wizarding War">Global Wizarding War</a>, Dumbledore was able to give useful leadership advice to both <a href="/wiki/Auror_Office" class="mw-redirect" title="Auror Office">Head Auror</a> <a href="/wiki/Theseus_Scamander" title="Theseus Scamander">Theseus Scamander</a>, and Head of <a href="/wiki/Department_of_Magical_Law_Enforcement" title="Department of Magical Law Enforcement">Magical Law Enforcement</a> <a href="/wiki/Torquil_Travers" title="Torquil Travers">Torquil Travers</a> concerning how to best combat <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Gellert Grindelwald</a>, though Travers would disregard it but his advice allowed Theseus and most of his allies to survive unscathed Grindelwald's rally in Paris and it was his leadership expertise giving advice to the wizarding authorities that allowed the wizarding world to be not conquered by Grindelwald long enough for Dumbledore to defeat Grindelwald personally. It was around this time that Dumbledore also personally taught the prodigious young Tom Riddle, who would ironically grow up to be the most powerful Dark wizard of all time, and Dumbledore's greatest rival. After Dumbledore's promotion to <a href="/wiki/Headteacher" title="Headteacher">Headmaster</a> of <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry</a>, he led the school so effectively, that many considered him the greatest headmaster Hogwarts would ever see. Dumbledore's leadership expertise also allowed him to handle the responsibilities of the <a href="/wiki/Chief_Warlock" title="Chief Warlock">Chief Warlock</a> of the <a href="/wiki/Wizengamot" title="Wizengamot">Wizengamot</a> and <a href="/wiki/Supreme_Mugwump" title="Supreme Mugwump">Supreme Mugwump</a> of the <a href="/wiki/International_Confederation_of_Wizards" title="International Confederation of Wizards">International Confederation of Wizards</a> with such effectiveness as to be well-respected for it by many, according to his friend Elphias Doge. Later on, a more experienced Dumbledore was able to found and effectively lead the <a href="/wiki/Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Order of the Phoenix">Order of the Phoenix</a> against <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a> and the latter's <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eaters</a> in both the <a href="/wiki/First_Wizarding_War" title="First Wizarding War">First</a> and <a href="/wiki/Second_Wizarding_War" title="Second Wizarding War">Second Wizarding Wars</a>, in secret. His leadership allowed Dumbledore to stand against the overwhelming forces of darkness at both the First and Second Wizarding War, despite also having to avoid the <a href="/wiki/Ministry_of_Magic" title="Ministry of Magic">Ministry of Magic</a>'s eyes, inspiring enough loyalty into his allies to make them be fearless and determined that the cause they were fighting for was right even with the massive losses of their loved ones. Due to Dumbledore's leadership skills, many high-ranking Ministry officials, such as <a href="/wiki/Torquil_Travers" title="Torquil Travers">Torquil Travers</a>, <a href="/wiki/Dolores_Umbridge" title="Dolores Umbridge">Dolores Umbridge</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Cornelius_Fudge" title="Cornelius Fudge">Cornelius Fudge</a>, were shown to fear what would happen if Dumbledore was plotting to overthrow the Ministry, implying that had Dumbledore wanted to, he could easily have overthrown the British Ministry of Magic, but he never had any intention of doing so.
</p>

<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Duelling" title="Duelling">Duelling</a></b>: Albus Dumbledore was a duellist of extraordinary, almost unrivalled skill. Even at a young age, Dumbledore was already a highly proficient duellist, as he held his own against <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Grindelwald</a> and <a href="/wiki/Aberforth_Dumbledore" title="Aberforth Dumbledore">Aberforth</a> in their <a href="/wiki/Duel_at_Godric%27s_Hollow" title="Duel at Godric's Hollow">three-way duel</a>. As an adult, in addition to having achieved great success in teaching the <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts</a> students in the art of <a href="/wiki/Martial_magic" title="Martial magic">martial magic</a> during his time as the <a href="/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts" title="Defence Against the Dark Arts">Defence Against the Dark Arts</a> professor, as displayed by the level of ability shown by his students Newt, Theseus and Leta, all of whom became seasoned Ministry magical combatants during the <a href="/wiki/Global_Wizarding_War" title="Global Wizarding War">Global Wizarding War</a>, Dumbledore was acknowledged by even the abrasive <a href="/wiki/Torquil_Travers" title="Torquil Travers">Torquil Travers</a> to be the only one skilful enough to fight and bring Grindelwald in. Even Grindelwald himself acknowledged Dumbledore would be easily capable of overpowering any of his followers, which made him a threat to his revolution even though at the time they could not fight each other directly due to their <a href="/wiki/Blood_pact" title="Blood pact">blood pact</a> and noted that only <a href="/wiki/Aurelius_Dumbledore" title="Aurelius Dumbledore">Credence Barebone</a>'s <a href="/wiki/Obscurus" title="Obscurus">Obscurus</a> form would be capable of slaying Dumbledore in magical combat. Dumbledore easily defeated Credence in battle with his experience and skill, casually countering all his attacks despite holding back. Even at the height of Grindelwald's power, where the Dark wizard had killed so many, the whole wizarding world still acknowledged Dumbledore could defeat him and indeed, despite Grindelwald's mastery of the Elder Wand, Albus ultimately proved capable of beating him in what many considered to be the greatest duel ever to be fought, with him describing himself as being a "shade more skilful" than Grindelwald. Prior to his <a href="/wiki/Curse_on_Marvolo_Gaunt%27s_ring" class="mw-redirect" title="Curse on Marvolo Gaunt's ring">injury</a> and consuming the <a href="/wiki/Emerald_Potion" title="Emerald Potion">Drink of Despair</a> in <a href="/wiki/1996" title="1996">1996</a>, it remained a fact that any witch or wizard would, regardless of skill, would be no match for him,<sup id="cite_ref-113" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-113"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>113<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> to the point that even the extraordinarily powerful <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a> strongly preferred to refrain from a face to face confrontation with Dumbledore: Even when the latter was extremely angry over Dumbledore's rejection of his proposal to become DADA'S Professor, despite coming close to, he refrained from drawing his wand and attacking Dumbledore. During the <a href="/wiki/First_Wizarding_War" title="First Wizarding War">First Wizarding War</a>, when confronting <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Severus Snape</a>, who was a very accomplished wizard even then, over the Prophecy, Dumbledore instantly disarmed and grounded him before his adversary could react. During the time when <a href="/wiki/Patricia_Rakepick" title="Patricia Rakepick">Patricia Rakepick</a> was present in Hogwarts, Snape noted that Dumbledore was the only one who could certainly defeat the extremely deadly curse-breaker and even Rakepick appeared to be unwilling to confront Dumbledore directly. <a href="/wiki/Jacob%27s_sibling" title="Jacob's sibling">Jacob's sibling</a>, perhaps the best student duellist, noted that it would be tantamount to suicide to try to infiltrate his office. He swiftly dealt with five werewolves that attacked Hagrid's hut during <a href="/wiki/Fenrir_Greyback%27s_attack_on_Hogwarts" title="Fenrir Greyback's attack on Hogwarts">Fenrir Greyback's attack on Hogwarts</a> without a single scratch. Following the <a href="/wiki/Return_of_Lord_Voldemort" title="Return of Lord Voldemort">Return of Lord Voldemort</a>, upon discovering that one of the teaching staff were in fact a <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eater</a> impersonating ex-Auror <a href="/wiki/Alastor_Moody" title="Alastor Moody">Alastor Moody</a>, Dumbledore quickly blindsided and subdued <a href="/wiki/Bartemius_Crouch_Junior" title="Bartemius Crouch Junior">Bartemius Crouch Junior</a> with a single <a href="/wiki/Stunning_Spell" title="Stunning Spell">Stunning Spell</a> of such power that it blasted apart the magically sealed door to the <a href="/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts_teacher%27s_office" title="Defence Against the Dark Arts teacher's office">Defence Against the Dark Arts Professor's office</a> and immediately floored said Azkaban escapee, knocking him unconscious. During his attempted arrest by the Ministry of Magic during the <a href="/wiki/1995%E2%80%931996_school_year" title="1995–1996 school year">1995–1996 school year</a>, Dumbledore, with a single spell, instantly defeated <a href="/wiki/Cornelius_Fudge" title="Cornelius Fudge">Cornelius Fudge</a>, <a href="/wiki/Dolores_Umbridge" title="Dolores Umbridge">Dolores Umbridge</a>, <a href="/wiki/Kingsley_Shacklebolt" title="Kingsley Shacklebolt">Kingsley Shacklebolt</a>, and <a href="/wiki/John_Dawlish" title="John Dawlish">John Dawlish</a> when they attempted to arrest him (though Kingsley was secretly on Dumbledore's side) and escaped. During the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Department_of_Mysteries" title="Battle of the Department of Mysteries">Battle of the Department of Mysteries</a>, Dumbledore soundly rounded up all of the <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eaters</a> who had earlier managed to avoid capture from the other Order members just before the following <a href="/wiki/Duel_in_the_Ministry_Atrium" title="Duel in the Ministry Atrium">Duel in the Ministry Atrium</a> took place, during which he swiftly incapacitated the extremely powerful Bellatrix Lestrange, one of Lord Voldemort's most dangerous followers. He subsequently calmly duelled Voldemort himself, countering his attacks and responding with such powerful assault as to force the Dark Lord into constant defence before eventually trapping him in an orb or water, forcing him to disapparate and to try and possess Harry to get Dumbledore to mercy kill the boy. Even with his wand hand irreparably injured, he still remained an extremely skilful duelist, as he noted he was fully confident he could repel any attack attempted on him and Harry by Voldemort's followers in case it happened while they travelled to find Slughorn and escort Harry to the Burrow and effortlessly defeated Dawlish again, showing he still could overpower even a seasoned <a href="/wiki/Auror" title="Auror">Auror</a> in his weakened condition rather easily. Dumbledore's duelling style was extremely versatile and dexterous, effortlessly capable of flawlessly adapting to the situation shown during the Battle of the Department of Mysteries, where while fighting the lesser threats posed by the Death Eaters, Dumbledore would simply immediately use powerful magic to incapacitate them, but when fighting the tremendously powerful Dark Lord himself, Dumbledore not only used some of his most powerful spells but also manipulated the environment into securing Bellatrix was out of the fight and Harry was safe, used Fawkes by taking advantage of the latter's immortality to block Voldemort's Killing Curse, and apparating at times to dodge Voldemort's spells before swiftly counter-attacking, a method of duelling that proved considerably efficient when used against the Dark Lord.</li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts" title="Defence Against the Dark Arts">Defence Against the Dark Arts</a></b>: With the subject apparently being his most prominent expertise out of his many magical abilities, Albus Dumbledore held the position of <a href="/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts" title="Defence Against the Dark Arts">Defence Against the Dark Arts</a> Professor at <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry</a> for more than twenty years and excelled to the point of being deemed the best teacher in the whole school during his time teaching the subject, showcasing his expertise in fending off <a href="/wiki/Dark_Arts" title="Dark Arts">Dark Forces</a>, up until Torquil Travers banned Dumbledore from teaching the subject. The full extent of Dumbledore's abilities in this field were perhaps best shown during the uprisings of <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Gellert Grindelwald</a> and <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a>, who were both regarded at the time of their respective rebellions as the most dangerous <a href="/wiki/Dark_wizard" title="Dark wizard">Dark wizard</a> of all time. Not only did popular opinion quickly grow during both conflicts that Albus Dumbledore would be the only one who could possibly put an end to their respective and seemingly unstoppable reigns of terror, but also that both of the aforementioned Dark wizards both feared and acknowledged him as the single greatest threat to their respective causes, and reluctant to challenge him directly. For this reason, those who opposed said dangerous criminals were often quick to rally at his side. Even during peacetime, between the <a href="/wiki/First_Wizarding_War" title="First Wizarding War">First</a> and <a href="/wiki/Second_Wizarding_War" title="Second Wizarding War">Second Wizarding Wars</a>, when a <a href="/wiki/R" title="R">nefarious cabal</a> of <a href="/wiki/Dark_wizard" title="Dark wizard">Dark wizards</a> became active in <a href="/wiki/Great_Britain" title="Great Britain">Britain</a> and sought to unlock the secrets of the fabled <a href="/wiki/Cursed_Vaults" title="Cursed Vaults">Cursed Vaults</a> at any cost, said group tried very hard to keep their operations secret from Dumbledore out of fear that he might decide to stop them if he became aware of their activities.<sup id="cite_ref-114" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-114"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>114<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> His knowledge and ability where <a href="/wiki/Protective_enchantment" title="Protective enchantment">protective enchantments</a> was concerned was perhaps best shown during his time as <a href="/wiki/Headteacher" title="Headteacher">Headmaster</a> of Hogwarts, when he was personally responsible for upholding the magical protections around the school, and many felt that there was no safer place in the world than Hogwarts Castle, which was even said to be more secure than <a href="/wiki/Gringotts_Wizarding_Bank" title="Gringotts Wizarding Bank">Gringotts Wizarding Bank</a>, as the castle's defences were of a standard the likes of which, most likely, no other previous Headmaster had achieved. Indeed, Dumbledore's <a href="/wiki/Defensive_Charm" title="Defensive Charm">defensive spellwork</a> was so powerful and sophisticated that not even Voldemort himself could find a way through them. In addition, Dumbledore was apparently the primary leader of the staff's efforts in containing the damage unleashed by the opening of the <a href="/wiki/Cursed_Vaults" title="Cursed Vaults">Cursed Vaults</a> and the staff noted repeatedly that had Dumbledore not been absent, he could have succeeded, where they had trouble, easily. Dumbledore was also highly accomplished and knowledgeable in fending off Dark creatures, as shown by him successfully mentoring his students, including the unique <a href="/wiki/Newton_Scamander" title="Newton Scamander">Newt Scamander</a>, on how to overcome a <a href="/wiki/Boggart" title="Boggart">Boggart</a>, only failing with <a href="/wiki/Leta_Lestrange" title="Leta Lestrange">Leta Lestrange</a> due to the tremendous guilt she had over her brother's death, and later by his ability to produce an extremely powerful <a href="/wiki/Patronus_Charm" title="Patronus Charm">Patronus Charm</a> capable of single-handedly chasing away all of the <a href="/wiki/Dementor" title="Dementor">Dementors</a> that <a href="/wiki/Cornelius_Fudge" title="Cornelius Fudge">Cornelius Fudge</a> had ordered stationed around Hogwarts without it even being a corporeal one. Dumbledore was also highly familiar with the concept of <a href="/wiki/Inferius" title="Inferius">Inferi</a> and how to defend against them using fire and in addition to thoroughly explaining to Harry Potter how they were created by Voldemort, he was able to swiftly force off the large army of Inferi in the Horcrux Cave with a single Firestorm. Dumbledore was also aware that an <a href="/wiki/Obscurus" title="Obscurus">Obscurus</a> can be potentially healed by replacing the feelings that made that person an <a href="/wiki/Obscurial" title="Obscurial">Obscurial</a> with a sense of love and belonging, hence he gave such advice to <a href="/wiki/Newton_Scamander" title="Newton Scamander">Newt Scamander</a> concerning <a href="/wiki/Credence_Barebone" class="mw-redirect" title="Credence Barebone">Credence</a>. Dumbledore's knowledge and ability to counter the effects of various spells of dark origin was exceptional, to the point where even <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Severus Snape</a>, a long-serving <a href="/wiki/Potions_Master" title="Potions Master">Potions Master</a>, eventual successor in the post of <a href="/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts" title="Defence Against the Dark Arts">Defence Against the Dark Arts</a> instructor and former <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eater</a> with a profound understanding for Dark Magic, repeatedly admitted that Dumbledore's expertise exceeded his own. One such example was when he and Professor McGonagall had to free <a href="/wiki/Ben_Copper" title="Ben Copper">Ben Copper</a> from the <a href="/wiki/Cursed_ice" title="Cursed ice">Cursed ice</a> that resulted from someone tampering with the fabled <a href="/wiki/Cursed_Vaults" title="Cursed Vaults">Cursed Vaults</a> and noted that Dumbledore would have been able to do so far easier than themselves had he been present, and again four years later when he failed to break the curses put on a collection of Dark artefacts belonging to <a href="/wiki/Patricia_Rakepick" title="Patricia Rakepick">Patricia Rakepick</a> and handed them over to Dumbledore; whom he judged to be the only wizard capable of properly handling them.<sup id="cite_ref-115" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-115"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>115<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Years later, he was quick to recognise the attack of <a href="/wiki/Mrs_Norris" title="Mrs Norris">Mrs Norris</a> as a case of <a href="/wiki/Petrification" title="Petrification">petrification</a> rather than <a href="/wiki/Transmogrifian_Torture" title="Transmogrifian Torture">murder</a> after a quick examination of the cat, and knew the only way to undo the attack was to use a Mandrake Restorative Draught after trying to undo it with a spell that should have normally reversed petrification, as well as to quickly identify that the real Moody was under the Imperius Curse and lifted it from him after discovering Crouch had been disguising himself as the seasoned Auror. He also knew that the Killing Curse cannot pass through solid objects, nor truly destroy a Phoenix, and therefore used the Fountain of Magical Brethren's statues and Fawkes to effectively shield himself from Voldemort's Killing Curses during their only known duel. He was also quickly capable of identifying the exceptionally powerful <a href="/wiki/Curse_on_Marvolo_Gaunt%27s_ring" class="mw-redirect" title="Curse on Marvolo Gaunt's ring">curse on Marvolo Gaunt's ring</a> and effectively suppress its effects long enough to return from the village of <a href="/wiki/Little_Hangleton" title="Little Hangleton">Little Hangleton</a> in <a href="/wiki/Yorkshire" title="Yorkshire">Yorkshire</a> to Hogwarts, in spite of his injuries, for further treatment from <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Severus Snape</a>, with him having previously managed to successfully penetrate the many powerful Dark defences set up by Voldemort around the Gaunt Cottage without being harmed and doing the same to all but the enchantment on the Potion of Despair when he invaded the Cave. Uniquely, Dumbledore was even capable of ripping out the piece of Voldemort's soul from the ring in order to destroy it without destroying the Resurrection Stone. His understanding of human nature also allowed him to understand and effectively take advantage of the functions of ancient magic that wards from any treat that few witches and wizards even knew about: taking advantage of the magical protection that lingered over Harry due to <a href="/wiki/Sacrificial_protection" title="Sacrificial protection">his mother's sacrifice</a>, Dumbledore was even able to effectively ensure that for the next sixteen years he would be safe from both Voldemort and his followers as long as he lived where a blood relative of his mother resided, highlighting his knowledge and proficiency in the subject. To further exemplify Dumbledore's exceptionally skill with the understanding and repelling of Dark creatures, he was very skilful in dealing with <a href="/wiki/Werewolf" title="Werewolf">werewolves</a>, as he effortlessly dispatched five werewolves in <a href="/wiki/Hagrid%27s_Hut" title="Hagrid's Hut">Hagrid's Hut</a>, and simply arriving to <a href="/wiki/Jacob%27s_sibling" title="Jacob's sibling">Jacob's sibling</a>'s aid sent the notoriously powerful <a href="/wiki/Fenrir_Greyback" title="Fenrir Greyback">Fenrir Greyback</a> running from Hogwarts. Regardless of his resentment of Dark creatures such as <a href="/wiki/Dementor" title="Dementor">Dementors</a> due to their untrustworthy nature, Dumbledore was still extremely knowledgeable and skilful in their nature and how to deal with them, as he thoroughly explained to Jacob's sibling on Boggarts and why they cannot be destroyed and can only be banished by <a href="/wiki/Boggart-Banishing_Spell" title="Boggart-Banishing Spell">Boggart-Banishing Spell</a>.</li></ul>

<dd>— Dumbledore conjuring his Phoenix Patronus<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire" title="Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire">[src]</a></sup></dd>
