<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Charm" title="Charm">Charms</a></b>: Albus was known to be extremely accomplished in <a href="/wiki/Charm" title="Charm">Charms</a> even as a young man as articles that he wrote about the branch of magic were published in the scholarly journal <i><a href="/wiki/Challenges_in_Charming" title="Challenges in Charming">Challenges in Charming</a></i> and his N.E.W.T examiners Professor Marchbanks was so impressed by his display during his Charms N.E.W.T Exam that he said that Dumbledore "did things with a wand that [she] had never seen before". He also earned the <a href="/wiki/Barnabus_Finkley_Prize_for_Exceptional_Spell-Casting" title="Barnabus Finkley Prize for Exceptional Spell-Casting">Barnabus Finkley Prize for Exceptional Spell-Casting</a> and could already cast such a strong <a href="/wiki/Disillusionment_Charm" title="Disillusionment Charm">Disillusionment Charm</a> that he was effectively able to render himself invisible without needing an Invisibility Cloak, which was a tremendous feat.<sup id="cite_ref-TOBTB_116-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-TOBTB-116"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>116<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> As an adult, Dumbledore's mastery of Charms was sufficient to earn him the illustrious title of <a href="/wiki/Grand_Sorcerer" title="Grand Sorcerer">Grand Sorcerer</a>. His proficiency in the incredibly complex Patronus Charm was so advanced that he was able to devise new uses for this charm, allowing it to be used as a form of communication (with the caster speaking with their own voice through the Patronus).<sup id="cite_ref-GOF_59-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-GOF-59"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>59<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Dumbledore was also capable of effectively performing the extremely complex <a href="/wiki/Fidelius_Charm" title="Fidelius Charm">Fidelius Charm</a>, acting as the Secret Keeper to <a href="/wiki/12_Grimmauld_Place" title="12 Grimmauld Place">12 Grimmauld Place</a> after it was made the Headquarters of the Order of Phoenix. He was even capable of performing the extremely powerful and ancient <a href="/wiki/Bond_of_blood_charm" title="Bond of blood charm">bond of blood charm</a> to further ensure Harry's protection from Voldemort for 17 years while he lived with his aunt, <a href="/wiki/Petunia_Dursley" title="Petunia Dursley">Petunia Dursley</a>. He could easily perform the <a href="/wiki/Portkey_Spell" title="Portkey Spell">Portkey Spell</a> successfully to create Portkeys, using it to turn a black kettle in his office to a Portkey that sent Harry and the Weasley children to Grimmauld Place and later the head of the golden wizard statue into a Portkey that took Harry back to Hogwarts. Even without the Deluminator, Dumbledore could easily put out light sources with an unknown charm, which he could do twice while in his office and also while announcing the Triwizard Champions with a mere gesture and seemed to have been the one who enchanted the device with such ability. He also was responsible for the additional charm cast on the Deluminator that allowed it to guide Ron back to Harry and Hermione after he left. He could cast a variety of powerful and unique enchantments, shown when he enchanted the <a href="/wiki/Mirror_of_Erised" title="Mirror of Erised">Mirror of Erised</a> to only give the <a href="/wiki/Philosopher%27s_Stone" title="Philosopher's Stone">Philosopher's Stone</a> to a person who wished to find it but not to use it, which held firm even against Quirrell when he had both the knowledge of Voldemort and his own experience, which had allowed him to easily bypass the other enchantments put in place to protect the artefact, manifested a hand to Newt's location capable of taking Newt to Dumbledore's location and conjured a thick mist capable of hiding him and Newt from magical detection in order to prevent the Ministry from locating them. Dumbledore's mastery and knowledge of all forms of defensive charms was unparalleled, as while he was Headmaster of Hogwarts, Dumbledore was in charge of controlling the protective measures of the castle and the standard of his magic was so strong that not even Voldemort could breach them, with Hogwarts thus being considered the safest it had ever been with Dumbledore in charge. He could easily lift and recast them, evidenced when he temporarily lifted the <a href="/wiki/Anti-Apparition_Charm" title="Anti-Apparition Charm">Anti-Apparition Charm</a> to allow the students to learn how to <a href="/wiki/Apparition" title="Apparition">Apparate</a>. He was also capable of locking doors to prevent them from being opened by seemingly any means apart from Dumbledore himself undoing the enchantment, as he did to further made it look like Harry and Hermione had not done anything to help Sirius escape and Hermione feared the idea of Dumbledore locking the doors of the Hospital Wing before they could get there after succeeding, with Snape and Fudge only able to access the door, despite Snape's rage and Fudge's exasperation, when Dumbledore calmly let them in, and later enchanting the entrance door to Hogwarts to be impenetrable to the <a href="/wiki/Unlocking_Charm" title="Unlocking Charm">Unlocking Charm</a> and making the walls reject any attempt of anyone to climb up. He also was able to cast a powerful <a href="/wiki/Age_Line" title="Age Line">Age Line</a> around the <a href="/wiki/Goblet_of_Fire" title="Goblet of Fire">Goblet of Fire</a> to ensure no one under the age of 17 could cross, with it being such a flawless enchantment that in addition to being humorously enchanted to both repel Ageing Potions and cause those who had used them to cross the line to grow beards, McGonagall adamantly defended that the Age Line Dumbledore had put had no flaws in it when the under-aged Harry Potter became Hogwarts's second champion, with Barty Crouch, while disguised as Moody, therefore being forced to risk exposure by putting Harry's name into the Goblet of Fire personally. He also understood the nature of the Goblet of Fire perfectly, acknowledging that there was no way for them to prevent Harry from competing after he had been chosen, and was able to easily unlock the chest containing the magical object by tapping it three times. As Headmaster, he was also able to control the protective spells around the school, such as when he lifted some of these spells so he and <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a> could breach the perimeter on a broomstick. Dumbledore was also able to cast the Shield Charm with great skill and strength, as he was able to effortlessly deflect destructive attacks from Credence, even casually maintaining the shield despite Credence advancing on him and keeping it until he overpowered the attack, and easily deflected a spell from Grindelwald. Dumbledore often extracted his memories and put them inside his Pensieve and was able to project the image of his memory regarding the Prophecy of the Chosen One from it for Harry to see. In order to entrance the sharp Mrs Cole, Dumbledore non-verbally cast the very complex <a href="/wiki/Confundus_Charm" title="Confundus Charm">Confundus Charm</a> with ease to successfully confound her into believing the blank paper was sufficient to allow a talk between them, a noteworthy feat as even the very skilled and powerful <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Severus Snape</a> had trouble using the advanced charm. He also was capable of inserting the Resurrection Stone into the Snitch he gave Harry and enchanting it to only reveal itself when Harry was about to make the ultimate sacrifice, preventing any attempt from Harry to open it. His mastery of the <a href="/wiki/Human-presence-revealing_Spell" title="Human-presence-revealing Spell">Human-presence-revealing Spell</a> was very potent, having been the only wizard seen thus far capable of penetrating the powerful magic of the <a href="/wiki/Cloak_of_Invisibility" title="Cloak of Invisibility">Cloak of Invisibility</a>, henceforth successfully sensing the presence of Harry Potter and Ron Weasley while they had the Cloak on. He was proficient enough in the <a href="/wiki/Slowing_Charm" title="Slowing Charm">Slowing Charm</a> to perform it quickly and without his wand to slow down Harry Potter's swift descent after he was knocked off his broom by the Dementors effectively enough to make him land without any injuries, not even breaking his glass, which Harry's friends commented on, and was able to levitate and carry the stretcher holding Harry's unconscious body all the way back to school without strain for further treatment from Madam Pomfrey. He also effortlessly summoned the names of the Champions of the Triwizard Tournament with a simple gesture, showing he could easily cast simple charms without needing his wand but preferred to do so with it. This was also shown years before, where Dumbledore levitated the vial containing the blood pact between him and Gellert without even needing to gesture, simply through sheer will. In addition, Dumbledore swiftly summoned the sofa in the house of the Dursleys in order to force them to sit on it, enchanted the glasses he filled with Rosmerta's mead to stay suspended in mid-air and repeatedly knock over the Dursleys, and transported the belongings of Harry Potter to the Burrow with ease. In the film, Dumbledore unleashed such a powerful <a href="/wiki/Disarming_Charm" title="Disarming Charm">Disarming Charm</a> to blast down the door to Crouch's office while he was disguised as Moody and send the fake Moody flying a considerable distance away, the impact of him hitting the nearby chair being enough to make the chair stumble backwards and stun him long enough for Dumbledore to breach the distance between them. He simultaneously disarmed and grounded Severus Snape when meeting with him with a single Disarming Charm. He was also able to cast an unknown charm that effortlessly pulled back a fleeing Death Eater during the Battle of the Department of Mysteries. Dumbledore could cast a seemingly modified version of the <a href="/wiki/Silencing_Charm" title="Silencing Charm">Silencing Charm</a> that instead of silencing a target, made the surrounding environment's natural events happen without causing any sound and seemingly rendered any sound coming from the area unable to be heard by all but the ones standing in said place, as he did to ensure he and Severus Snape were not disturbed when they conversed about Snape relaying the Prophecy to Voldemort. In addition to making normal use of the <a href="/wiki/Wand-Lighting_Charm" title="Wand-Lighting Charm">Wand-Lighting Charm</a> for light in the dark areas of the Horcrux Cave and Forbidden Forest, Dumbledore was also able to throw the light created by the charm at the centre of the ocean to light the whole cave up. Dumbledore was also very accomplished with the <i><a href="/wiki/Piertotum_Locomotor" class="mw-redirect" title="Piertotum Locomotor">Piertotum Locomotor</a></i> Charm, as he was able to do so seamlessly and in an instant with ease to animate and manipulate the statues of the Fountain of Magical Brethren during his duel with Voldemort. Dumbledore was also able to skilfully perform the <a href="/wiki/Reviving_Spell" title="Reviving Spell">Reviving Spell</a>, as he instantly un-stunned Viktor Krum after Barty Crouch Jnr knocked him out and even managed to partially revive the latter from an extremely powerful Stunning Spell he had unleashed while taking care to not revive him enough to allow Crouch any chance to resist. He warmed up Harry and dried his clothes upon noticing the latter was shivering with a single spell. When playing the <a href="/wiki/Hoggy_Warty_Hogwarts" title="Hoggy Warty Hogwarts">Hoggy Warty Hogwarts</a> song, Dumbledore was capable of simultaneously making the entire school rumble.</li></ul>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">"<i>Dumbledore brandished his wand in one, long, fluid movement — the snake, which had been an instant from sinking its fangs into him, flew high into the air and vanished in a wisp of dark smoke.</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— Dumbledore performing the <a href="/wiki/Snake-Vanishing_Spell" title="Snake-Vanishing Spell">Snake-Vanishing Spell</a> during the <a href="/wiki/Duel_in_the_Ministry_Atrium" title="Duel in the Ministry Atrium">Duel in the Ministry Atrium</a><sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Transfiguration" title="Transfiguration">Transfiguration</a></b>: Dumbledore was known to be highly accomplished and knowledgeable in the incredibly complex art of Transfiguration even before graduating, as his knowledge and proficiency on the subject was already sufficient for him to be allowed to submit some papers to the <a href="/wiki/Transfiguration_Today" title="Transfiguration Today">Transfiguration Today</a>, all of which, particularly his pages on <a href="/wiki/Trans-Species_Transformation" title="Trans-Species Transformation">Trans-Species Transformation</a>, were of a remarkably high standard, to the point that <a href="/wiki/Bathilda_Bagshot" title="Bathilda Bagshot">Bathilda Bagshot</a> was impressed enough to contact him and his N.E.W.T. Examiner <a href="/wiki/Griselda_Marchbanks" title="Griselda Marchbanks">Professor Marchbanks</a> was so impressed by his display during his Transfiguration N.E.W.T. Exam, that she would note that Dumbledore had performed transfiguration magic that "[she] had never seen before." As an adult, Transfiguration had become one of Dumbledore's most prominent areas of expertise, as ever since he was banned from teaching <a href="/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts" title="Defence Against the Dark Arts">Defence Against the Dark Arts</a> by <a href="/wiki/Torquil_Travers" title="Torquil Travers">Torquil Travers</a>, Dumbledore chose Transfiguration as his next subject to teach and did so magnificently enough to quickly be promoted to the <a href="/wiki/Head_of_Transfiguration" title="Head of Transfiguration">Head of Transfiguration</a> department of the school, holding the position up for many years to come until his ascending to the position of Headmaster of the School. He was seemingly deemed the greatest teacher of the field in Hogwarts's history, as Harry Potter stated Dumbledore had been the best while only aware of Dumbledore's career as Professor of Transfiguration and having also trained the especially talented Minerva McGonagall into becoming an excellent master of the field and his successor later on. In addition, Dumbledore had been a famously regular and successful columnist to the Transfiguration Today to the point his contribution was deemed good enough to be published among the news of <a href="/wiki/Daily_Prophet" title="Daily Prophet">Daily Prophet</a>. He was quite knowledgeable in the field of Animagus Transformation, having successfully guided Minerva McGonagall into becoming one at the age of seventeen, despite the notorious difficulty and known dangers of that ability. Dumbledore was particularly proficient in <a href="/wiki/Conjuration" title="Conjuration">Conjuration</a> and also accomplished in <a href="/wiki/Vanishment" title="Vanishment">Vanishment</a>, as he could effortlessly and non-verbally conjure a stretcher to transport the unconscious Harry, several hats for the charmed skeletons he enchanted for <a href="/wiki/Hallowe%27en_Feast" class="mw-redirect" title="Hallowe'en Feast">Hallowe'en Feast</a> Entertainment that he easily vanished upon finishing, hundreds of squishy purple bags to accommodate the Gryffindor students in the <a href="/wiki/Great_Hall" title="Great Hall">Great Hall</a> when <a href="/wiki/Sirius_Black%27s_break-in_of_Hogwarts_Castle_(1993)" title="Sirius Black's break-in of Hogwarts Castle (1993)">Sirius Black broke into the Castle</a>, two armchairs for <a href="/wiki/Arabella_Figg" title="Arabella Figg">Mrs Figg</a> and himself to sit on during <a href="/wiki/Disciplinary_hearing_of_Harry_Potter" title="Disciplinary hearing of Harry Potter">Harry's disciplinary hearing</a>, at one instance quickly vanishing the container of the <a href="/wiki/Goblet_of_Fire" title="Goblet of Fire">Goblet of Fire</a>, a tea tray when the trio came to visit Hagrid, several glasses and a bottle containing Rosmerta's mead, which he later on easily vanished, a bottle of gin and several glasses to accommodate Cole, and a goblet to drink the <a href="/wiki/Emerald_Potion" title="Emerald Potion">Emerald Potion</a>. His mastery of Transfiguration allowed him to make very good use of it in combat, as shown when Dumbledore seamlessly cast the <a href="/wiki/Piertotum_Locomotor" class="mw-redirect" title="Piertotum Locomotor">Piertotum Locomotor</a> spell to animate the statues of the Fountain of Magical Brethren to subdue Bellatrix, protect Harry and repel Voldemort's curses and conjured a large rope of fire that Voldemort had to transfigure into a snake to repel the attack, which Dumbledore easily vanished, during <a href="/wiki/Duel_in_the_Ministry_Atrium" title="Duel in the Ministry Atrium">his duel with the Dark Lord</a>. He also effortlessly transformed the banners of the Great Hall from representing <a href="/wiki/Slytherin" title="Slytherin">Slytherin</a> to <a href="/wiki/Gryffindor" title="Gryffindor">Gryffindor</a> with a mere clap of his hands. Dumbledore also had an uncanny knack for immediately figuring out and countering Transfiguration spells done by others, as shown by how he quickly deduced <a href="/wiki/Horace_Slughorn" title="Horace Slughorn">Horace Slughorn</a> had turned himself into a chair and easily undid it with a simple jab of his wand and later on casually figured out the beetle watching over him and Jacob's Sibling as being <a href="/wiki/Rita_Skeeter" title="Rita Skeeter">Rita Skeeter</a> using her Animagus power and called her out on it to make her revert back to her true form. He presumably also undid the transfiguration spell that McGonagall used on the <a href="/wiki/Chessboard_Chamber" title="Chessboard Chamber">Chessboard Chamber</a> to quickly pass through them and get to Harry on time. In order to sing the school song, Dumbledore conjured and animated a ribbon that he twisted to form the lyrics into the air.</li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/Potion" title="Potion">Potions</a></b>: Dumbledore was also considerably knowledgeable and accomplished in Potions, even while still young, as while still a student, he published good papers in <i><a href="/wiki/The_Practical_Potioneer" title="The Practical Potioneer">The Practical Potioneer</a></i>, an academic journal regarding Potions, according to <a href="/wiki/Elphias_Doge" title="Elphias Doge">Elphias Doge</a>. He showed thorough knowledge and understanding of the properties of Love Potion, as he understood that Love Potion merely brought upon the sensation of obsessive love rather than true love, and also the Mandrake Restorative Draught's potent healing properties, which allowed him to have Sprout and Snape begin producing it as the only way to reverse the Petrification caused by the Basilisk inside the Chamber of Secrets. He instantly recognised the drink inside Moody's hip-flask that Crouch used to drink unsuspected as the Polyjuice Potion and knew about <a href="/wiki/Veritaserum" title="Veritaserum">Veritaserum</a>'s inability to overcome the defences of expert Occlumens, thus first stunning Barty Crouch Jnr before having him exposed to the Truth Potion in order to ensure he could not resist it, with Dumbledore notably requesting the strongest batch of Veritaserum in order to further maximise Crouch's inability to overcome it. Dumbledore expressed confidence he could brew the Truth Potion for himself if he desired to use it against Horace Slughorn to make him confess the real memory but Horace's Occlumency and ability to make an antidote for it made it null. He also was able to easily recognise the <a href="/wiki/Ageing_Potion" title="Ageing Potion">Ageing Potion</a> as being the primary method under-aged students would use to submit their names to the <a href="/wiki/Goblet_of_Fire" title="Goblet of Fire">Goblet of Fire</a> by physically ageing themselves to overcome his <a href="/wiki/Age_Line" title="Age Line">Age Line</a> and therefore seamlessly created counters to it to seemingly increase the potion's effects to the point of ageing youngsters enough to make their hair white and give them magnificent beards. In addition, it was quite likely that Dumbledore was the one who instructed Minerva McGonagall on how to brew the complex <a href="/wiki/Animagus_potion" title="Animagus potion">Animagus potion</a> that was needed to become an Animagi and may have even been the one who brewed it for her. He also quickly measured the quality of the <a href="/wiki/Wit-Sharpening_Potion" title="Wit-Sharpening Potion">Wit-Sharpening Potion</a> Merula presented before him and Snape as being the best one he had ever seen and should <a href="/wiki/Jacob%27s_sibling" title="Jacob's sibling">Jacob's sibling</a> disguise himself as Potion Master Snape to expose Merula's lies as it was actually Penny Haywood who made the potion, Dumbledore would calmly level with them regarding the Potions curriculum and could detect that by the time they had exposed Merula's lies, the Potion had begun to wear off and thus allow them to leave before they could be caught for it. It was likely that when he went to the <a href="/wiki/Underground_Chambers" title="Underground Chambers">Underground Chambers</a>, he had no trouble figuring out which one was the <a href="/wiki/Fire_Protection_Potion" title="Fire Protection Potion">Fire Protection Potion</a> needed to pass through the <a href="/wiki/Black_flames" title="Black flames">Black flames</a> Snape had conjured up unharmed and save Harry.</li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/Occlumency" title="Occlumency">Occlumency</a> and <a href="/wiki/Legilimency" title="Legilimency">Legilimency</a></b>: Dumbledore was also impeccably adept in both <a href="/wiki/Occlumency" title="Occlumency">Occlumency</a> and <a href="/wiki/Legilimency" title="Legilimency">Legilimency</a>. Capable of using Legilimency without needing to use his wand or speak the incantation, many people, particularly Harry Potter, often noted that Dumbledore sometimes seemed to see right into their mind and correctly decipher what they were thinking.<sup id="cite_ref-OOTP_64-17" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OOTP-64"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>64<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> However, some of Lord Voldemort's followers, such as Barty Crouch Jnr, and his staff members, such as Horace Slughorn, proved to be excellent Occlumens capable of effectively hiding their thoughts from him. His skill in Legilimency was great enough that he was capable of extracting the true version of modified memories even if it was powerfully done, coaxing out from <a href="/wiki/Morfin_Gaunt" title="Morfin Gaunt">Morfin Gaunt</a> and later <a href="/wiki/Hokey" title="Hokey">Hokey</a> the true version of the memories that Voldemort used powerful magic to falsify, something which he said needed a "great deal of skilled Legilimency" to accomplish, although he did admit that he was not able to do so without difficulty. He also trained <a href="/wiki/Jacob_(Hogwarts_expellee)" title="Jacob (Hogwarts expellee)">Jacob</a>, a natural Legilimens, in the art. Dumbledore's skill in Occlumency was so great that he was among the very few (together with <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Gellert Grindelwald</a> and <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Severus Snape</a>) skilled enough in the art to conceal thoughts from Voldemort himself, who was the most powerful Legilimens of all time. At one point, he noted to Harry that he was confident that he was capable enough in Occlumency to train him to successfully to resist Voldemort but due to his fear of Voldemort's reaction to their closeness, he made the ill-fated decision of appointing Snape to train Harry. He could also lower his staunch mind defence enough to allow a lesser Legilimens to enter his mind but still limiting what they could see, enabling <a href="/wiki/Jacob%27s_sibling" title="Jacob's sibling">Jacob's sibling</a> to enter his mind but preventing them from seeing too much.</li></ul>

<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Wandless_magic" title="Wandless magic">Wandless</a> and <a href="/wiki/Nonverbal_spell" title="Nonverbal spell">non-verbal</a> magic</b>: Albus was highly proficient at both non-verbal and wandless magic, both of which were highly advanced and difficult to perform; his prowess was great enough for him to be fully capable of using both simultaneously.<sup id="cite_ref-PS_8-8" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PS-8"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>8<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> While some people, such as <a href="/wiki/Antonin_Dolohov" title="Antonin Dolohov">Antonin Dolohov</a>, as seen during the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Department_of_Mysteries" title="Battle of the Department of Mysteries">Battle of the Department of Mysteries</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-OOTP_64-18" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OOTP-64"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>64<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> seemed to produce lesser magic when using it non-verbally, Dumbledore was capable of extraordinary feats such as <a href="/wiki/Sleeping_bag_conjuring_spell" class="mw-redirect" title="Sleeping bag conjuring spell">conjuring</a> hundreds of squishy purple sleeping bags to accommodate the students of Hogwarts, without saying a word.<sup id="cite_ref-POA_57-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-POA-57"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>57<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> During the Ending Feast in 1992, he only had to clap his hands to transform the banners of the Great Hall from Slytherin to Gryffindor. In addition, during the Welcome Feast in 1993, he extinguished and lit a candle with a mere wave of his hand. While in <a href="/wiki/The_Cave" title="The Cave">The Cave</a>, Dumbledore easily foiled the defences set up by Lord Voldemort using only wandless and nonverbal magic. He later cast the Freezing Charm nonverbally to keep Harry unable to intervene in his death. He could cast the <a href="/wiki/Human-presence-revealing_Spell" title="Human-presence-revealing Spell">Human-presence-revealing Spell</a> wandlessly and nonverbally. He also duelled Voldemort and defeated the Death Eaters during the Battle of the Department of Mysteries without ever uttering any incantation.<sup id="cite_ref-OOTP_64-19" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OOTP-64"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>64<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He was also able to dim the Great Hall's light sources and summon the names of the Champions of the <a href="/wiki/Triwizard_Tournament" title="Triwizard Tournament">Triwizard Tournament</a> to his hand. He even set Riddle's Wardrobe to fire without bothering to look. With sheer will, while having his Admonitors vanished by Theseus, Dumbledore kept the blood pact vial levitated without even having to look or wave his hand.</li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/Dark_Arts" title="Dark Arts">Dark Arts</a></b>: While not an active practitioner of the Dark Arts, and seldom ever known to have used Dark spells of any kind, Dumbledore was nevertheless exceptionally talented in the field of magic, with <a href="/wiki/Minerva_McGonagall" title="Minerva McGonagall">Minerva McGonagall</a>, a long-time colleague of Dumbledore who knew him for most of her life, even insinuating at one point that Dumbledore was fully capable of utilising the same destructive Dark powers that <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a> wielded, but that he chose not to do so, being "too noble to use them". Dumbledore's extensive knowledge on the topic of Dark Magic allowed him to fully understand the scarcely known and extremely advanced magic used to create <a href="/wiki/Horcrux" title="Horcrux">Horcruxes</a>, and he was able to quickly identify that Mrs Norris had been <a href="/wiki/Petrification" title="Petrification">petrified</a> upon a brief inspection, whereas others incorrectly believed the cat to be dead when they found her lifeless body. Even while limited by his good nature, Dumbledore still proved to be quite capable of casting powerful hexes and jinxes, as shown when he swiftly incapacitated <a href="/wiki/Cornelius_Fudge" title="Cornelius Fudge">Fudge</a>, <a href="/wiki/Dolores_Umbridge" title="Dolores Umbridge">Umbridge</a>, <a href="/wiki/John_Dawlish" title="John Dawlish">Dawlish</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Kingsley_Shacklebolt" title="Kingsley Shacklebolt">Kingsley</a> with a powerful hex that emitted a streak of silver light and was described as having the force of a gunshot and caused the floor to tremble when they tried to arrest him and later easily jinxed Dawlish once again when tailed by him. He seemed to have the capability to perform the <a href="/wiki/Killing_Curse" title="Killing Curse">Killing Curse</a>, as <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Severus Snape</a> feared Dumbledore was going to kill him after he had been disarmed and brought to his knees by the headmaster when straying too close to the school during his time as a <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eater</a>.</li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/Spell_creation" title="Spell creation">Spell creation</a></b>: Dumbledore was known for his ability to create unique magical spells and devices and modify already existing spells. He was the inventor of the <a href="/wiki/Deluminator" title="Deluminator">Deluminator</a>, which was considered to be unique. Not only could it remove light sources from the Deluminator's immediate surroundings, as well as bestow them, after it had been bequeathed to Ron Weasley, he discovered that he could sometimes hear Harry and Hermione's voices through it, and that it also allowed him to Apparate to their location, a function that Dumbledore likely added before his death. He also developed a method to communicate using <a href="/wiki/Patronus_Charm" title="Patronus Charm">Patronus Charms</a>, which he taught to the members of the <a href="/wiki/Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Order of the Phoenix">Order of the Phoenix</a>.</li></ul>

<ul><li><b>Elemental magic mastery</b>: Dumbledore was extremely capable in using magic to manipulate the elements, especially fire, water and wind, although he seemed to prefer the former, for both combative and supplementary purposes, as it seems that when straying away from more conventional combative spellwork, Dumbledore would skilfully use the power of the elements to attack his adversary. In order to converse secretly with Newt Scamander, Dumbledore combined both water and wind to form a thick mist and easily dispersed it after he had finished. He displayed particularly incredible skill in controlling fire, as shown when he easily set ablaze Riddle's wardrobe <a href="/wiki/Flame-Freezing_Charm" title="Flame-Freezing Charm">without actually burning anything</a> in order to display his wizarding powers to him and was able to generate a ring of fire to hold off a throng of <a href="/wiki/Inferius" title="Inferius">Inferi</a> in the Horcrux Cave, which was potent enough to remain unquenchable by the vast ocean that surrounded them.<sup id="cite_ref-HBP_48-19" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP-48"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>48<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He was also capable of conjuring the everlasting <a href="/wiki/Gubraithian_Fire" title="Gubraithian Fire">Gubraithian Fire</a>, an incredibly advanced piece of magic that extreme few could accomplish, greatly impressing <a href="/wiki/Hermione_Granger" title="Hermione Granger">Hermione Granger</a>. In his duel against Voldemort, he used a <a href="/wiki/Fire_rope" title="Fire rope">fiery rope</a> that managed to overshadow the silver shield Voldemort had conjured, forcing him to transfigure it in order to repel the attack, and <a href="/wiki/Orb_of_Water" title="Orb of Water">easily manipulated</a> the considerable amount of water contained inside the <a href="/wiki/Fountain_of_Magical_Brethren" title="Fountain of Magical Brethren">Fountain of Magical Brethren</a> to rise up and cover Voldemort "like a cocoon of molten glass".<sup id="cite_ref-OOTP_64-20" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OOTP-64"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>64<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><b>Magical multilingualism</b>: Dumbledore had an uncanny expertise in mastering many foreign magical languages, as not only could he speak <a href="/wiki/Mermish" title="Mermish">Mermish</a><sup id="cite_ref-GOF_59-7" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-GOF-59"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>59<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> and <a href="/wiki/Gobbledegook" title="Gobbledegook">Gobbledegook</a>, but he was even among the very few able to recognise and understand <a href="/wiki/Parseltongue" title="Parseltongue">Parseltongue</a>, the language of snakes, as while he and Harry were inside Bob Ogden's stored memory, he instantly recognised that Marvolo was speaking Parseltongue whereas Harry didn't even realise until Dumbledore pointed it out; he was able to quote verbatim a Parseltongue phrase uttered by Morfin Gaunt in a later stored memory, implying at least a level of ability to speak it.<sup id="cite_ref-HBP_48-20" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP-48"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>48<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/Alchemy" title="Alchemy">Alchemy</a></b>: Apparently having always been highly gifted in the ancient magical science art of Alchemy since his youth, as a student, Dumbledore was already capable enough to earn the interest of <a href="/wiki/Nicolas_Flamel" title="Nicolas Flamel">Nicolas Flamel</a>, who was considered to be the greatest Alchemist in history, being henceforth famous for his correspondence with the famous Alchemist while still a student, and having also won the <a href="/wiki/Gold_Medal_for_Ground-Breaking_Contribution_to_the_International_Alchemical_Conference" title="Gold Medal for Ground-Breaking Contribution to the International Alchemical Conference">Gold Medal for Ground-Breaking Contribution to the International Alchemical Conference</a> during his participation of the event in Cairo. By the time he was an adult, Alchemy was one of Dumbledore's most famous areas of expertise and he contributed considerably to the advancement of the subject alongside his old friend Flamel.</li>
<li><b>Magical chemistry</b>: Dumbledore also had a great deal of knowledge on magical substances, particularly the substance of <a href="/wiki/Dragon_blood" title="Dragon blood">Dragon's blood</a>, as he was considered the foremost expert of it and managed to discover twelve ways to use it practically, among them as a spot remover, as an oven cleaner, and for a potion ingredient. His knowledge and experience in the study of Dragon Blood also allowed him to easily distinguish it from <a href="/wiki/Human" title="Human">human</a> <a href="/wiki/Blood" title="Blood">blood</a> by tasting a small amount of it.</li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/Magical_Law" class="mw-redirect" title="Magical Law">Magical Law</a> expertise</b>: Dumbledore displayed outstanding knowledge of the laws of the wizarding world, owning several books in his office concerning it. His expertise in the law allowed him to successfully clear <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a> of all charges during his trial for underaged magic when he used a Patronus to defend himself. He also managed to give a convincing enough defence of <a href="/wiki/Morfin_Gaunt" title="Morfin Gaunt">Morfin Gaunt</a>'s innocence in the murder of <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle_Senior" title="Tom Riddle Senior">Tom Riddle Senior</a> and the rest of the <a href="/wiki/Riddle_family" title="Riddle family">Riddle family</a> after acquiring the memory that proved it that he would have successfully convinced the Ministry into letting out Morfin had Morfin not died first in Azkaban. He also displayed his knowledge when taking Harry with him to persuade Slughorn in which he showed full confidence his permission would be enough to allow Harry to use underage magic should there be an attack and lectured Harry on how they could not just apparate to his old friend's house due to the laws banning it.</li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/Care_of_Magical_Creatures" title="Care of Magical Creatures">Care of Magical Creatures</a></b>: Dumbledore's knowledge and understanding of many magical creatures was very thorough, even being sufficient to be comparable to outstanding masters of the subject of the level of <a href="/wiki/Newton_Scamander" title="Newton Scamander">Newton Scamander</a> and <a href="/wiki/Rubeus_Hagrid" title="Rubeus Hagrid">Rubeus Hagrid</a>. This was shown when he was aware of the old <a href="/wiki/Dumbledore_family" title="Dumbledore family">Dumbledore family</a> legend of a <a href="/wiki/Phoenix" title="Phoenix">Phoenix</a> coming to any one of them in desperate need being true, and quickly understood how Newt's pet <a href="/wiki/Niffler" title="Niffler">Niffler</a> had stolen the <a href="/wiki/Blood_pact" title="Blood pact">blood pact</a> vial from <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Grindelwald</a>. He alongside Hagrid were aware of how to get past <a href="/wiki/Fluffy" title="Fluffy">Fluffy</a>, something that not even <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Severus Snape</a> or <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a>, both highly intelligent and knowledgeable wizards, knew about, with <a href="/wiki/Quirinus_Quirrell" title="Quirinus Quirrell">Quirinus Quirrell</a>, who had knowledge and experience in handling dangerous magical creatures, having to get it from the drunk Hagrid under Voldemort's orders. Dumbledore was also extremely adept at communicating with all sorts of magical creatures, such as <a href="/wiki/Phoenix" title="Phoenix">Phoenixes</a>, <a href="/wiki/Thestral" title="Thestral">Thestrals</a>, <a href="/wiki/Merperson" title="Merperson">Merpeople</a>, <a href="/wiki/Centaur" title="Centaur">Centaurs</a>, and gained much respect from them as a result. His pet Phoenix <a href="/wiki/Fawkes" title="Fawkes">Fawkes</a> was extremely loyal to him, and even managed to use him in combat in the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Department_of_Mysteries" title="Battle of the Department of Mysteries">Battle of the Department of Mysteries</a> to fight Voldemort. He successfully communicated with the Merpeople of the Black Lake to learn the progress of the Second Task of the Triwizard Tournament. He was also notably one of the few wizards that the <a href="/wiki/Forbidden_Forest_Centaur_colony" class="mw-redirect" title="Forbidden Forest Centaur colony">Forbidden Forest Centaur colony</a> respected and trusted, enough that Dumbledore was able to convince them to return Umbridge safely without any harm done to him. Both the Centaurs and the Merpeople later paid their respects during Dumbledore's funeral, showing their immense respect for him. Dumbledore also was a famous contributor to the defence of <a href="/wiki/Giant" title="Giant">Giants</a> from wizarding violence, with his reputation being enough to make <a href="/wiki/Karkus" title="Karkus">Karkus</a> consider aiding the <a href="/wiki/Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Order of the Phoenix">Order of the Phoenix</a> and his ability to give Hagrid the gifts and instruction necessary to steadily convince the giant colony, up until <a href="/wiki/Golgomath" title="Golgomath">Golgomath</a> killed Karkus, with his advice still managing to convince the surviving giants who didn't join Golgomath to not join the Death Eaters. He also was one of the few wizards and witches who interacted with <a href="/wiki/House-elf" title="House-elf">house-elves</a> with kindness and compassion, giving <a href="/wiki/Dobby" title="Dobby">Dobby</a> and <a href="/wiki/Winky" title="Winky">Winky</a> jobs at Hogwarts and encouraging Harry to treat <a href="/wiki/Kreacher" title="Kreacher">Kreacher</a> kindlier. When Hagrid and Kettleburn unleashed a large number of creatures upon Hogwarts, Dumbledore easily dealt with the many <a href="/wiki/Bowtruckle" title="Bowtruckle">Bowtruckles</a> in the faculty seats of the Great Hall, showing he was also able to proficiently deal with small magical creatures, as well as large ones.</li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/History_of_Magic" title="History of Magic">History of Magic</a></b>: Dumbledore had excellent knowledge of magical history and lore, having been well-known for his correspondence with the famous historian <a href="/wiki/Bathilda_Bagshot" title="Bathilda Bagshot">Bathilda Bagshot</a> while still young, with particular specialisation in the portions of it that pertained to powerful magical artefacts, such as the <a href="/wiki/Deathly_Hallows" title="Deathly Hallows">Deathly Hallows</a>, from his time studying them with <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Gellert Grindelwald</a> due to their shared obsession of the Hallows. As such, Dumbledore was able to identify <a href="/wiki/James_Potter_(I)" title="James Potter (I)">James Potter</a>'s <a href="/wiki/Invisibility_Cloak" title="Invisibility Cloak">Invisibility Cloak</a> as the legendary <a href="/wiki/Cloak_of_Invisibility" title="Cloak of Invisibility">Cloak of Invisibility</a> of the Hallows and could see that the Gaunt Ring was the Resurrection Stone. In addition, Dumbledore was able to easily correctly recite the contents of the historical divination poetic book <i><a href="/wiki/The_Predictions_of_Tycho_Dodonus" title="The Predictions of Tycho Dodonus">The Predictions of Tycho Dodonus</a></i>, when questioned by <a href="/wiki/Torquil_Travers" title="Torquil Travers">Torquil Travers</a>. He also had thorough knowledge of the history of the <a href="/wiki/Triwizard_Tournament" title="Triwizard Tournament">Triwizard Tournament</a>, henceforth effectively explaining the reason why it was initially decided the Tournament would no longer be held. Having been one of the few to ever acquire the first-edition copy of <i><a href="/wiki/The_Tales_of_Beedle_the_Bard" title="The Tales of Beedle the Bard">The Tales of Beedle the Bard</a></i> and also having translated and read its runic contents, Dumbledore was fully aware of the real stories out of the many changed tales in the world-wide famous Wizarding Storybook and the historical background behind it, therefore publishing notes regarding said topic.</li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/Astronomy" title="Astronomy">Astronomy</a></b>: Dumbledore appeared to be quite knowledgeable and adept in Astronomy, as he owned a <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore%27s_pocket_watch" title="Albus Dumbledore's pocket watch">special pocket watch</a> that contained moving planets around the edge of seemingly unique astronomy composition, with which he could apparently translate the meaning off to know the current time.</li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/Divination" title="Divination">Divination</a></b>: Although not having taken the subject and admitting to disliking it, Dumbledore displayed decent knowledge of Divination, as he was shown to be fully familiar with <i><a href="/wiki/The_Predictions_of_Tycho_Dodonus" title="The Predictions of Tycho Dodonus">The Predictions of Tycho Dodonus</a></i>, a Divination book, correctly answering all of Travers's questions regarding the book. His knowledge of the subject also allowed him to effortlessly identify the difference between real and false Seers as well as quickly recognise the usage of the gift, as he was not fooled by Sybill's attempts to impress him as it didn't truly contain any trace of the gift, whereas apart from Hermione Granger, Ron Weasley and Harry Potter, most of the students believed her prophecies were real, but immediately saw her as a genuine Seer once Sybil delivered the Chosen One Prophecy. He was also capable of somehow accurately deciphering the contents of Prophecies, having successfully figured out that the <a href="/wiki/Sybill_Trelawney%27s_first_prophecy" class="mw-redirect" title="Sybill Trelawney's first prophecy">Chosen One prophecy</a> about one with the power to defeat <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Voldemort</a> was about <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a>, not <a href="/wiki/Neville_Longbottom" title="Neville Longbottom">Neville Longbottom</a>, despite both being born almost on the same day, and also that the unique Chosen One power Harry possessed was love. He apparently had a level of skill in the practical aspect of the subject, owning at least a single silver device containing the ability to tell him of events happening elsewhere, which he used to recognise Arthur Weasley had truly been attacked by Nagini and his wounds were severe.</li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/Muggle_Studies" title="Muggle Studies">Muggle Studies</a></b>: Dumbledore's knowledge regarding Muggles and ability to interact with them was considerable, with him often employing many Muggle sweets as passwords for the Headmaster's office and at one point managing to effectively interact with the Muggles controlling <a href="/wiki/Wool%27s_Orphanage" title="Wool's Orphanage">Wool's Orphanage</a> to successfully go to the young <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Tom Riddle</a>, quickly convincing one of the employers into calling the matron <a href="/wiki/Cole" title="Cole">Mrs Cole</a>, who he calmly levelled with and convinced to trust him, needing little aid of his magic against the admittedly sharp woman. He was also well-known for his great contribution to the support of Muggles of wizardkind.</li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/Healing_magic" title="Healing magic">Healing magic</a></b>: Dumbledore was accomplished in healing magic as he managed to temporarily control the immensely powerful curse on <a href="/wiki/Marvolo_Gaunt%27s_ring" class="mw-redirect" title="Marvolo Gaunt's ring">Marvolo Gaunt's ring</a> long enough to destroy it and return to Hogwarts to receive further treatment from <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Severus Snape</a>, and easily healed his wound with a <a href="/wiki/Healing_spell" title="Healing spell">healing spell</a> after using his blood to open the passageway in <a href="/wiki/The_Cave" title="The Cave">The Cave</a> when searching for <a href="/wiki/Slytherin%27s_Locket" title="Slytherin's Locket">Salazar Slytherin's Locket</a>. He also appeared to be accomplished in treating magical creatures, as <a href="/wiki/Cecil_Lee" title="Cecil Lee">Cecil Lee</a> took <a href="/wiki/Chiara_Lobosca" title="Chiara Lobosca">Chiara Lobosca</a> in her wolf form to his office for treatment after she was wounded by Greyback and he appeared to have succeeded in treating her.</li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/Apparition" title="Apparition">Apparition</a></b>: Dumbledore was extremely skilled in Apparition, as he was the only known wizard apart from Lord Voldemort capable of Apparating silently.<sup id="cite_ref-117" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-117"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>117<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He could transport himself from one place to another with pin-point precision, even when locked in combat, as shown by how he dodged some of Voldemort's spells during <a href="/wiki/Duel_in_the_Ministry_Atrium" title="Duel in the Ministry Atrium">their duel</a> by teleporting away before quickly counter-attacking.</li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/Flight" title="Flight">Flying</a></b>: Dumbledore was an excellent broomstick flyer, as, despite being considerably weakened from having drunk the <a href="/wiki/Emerald_Potion" title="Emerald Potion">Emerald Potion</a>, he was able to fly from <a href="/wiki/Hogsmeade" title="Hogsmeade">Hogsmeade</a> to the <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_Castle" title="Hogwarts Castle">Hogwarts</a> <a href="/wiki/Astronomy_Tower" title="Astronomy Tower">Astronomy Tower</a> at great speed and was even able to cast a spell while en route to undo the protections around the Castle. He also managed to fly back from "midway" to the British Ministry of Magic to Hogwarts fast enough to still have the time needed to save Harry from Quirrell. In addition, he apparently effortlessly managed to capture the right key out of the <a href="/wiki/Winged_Keys" title="Winged Keys">Winged Keys</a> to unlock the door to McGonagall's real Wizard Chess obstacle.</li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/Love" title="Love">Love</a></b>: Dumbledore was extremely learned and knowledgeable in the nature of love along with the magic associated with it and showed a remarkably powerful capability to feel true love. This was shown when Dumbledore advised <a href="/wiki/Newton_Scamander" title="Newton Scamander">Newt Scamander</a> on how to potentially heal the <a href="/wiki/Obscurial" title="Obscurial">Obscurial</a> <a href="/wiki/Credence_Barebone" class="mw-redirect" title="Credence Barebone">Credence</a> of the latter's <a href="/wiki/Obscurus" title="Obscurus">Obscurus</a> - by replacing the feelings that made Credence an Obscurial with a sense of love and belonging. Later, he also advised <a href="/wiki/Leta_Lestrange" title="Leta Lestrange">Leta Lestrange</a> to not torture herself over her brother's death, since he himself had not loved his own late sister <a href="/wiki/Ariana_Dumbledore" title="Ariana Dumbledore">Ariana</a> enough. Furthermore, Dumbledore was able to understand the true magical power behind a <a href="/wiki/Sacrificial_protection" title="Sacrificial protection">loving sacrifice</a>, telling <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a> about the magical protection the latter had inherited when his mother sacrificed herself to protect him from Voldemort, and was also able to inform Harry that his own ability to love allowed him to close the connection between him and Voldemort and repel Voldemort's attempted possession of Harry by focusing on grief when he was unable to perform <a href="/wiki/Occlumency" title="Occlumency">Occlumency</a>. Due to this, he was also the only person who understood that Voldemort's act in using Harry's blood to help in restoring him to full power actually strengthened the magical protection within Harry to the point that Voldemort could not kill Harry while he himself was still alive.<sup id="cite_ref-DH35_118-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH35-118"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>118<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Dumbledore's understanding of love and sacrificial protection also made him cast the <a href="/wiki/Bond_of_blood_charm" title="Bond of blood charm">bond of blood charm</a>, a piece of <a href="/wiki/Ancient_magic" title="Ancient magic">ancient magic</a>, upon Harry to ensure he had further protection from Voldemort for 17 years alongside his mother's sacrifice while living with his aunt, <a href="/wiki/Petunia_Dursley" title="Petunia Dursley">Petunia Dursley</a>. Dumbledore was also able to distinguish between pure, unconditional love which most people felt for each other, and the obsession which was caused by Love Potions. While Dumbledore became "quite asexual" in his older years, after the disaster following his romantic interest in teenage friend <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Gellert Grindelwald</a>, he evidently cared greatly about his family, close friends, students, allies and the wizarding community. His ability to love gave him the strength to overcome his selfishness and obsession for power and stand up to Grindelwald in order to protect his brother Aberforth when Grindelwald attacked him. His ability to love also allowed Dumbledore to eventually overcome his fear of learning who really killed Ariana and duel Grindelwald again at the heights of the latter's power and defeat him when Grindelwald was threatening to take over both wizarding and Muggle worlds. Dumbledore's ability to love was his most redeeming quality, as it allowed him to become a far better person by protecting many people he cared about, especially when Voldemort rose to power. His ability to love also made him concerned about Harry Potter's safety, to the point that he kept <a href="/wiki/Sybill_Trelawney%27s_first_prophecy" class="mw-redirect" title="Sybill Trelawney's first prophecy">the Prophecy</a> a secret from him earlier on and distanced himself from Harry during the latter's fifth year, hoping it would reduce the connection between Harry and Voldemort, along with protecting Harry several times.</li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/Study_of_Ancient_Runes" title="Study of Ancient Runes">Study of Ancient Runes</a></b>: Dumbledore was also proficient in Ancient Runes, as he was able to perfectly understand the contents of his first-edition copy of <i><a href="/wiki/The_Tales_of_Beedle_the_Bard" title="The Tales of Beedle the Bard">The Tales of Beedle the Bard</a></i>, which were written completely in Runes. His ability to read and understand the runic language the book was shown by the fact that he had written a series of extensive notes on the book's various stories, providing his own interpretations of the stories' events, as well as recording significant historical background to how the stories had been changed or adapted over the years from this first edition.</li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/Herbology" title="Herbology">Herbology</a></b>: Dumbledore had a fair share of knowledge on magical plants and their properties, as he knew of the healing properties of <a href="/wiki/Mandrake" title="Mandrake">Mandrakes</a> and therefore began the production of the <a href="/wiki/Mandrake_Restorative_Draught" title="Mandrake Restorative Draught">Mandrake Restorative Draught</a> to cure the petrification done when the <a href="/wiki/Chamber_of_Secrets" title="Chamber of Secrets">Chamber of Secrets</a> was opened. Although he was never shown directly handling magical plants, he had no problem bypassing the Devil's Snare of the Philosopher's Stone Chambers to reach Harry in time, showing he was at least adequately skilled in the field.</li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/Wandlore" title="Wandlore">Wandlore</a></b>: From his correspondence with <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Gellert Grindelwald</a> in their youth over the <a href="/wiki/Elder_Wand" title="Elder Wand">Elder Wand</a> as it was one of the three fabled <a href="/wiki/Deathly_Hallows" title="Deathly Hallows">Deathly Hallows</a>, Dumbledore became highly knowledgeable of wandlore. Henceforth, he was not only able to easily recognise that the effect that happened during <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry</a>'s <a href="/wiki/Duel_in_Little_Hangleton" title="Duel in Little Hangleton">confrontation</a> with <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Voldemort</a> was <a href="/wiki/Reverse_Spell" class="mw-redirect" title="Reverse Spell">Reverse Spell</a> and explain the reason behind its occurrence to Harry, but he was also capable of understanding the reason of the unique effect <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter%27s_wand" title="Harry Potter's wand">Harry's wand</a> had when confronted by Voldemort and its activation only happening when around Voldemort so as to explain to Harry the reason why he was able to break <a href="/wiki/Lucius_Malfoy" title="Lucius Malfoy">Lucius</a>'s wand, but <a href="/wiki/Hermione_Granger" title="Hermione Granger">Hermione</a> could break his wand. Finally, Dumbledore was aware that should the master of the Elder Wand die a natural death, he would remain undefeated, and the wand's powers will be destroyed, henceforth attempting to do so by having <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Severus Snape</a> kill him with the <a href="/wiki/Killing_Curse" title="Killing Curse">Killing Curse</a>, although it failed due to Draco <a href="/wiki/Disarming_Charm" title="Disarming Charm">Disarming</a> him first.</li>
<li><b>Indomitable willpower</b>: Dumbledore, in true <a href="/wiki/Gryffindor" title="Gryffindor">Gryffindor</a> fashion, had tremendously strong willpower, most prominently shown by his ability to overcome strong emotional attachments and desires and recover from horrendous losses from a young age, and become even stronger from the experience, as shown by Dumbledore immediately standing up to <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Grindelwald</a>, despite his crush for the latter and desire to complete the <i><a href="/wiki/For_the_Greater_Good" title="For the Greater Good">For the Greater Good</a></i> revolution they planned when Grindelwald attacked <a href="/wiki/Aberforth_Dumbledore" title="Aberforth Dumbledore">Aberforth</a>, later showing determination to find a way to terminate the <a href="/wiki/Blood_pact" title="Blood pact">blood pact</a> he had made with Grindelwald, and later still, after the blood pact was somehow overcome, mustering up the willpower to confront Grindelwald when the latter was at the height of his power in the <a href="/wiki/Global_Wizarding_War" title="Global Wizarding War">Global Wizarding War</a>, despite his strong fear of Grindelwald knowing who had really killed <a href="/wiki/Ariana_Dumbledore" title="Ariana Dumbledore">Ariana</a>, all of which instead of breaking Dumbledore, made him the benevolent wizard respected by most of the Wizarding World. Dumbledore was also confident that he would be able to resist the effect of the <a href="/wiki/Dementor" title="Dementor">Dementors</a> long enough to easily escape <a href="/wiki/Azkaban" title="Azkaban">Azkaban</a> and was known for having entered Azkaban at least once to recover <a href="/wiki/Morfin_Gaunt" title="Morfin Gaunt">Morfin Gaunt</a>'s memory and left without any effect on him. Additionally, Dumbledore was never intimidated when questioned by high-ranking <a href="/wiki/Ministry_of_Magic" title="Ministry of Magic">Ministry of Magic</a> officials, such as <a href="/wiki/Torquil_Travers" title="Torquil Travers">Torquil Travers</a>, <a href="/wiki/Dolores_Umbridge" title="Dolores Umbridge">Dolores Umbridge</a>, <a href="/wiki/Cornelius_Fudge" title="Cornelius Fudge">Cornelius Fudge</a>, or <a href="/wiki/Rufus_Scrimgeour" title="Rufus Scrimgeour">Rufus Scrimgeour</a>, even when Travers forced him to wear two <a href="/wiki/Admonitor" title="Admonitor">admonitors</a>, or when Fudge tried to send him to Azkaban, nor was he ever intimidated by Voldemort, not only willing to speak the name his former student had used to terrorise the wizarding Britain but he would even casually refer to Voldemort as Tom in direct confrontation. A lesser display of Dumbledore's extreme willpower was his complete mastery of <a href="/wiki/Occlumency" title="Occlumency">Occlumency</a> and non-verbal magic, both of which required high amounts of mental strength. Additionally, Dumbledore's encouragement aided his allies in developing a similar willpower, with <a href="/wiki/Leta_Lestrange" title="Leta Lestrange">Leta Lestrange</a> and <a href="/wiki/Theseus_Scamander" title="Theseus Scamander">Theseus Scamander</a> notably resisting <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Grindelwald</a>'s persuasive speech, and <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a> being encouraged by Dumbledore's example to be steadfast against <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a> numerous times.</li>
<li><b>Intimidation master</b>: Despite Dumbledore's benevolent personality and famous standing as a well-meaning and good man, he proved himself to be an extraordinarily effective intimidator if necessary. With his unmatched magical power and skills as well as his well-concealed and barely unleashed dark side, Dumbledore was capable of striking fear even into the heart of the extremely powerful <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a> and <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Gellert Grindelwald</a>, despite them being, perhaps, the closest individuals to matching him in power and skill, to the point that it was a widely known fact that both feared Dumbledore and refrained from attacking Hogwarts while he was there. Dumbledore's mere presence was so overwhelmingly intimidating that a group of <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eaters</a> outright ran from him when he arrived during the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Department_of_Mysteries" title="Battle of the Department of Mysteries">Battle of the Department of Mysteries</a>, with even the intensely sadistic and extremely powerful <a href="/wiki/Bellatrix_Lestrange" title="Bellatrix Lestrange">Bellatrix Lestrange</a> fleeing from him as soon as she was able to. In addition, <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Severus Snape</a> was quick to plead with Dumbledore not to kill him out of fear of what Dumbledore could do to him despite his own tremendous skills and powers and concern for <a href="/wiki/Lily_Potter_(I)" title="Lily Potter (I)">Lily</a> driving him to contact Dumbledore, and <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry</a> noted that Dumbledore was more intimidating than <a href="/wiki/Minerva_McGonagall" title="Minerva McGonagall">Minerva McGonagall</a>, a notably strict individual. Dumbledore's experience in intimidation tactics was such that he could effectively intimidate others while remaining calm with just a single sentence, as shown when he not only visibly unnerved <a href="/wiki/Cornelius_Fudge" title="Cornelius Fudge">Cornelius Fudge</a> and Harry Potter, despite Fudge's standing as the Minister for Magic and Harry's bravery, while just seriously defending <a href="/wiki/Rubeus_Hagrid" title="Rubeus Hagrid">Hagrid</a> and not outright angry but he even silenced Harry's own anger at him for trusting Snape despite Harry's tremendous rage over Snape's involvement in his parents death while only indicating Harry had crossed the line and still remaining calm. He also calmly levelled with Harry's anger regarding Sirius' death (though Dumbledore fully admitted that Harry had every right to be angry with him). Additionally, just an expression of calm disappointment was enough to make Harry feel ashamed of his attempt to enter Hogwarts with the <a href="/wiki/Flying_Ford_Anglia" title="Flying Ford Anglia">Ford Anglia</a>, and his failure to get <a href="/wiki/Horace_Slughorn" title="Horace Slughorn">Slughorn</a>'s memory, with Harry on both occasions finding it preferable if Dumbledore shouted at him. At the peak of Dumbledore's wrath, when he was furiously interrogating <a href="/wiki/Bartemius_Crouch_Junior" title="Bartemius Crouch Junior">Barty Crouch Jnr</a>, Dumbledore was capable of exerting such a massively fearsome appearance that Snape and McGonagall were visibly wary of the Headmaster and left Harry visibly terrified and he even described Dumbledore as being more fearsome than Voldemort, acknowledging he knew why Voldemort feared the old but still extraordinarily powerful wizard.</li>
<li><b>Conducting</b>: Dumbledore was fully capable of single-handedly leading the singing of the <a href="/wiki/Hoggy_Warty_Hogwarts" title="Hoggy Warty Hogwarts">Hoggy Warty Hogwarts</a> song, showing he had apt musical abilities.</li>
<li><b>Social networking</b>: Due to his vast reputation, Dumbledore had a vast network of followers and international contacts around the whole Wizarding World, to the point that he was known for knowing all that happens. Indeed, even the abrasive <a href="/wiki/Department_of_Magical_Law_Enforcement" title="Department of Magical Law Enforcement">Department of Magical Law Enforcement</a> Head <a href="/wiki/Torquil_Travers" title="Torquil Travers">Torquil Travers</a> showed begrudging admiration of Dumbledore's international contacts network while questioning the <a href="/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts" title="Defence Against the Dark Arts">Defence Against the Dark Arts</a> professor. Later, during his job application meeting with Dumbledore, even <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a> himself was impressed by how well-informed the new Hogwarts Headmaster was. This was what allowed Dumbledore to be aware of his old friend <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Gellert Grindelwald</a> being disguised as <a href="/wiki/Percival_Graves" title="Percival Graves">Percival Graves</a> and his search of the Obscurial that terrorised <a href="/wiki/New_York" title="New York">New York</a>, of <a href="/wiki/Aurelius_Dumbledore" title="Aurelius Dumbledore">Credence Barebone</a> being considered by many to be the long-lost <a href="/wiki/Corvus_Lestrange_(V)" title="Corvus Lestrange (V)">Corvus Lestrange</a>, of the feud between the <a href="/wiki/Kama_family" title="Kama family">Kama family</a> and <a href="/wiki/Lestrange_family" title="Lestrange family">Lestrange family</a>, of <a href="/wiki/Nicolas_Flamel" title="Nicolas Flamel">Nicolas Flamel</a> being urgently needed at <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Grindelwald</a>'s rally in Paris (communicating with Nicolas via the latter's <a href="/wiki/Nicolas_Flamel%27s_phoenix-embossed_book" class="mw-redirect" title="Nicolas Flamel's phoenix-embossed book">phoenix-embossed book</a>), of <a href="/wiki/Leta_Lestrange" title="Leta Lestrange">Leta Lestrange</a>'s death at Grindelwald's rally, of several <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eaters</a> being at Hogsmeade waiting for Voldemort's return, of <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a> hiding in Albania, of <a href="/wiki/Frank_Bryce" title="Frank Bryce">Frank Bryce</a>'s disappearance (from Muggle newspapers), of <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a>'s arrival at the Burrow, and, thanks to <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Severus Snape</a>, of the majority of Voldemort's plans in the <a href="/wiki/Second_Wizarding_War" title="Second Wizarding War">Second Wizarding War</a>. Additionally, Dumbledore's contacts allowed him to provide safe-houses for his allies, such as <a href="/wiki/Nicolas_Flamel" title="Nicolas Flamel">Nicolas Flamel</a>'s house for <a href="/wiki/Newton_Scamander" title="Newton Scamander">Newt Scamander</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Potter_cottage" title="Potter cottage">Potter cottage</a> for the endangered <a href="/wiki/Potter_family" title="Potter family">Potter family</a> and <a href="/wiki/Sirius_Black" title="Sirius Black">Sirius Black</a>'s <a href="/wiki/12_Grimmauld_Place" title="12 Grimmauld Place">12 Grimmauld Place</a> house for the <a href="/wiki/Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Order of the Phoenix">Order of the Phoenix</a>'s headquarters. He was somehow aware of <a href="/wiki/Rita_Skeeter" title="Rita Skeeter">Rita Skeeter</a>'s Animagus ability too. However, while this did usually made Dumbledore well-informed, his contacts network was not always a perfect source of information, since in 1927 he was unaware that his relative <a href="/wiki/Credence_Barebone" class="mw-redirect" title="Credence Barebone">Aurelius Dumbledore</a> had allegedly survived a shipwreck and was now called "<a href="/wiki/Aurelius_Dumbledore" title="Aurelius Dumbledore">Credence Barebone</a>", in 1981 he was unaware of <a href="/wiki/Sirius_Black" title="Sirius Black">Sirius Black</a>'s innocence, and in 1995 he was unaware of <a href="/wiki/Bartemius_Crouch_Junior" title="Bartemius Crouch Junior">Bartemius Crouch Junior</a>'s infiltration of his school in the guise of <a href="/wiki/Alastor_Moody" title="Alastor Moody">Alastor Moody</a>.</li>
<li><b>Physical aptitude</b>: Despite his advanced age and rather skinny build, Dumbledore was in superbly good physical condition, as he has been seen to be capable of physically performing feats that should be far beyond someone of his age and body, rivalling that of a much younger, fit man: his strength was great enough to raise <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a> forcibly off the ground away from <a href="/wiki/Cedric_Diggory" title="Cedric Diggory">Cedric Diggory</a>'s body with one hand, which shocked Harry. Dumbledore was also astonishingly fast and agile for someone his age, as shown during the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Department_of_Mysteries" title="Battle of the Department of Mysteries">Battle of the Department of Mysteries</a>, describing as having sped past Harry and Neville when they blinked away from his arrival, and he displayed sufficient swimming ability to quickly swim with a "perfect breaststroke" and speed surpassing Harry, in the churning sea to reach <a href="/wiki/The_Cave" title="The Cave">The Cave</a>, with a considerably large tolerance to climate weathers to be entirely unfazed from the coldness of the waters, whereas Harry was left shivering upon emerging to the grounds of the cave. He also effortlessly jumped to the seventh trunk of Moody, which was used by Crouch to hold the real Moody while disguised as him, and landed gracefully on his feet, with his landing being only of light impact, before climbing back up with Moody on hand without issue. He also was capable of overpowering the weakened and injured <a href="/wiki/Quirinus_Quirrell" title="Quirinus Quirrell">Quirinus Quirrell</a> to forcibly and quickly remove him from his struggle with Harry. Dumbledore also displayed considerable endurance and stamina, as after only a brief moment of rest from being incapacitated by the <a href="/wiki/Emerald_Potion" title="Emerald Potion">Emerald Potion</a>, he was able to cast a <a href="/wiki/Firestorm" title="Firestorm">firestorm</a> to fend off the Inferi in <a href="/wiki/The_Cave" title="The Cave">The Cave</a>, and quickly afterwards fly from Hogsmeade to Hogwarts. In addition, he had a strong tolerance for pain, as shown when slicing his hand with a knife to use his blood to unlock the Cave, he did not even flinch and went as far as to soberly say the reason why to the shocked Harry.</li></ul>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Possessions">Possessions</span></h2>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 250px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/ae/Pensieve2.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20090803154714" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Pensieve2" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="143" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Pensieve2.jpg" data-image-key="Pensieve2.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/ae/Pensieve2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20090803154714" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/ae/Pensieve2.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20090803154714" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Pensieve2" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/ae/Pensieve2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20090803154714" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="143" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Pensieve2.jpg" data-image-key="Pensieve2.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/ae/Pensieve2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20090803154714" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Pensieve2.jpg" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Dumbledore's <a href="/wiki/Pensieve" title="Pensieve">Pensieve</a></p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Dumbledore's office housed "a number of curious... <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore%27s_silver_instruments" title="Albus Dumbledore's silver instruments">instruments</a>." Among them was a <a href="/wiki/Pensieve" title="Pensieve">Pensieve</a>, a stone receptacle used to store and review memories, which witches and wizards are able to extract from their heads as a type of fluid. Harry first discovered this device to witness Dumbledore's memory of <a href="/wiki/Igor_Karkaroff" title="Igor Karkaroff">Igor Karkaroff</a>'s trial before the <a href="/wiki/Wizengamot" title="Wizengamot">Wizengamot</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-GOF_59-8" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-GOF-59"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>59<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> and also used it to view <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Severus Snape</a>'s memories of childhood. During the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_Albus_Dumbledore%27s_private_lessons" title="Harry Potter and Albus Dumbledore's private lessons">private lessons between Harry and Dumbledore</a>, the Pensieve was used to view a variety of memories about <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Tom Riddle</a>'s past.<sup id="cite_ref-HBP_48-21" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP-48"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>48<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Dumbledore was also seen using the <a href="/wiki/Deluminator" title="Deluminator">Deluminator</a>, a device for removing and later returning light, and for use as a homing device.<sup id="cite_ref-PS1_10-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PS1-10"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>10<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> It was confirmed when the object was inherited by Ron that the Deluminator was of Dumbledore's own design.<sup id="cite_ref-DH7_119-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH7-119"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>119<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Dumbledore was the possessor and master of the <a href="/wiki/Elder_Wand" title="Elder Wand">Elder Wand</a>, an extremely powerful <a href="/wiki/Wand" title="Wand">wand</a> known also as the "Wand of Destiny" or the "Deathstick", and one of the <a href="/wiki/Deathly_Hallows" title="Deathly Hallows">Deathly Hallows</a>, until he was disarmed by Draco Malfoy at the top of the Astronomy Tower.<sup id="cite_ref-HBP_48-22" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP-48"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>48<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> The wand's allegiance was then transferred to Harry Potter nearly a year later.<sup id="cite_ref-DH_28-13" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH-28"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>28<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Unlike many of the wand's previous owners, Dumbledore kept its identity a closely guarded secret and did not use it for evil or cruel reasons. 
</p><p>He also owned a pet <a href="/wiki/Phoenix" title="Phoenix">phoenix</a> named <a href="/wiki/Fawkes" title="Fawkes">Fawkes</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-COS_49-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COS-49"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>49<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> who left Hogwarts Castle after Dumbledore's death.<sup id="cite_ref-HBP_48-23" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP-48"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>48<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> It was revealed in that two of Fawkes's feathers form the <a href="/wiki/Wand_core" title="Wand core">magical cores</a> of both Harry's and Voldemort's <a href="/wiki/Wand" title="Wand">wands</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-DH_28-14" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH-28"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>28<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> This was another testament to his skill as phoenixes were notoriously difficult to domesticate,<sup id="cite_ref-FB_120-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FB-120"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>120<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> although they have been long associated with the <a href="/wiki/Dumbledore_family" title="Dumbledore family">Dumbledore family</a>. His <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore%27s_great-great-grandfather" title="Albus Dumbledore's great-great-grandfather">great-great grandfather</a> was said to have owned a phoenix<sup id="cite_ref-COG28_121-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COG28-121"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>121<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>, as did his alleged relative <a href="/wiki/Aurelius_Dumbledore" title="Aurelius Dumbledore">Credence Barebone</a>/Aurelius Dumbledore.<sup id="cite_ref-COG120_122-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COG120-122"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>122<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> According to legend, a phoenix will appear to anyone of the Dumbledore Family in dire need. 
</p><p>Professor Dumbledore kept a <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore%27s_diary" title="Albus Dumbledore's diary">diary</a> in which he would have written in regularly. He also kept a <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore%27s_pocket_watch" title="Albus Dumbledore's pocket watch">pocket watch</a> with twelve hands, but instead of numbers it had little planets moving around the edge.<sup id="cite_ref-PS1_10-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PS1-10"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>10<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Career_accomplishments">Career accomplishments</span></h2>
<p>In a long career, Albus Dumbledore served as teacher of at <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry</a>, first as its <a href="/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts" title="Defence Against the Dark Arts">Defence Against the Dark Arts</a> instructor and later as a <a href="/wiki/Transfiguration" title="Transfiguration">Transfiguration</a> Professor, and eventual promotion to <a href="/wiki/Head_of_Transfiguration" title="Head of Transfiguration">Head</a> of the <a href="/wiki/Transfiguration_department" title="Transfiguration department">Transfiguration department</a>, making contributions to such learned, scholarly publications as <a href="/wiki/Transfiguration_Today" title="Transfiguration Today">Transfiguration Today</a>, <a href="/wiki/Challenges_in_Charming" title="Challenges in Charming">Challenges in Charming</a>, and <a href="/wiki/The_Practical_Potioneer" title="The Practical Potioneer">The Practical Potioneer</a>, ultimately rounding his career off by becoming arguably the finest and most revered <a href="/wiki/Headteacher" title="Headteacher">Headmaster</a> the school had ever seen. He was also a famous alchemist who worked with <a href="/wiki/Nicolas_Flamel" title="Nicolas Flamel">Nicolas Flamel</a>, the only known maker of the <a href="/wiki/Philosopher%27s_Stone" title="Philosopher's Stone">Philosopher's Stone</a>, and was credited with discovering the twelve uses of <a href="/wiki/Dragon" title="Dragon">dragon</a>'s blood.
</p><p>Dumbledore became the <a href="/wiki/Chief_Warlock" title="Chief Warlock">Chief Warlock</a> of the <a href="/wiki/Wizengamot" title="Wizengamot">Wizengamot</a> and <a href="/wiki/Supreme_Mugwump" title="Supreme Mugwump">Supreme Mugwump</a> of the <a href="/wiki/International_Confederation_of_Wizards" title="International Confederation of Wizards">International Confederation of Wizards</a>.
