When Snape overheard part of <a href="/wiki/Sybill_Trelawney%27s_first_prophecy" class="mw-redirect" title="Sybill Trelawney's first prophecy">the prophecy</a>, he immediately relayed its contents to the <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Dark Lord</a>, not knowing that it would have anything to do with Lily. Upon discovering that Lord Voldemort was planning on killing <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Lily's son</a>, Snape pleaded with him to spare Lily, on account that he had relayed the prophecy to him, and then went to <strong class="mw-selflink selflink">Albus Dumbledore</strong>, appearing beyond himself with worry and agitation, and looking on the edge of madness. Dumbledore was initially hostile due to his Death Eater allegiances and was mistrustful of him and his motivations, accusing him of only caring about Lily's life, not about her husband's and son's. Snape responded by asking him to do everything in his power to protect Lily and her family, and when Dumbledore asked what he was willing to give him in return for keeping them safe, he responded that he was ready to give him anything in return. After Lily's death he became committed to protecting Harry's life, on account of him being Lily's son, and assisting him in defeating Lord Voldemort.
</p><p>Dumbledore agreed to capitalise on Snape's remorse and initiated him into the <a href="/wiki/Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Order of the Phoenix">Order of the Phoenix</a> as a double agent. As a spy for the Order, Snape silently kept his place within the ranks of the <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eaters</a>, while informing Dumbledore about their movements. He also adopted the role of secret agent for Voldemort and supplied him with strategic scraps of information about the Order. The content of these reports was often dictated by Dumbledore. It is implied that Snape withheld little, if any, information from Dumbledore that was relevant to the Order's success, while Snape deliberately did the opposite for Voldemort.
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/2/26/Snape_and_Dumbledore.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20160819104925" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Snape and Dumbledore" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="270" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Snape and Dumbledore.jpg" data-image-key="Snape_and_Dumbledore.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/2/26/Snape_and_Dumbledore.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20160819104925" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/2/26/Snape_and_Dumbledore.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20160819104925" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Snape and Dumbledore" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/2/26/Snape_and_Dumbledore.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20160819104925" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="270" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Snape and Dumbledore.jpg" data-image-key="Snape_and_Dumbledore.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/2/26/Snape_and_Dumbledore.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20160819104925" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Snape_and_Dumbledore.jpg" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption"><i>"I am fortunate, extremely fortunate, that I have you, Severus..."</i></p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince"><b>Albus Dumbledore</b>: "<i>Severus... please...</i>"</span></dd>
<dd><b>Severus Snape</b>: "<i>Avada Kedavra!</i>"</dd>
<dd>— Dumbledore asking Snape to end his life<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">[src]</a></sup></dd></dl>
</div>
<p>It is notable that Dumbledore did not confide completely in Snape, thereby minimising the potential damage that might occur if Snape was compromised. Snape resented Dumbledore's secrecy, and was offended by this lack of faith in his abilities. However, when Snape discovered that he had been used as a pawn in <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry</a>'s own destruction, he was horrified, seeing it as a calculated betrayal of Lily's memory.
</p><p>Dumbledore clearly underestimated Snape's capacity for <a href="/wiki/Love" title="Love">love</a>, and years later was very surprised to learn that Snape still maintained his devotion. Furthermore, he complimented Snape's bravery, stating he was far braver than Igor Karkaroff and that sometimes they sorted too soon, leaving Snape dumbstruck. But in contrast to this, Dumbledore overestimated Snape's feelings to get over "old grudges" and therefore assigned him to tutor Harry in Occlumency, which ended badly between the two parties. 
</p>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">"<i>I am fortunate, extremely fortunate, that I have you, Severus.</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— Dumbledore's gratitude towards Snape<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<p>In <a href="/wiki/1996" title="1996">1996</a>, Dumbledore was <a href="/wiki/Curse_on_Marvolo_Gaunt%27s_Ring" title="Curse on Marvolo Gaunt's Ring">cursed</a> by putting on <a href="/wiki/Marvolo_Gaunt%27s_Ring" title="Marvolo Gaunt's Ring">Marvolo Gaunt's Ring</a>, which was a <a href="/wiki/Horcrux" title="Horcrux">Horcrux</a> (he put it on when he was distracted by finding out that it was the Resurrection Stone, hoping to talk to his dead family). He managed to contact Severus who was able to contain the <a href="/wiki/Curse" title="Curse">curse</a> in his right hand. However, Snape knew and told Dumbledore that the curse would get stronger and stronger and eventually kill him painfully, giving him a prognosis of about a year. By this time, Dumbledore was aware of Voldemort's plan to kill him through assigning <a href="/wiki/Draco_Malfoy" title="Draco Malfoy">Draco Malfoy</a> by threatening to kill his parents. Knowing that he was going to die in a year and to save Draco Malfoy's safety and his soul, he begged Snape to give him a quick and painless death when the time came. Snape, although resistant at first to killing Dumbledore, carried it out at the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Astronomy_Tower" title="Battle of the Astronomy Tower">Battle of the Astronomy Tower</a>, when Draco Malfoy had managed to bring <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eaters</a> into Hogwarts. Dumbledore also entrusted Snape with protecting the students once Hogwarts fell into Voldemort's control.
</p><p>It is notable that despite trusting Snape had reformed, Dumbledore never allowed him his coveted position of professor of <a href="/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts" title="Defence Against the Dark Arts">Defence Against the Dark Arts</a>, ostensibly under the concern that it would cause him to revert to "old habits". However, it is more likely that he did it out of a desire to protect Snape from the <a href="/wiki/Jinx" title="Jinx">jinx</a> he believed Lord Voldemort had put on the job after failing to acquire the position himself. This same jinx prevented any teacher from lasting more than twelve months at the post, sometimes with fatal results. After being cursed by Marvolo Gaunt's ring and ordering Snape to kill him, Dumbledore finally granted him the Defence Against the Dark Arts post, knowing that if Snape were to kill him, he would be vilified by the wizarding public and forced to abandon the post.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Elphias_Doge">Elphias Doge</span></h3>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">"<i>Thought the sun shone out of my brother's every orifice, he did.</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— Aberforth Dumbledore on Elphias Doge<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/4/4e/Elphias_Doge_2.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20110610163841" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Elphias Doge 2" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="245" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Elphias Doge 2.jpg" data-image-key="Elphias_Doge_2.jpg" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/4/4e/Elphias_Doge_2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20110610163841" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/4/4e/Elphias_Doge_2.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20110610163841" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Elphias Doge 2" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/4/4e/Elphias_Doge_2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20110610163841" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="245" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Elphias Doge 2.jpg" data-image-key="Elphias_Doge_2.jpg" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/4/4e/Elphias_Doge_2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20110610163841" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Elphias_Doge_2.jpg" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption"><a href="/wiki/Elphias_Doge" title="Elphias Doge">Elphias Doge</a>, his friend for many years</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Elphias Doge became a close friend of Dumbledore's during their first day at Hogwarts. Elphias suffered from <a href="/wiki/Dragon_Pox" title="Dragon Pox">Dragon Pox</a>, and everybody avoided him. Elphias thought Dumbledore was a very great <a href="/wiki/Wizardkind" title="Wizardkind">wizard</a>, and a very great person, and believed that his many early losses endowed him with great humanity and strong sympathy, as he stated in an obituary he wrote for Albus Dumbledore, after his <a href="/wiki/Death" title="Death">death</a>.
</p><p>Elphias pitied Dumbledore about his <a href="/wiki/Percival_Dumbledore" title="Percival Dumbledore">father</a>, <a href="/wiki/Kendra_Dumbledore" title="Kendra Dumbledore">mother</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Ariana_Dumbledore" title="Ariana Dumbledore">sister</a>, and had a highly opinion of him. Elphias soon became a member of the <a href="/wiki/Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Order of the Phoenix">Order of the Phoenix</a>, an organisation that Dumbledore had led. He also attended Albus Dumbledore's funeral.
</p><p>Elphias also told Harry to never believe <a href="/wiki/Rita_Skeeter" title="Rita Skeeter">Rita Skeeter</a> and <a href="/wiki/Muriel" title="Muriel">Muriel</a>'s slanders about Albus Dumbledore's family life, including that Ariana was a <a href="/wiki/Squib" title="Squib">Squib</a>. It is possible that Elphias Doge fought in the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Hogwarts" title="Battle of Hogwarts">Battle of Hogwarts</a>.
</p>

<p>Ron Weasley and Hermione Granger were <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a>'s best friends and, like Harry, they thought Dumbledore was a great <a href="/wiki/Wizardkind" title="Wizardkind">wizard</a>. Dumbledore liked them too, despite that he wasn't as close to them as he was to Harry. 
</p><p>After his <a href="/wiki/Death" title="Death">death</a>, he left Ron his <a href="/wiki/Deluminator" title="Deluminator">Deluminator</a> (a unique artefact created by Dumbledore himself) and Hermione his copy of <i><a href="/wiki/The_Tales_of_Beedle_the_Bard" title="The Tales of Beedle the Bard">The Tales of Beedle the Bard</a></i>. These gifts were proven very useful, as Ron abandoned Harry and Hermione formerly to find his family, and, when he wanted to come back to Harry and Hermione, the Deluminator showed him the way. The trio also read the <i>Tales of Beedle the Bard</i> and learned about the <a href="/wiki/Deathly_Hallows" title="Deathly Hallows">Deathly Hallows</a>. Harry, Ron and Hermione also visited Dumbledore's <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore%27s_portrait" title="Albus Dumbledore's portrait">portrait</a>, after the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Hogwarts" title="Battle of Hogwarts">Battle of Hogwarts</a>.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Weasley_family">Weasley family</span></h3>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">"<i>The man has red hair and glasses. Everard, you will need to raise the alarm, make sure he is found by the right people —</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— Dumbledore ordering the <a href="/wiki/Portrait" title="Portrait">portrait</a> of <a href="/wiki/Everard" title="Everard">Everard</a> to help <a href="/wiki/Arthur_Weasley" title="Arthur Weasley">Arthur Weasley</a> after he was <a href="/wiki/Attack_on_Arthur_Weasley" title="Attack on Arthur Weasley">attacked</a><sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 250px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/9/9f/Weasley_family.png/revision/latest?cb=20200417054614" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Weasley family" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="145" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Weasley family.png" data-image-key="Weasley_family.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/9/9f/Weasley_family.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20200417054614" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/9/9f/Weasley_family.png/revision/latest?cb=20200417054614" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Weasley family" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/9/9f/Weasley_family.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20200417054614" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="145" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Weasley family.png" data-image-key="Weasley_family.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/9/9f/Weasley_family.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20200417054614" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Weasley_family.png" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">The <a href="/wiki/Weasley_family" title="Weasley family">Weasley family</a></p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Apart from Ron, Dumbledore was respected greatly by the rest of the Weasley family. They considered him as the greatest wizard of all time and supported him through everything (except Percy who disbelieved him about Voldemort's return) and was even the Hogwarts Headmaster during the times in which all the Weasleys attended Hogwarts.
</p><p>Arthur and Molly Weasley always respected Dumbledore and were very loyal to him. Arthur, like Dumbledore, believed in the equality of all witches, wizards and Muggles while Molly considered him a great wizard who doesn't make mistakes. When the Ministry of Magic began to disbelieve Dumbledore and Harry, they supported the two famous wizards rather than the Ministry and became members of the second Order of the Phoenix.
</p><p>Dumbledore's relationship with Bill happened to be a friendly one since they were both Gryffindors and liked each other. It is very likely that he also had a good relationship with Charlie.
</p><p>Percy also thought of Dumbledore as a great wizard, but sometimes odd. In <a href="/wiki/1995" title="1995">1995</a>, Percy's relationship with Dumbledore became antagonistic when he and Harry claimed that Voldemort had returned, Percy was loyal to the Ministry and participated in discrediting Harry and Dumbledore altogether. When the truth was revealed, Percy learned he had made a mistake and in 1997, attended Dumbledore's funeral.
</p><p>Fred and George appeared to respect Dumbledore very much. Dumbledore also appeared to like the twins, despite their mischief-making, but knew they were good people at heart. They even joined the second Order of the Phoenix and even <a href="/wiki/Dumbledore%27s_Army" title="Dumbledore's Army">Dumbledore's Army</a>.
</p><p>Ginny Weasley admired Dumbledore a lot and became his student in 1992. Dumbledore comforted and reassured Ginny after she was possessed by a fragment of Voldemort's soul and manipulated into opening the Chamber of Secrets during the 1992–1993 school year. Ginny was one of the first people to learn about Dumbledore's death, and the only one able to console Harry afterwards. Ginny also named her younger son, Albus Severus Potter after Dumbledore.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="James_and_Lily_Potter">James and Lily Potter</span></h3>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">"<i>James had shown it to me just a few days previously. It explained much of his undetected wrongdoing at school</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— Albus Dumbledore to Harry Potter<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Frame" style="width: 200px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/81/Lily_and_James_Potter.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20090727171514" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Lily and James Potter" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="200" height="150" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Lily and James Potter.jpg" data-image-key="Lily_and_James_Potter.jpg" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/81/Lily_and_James_Potter.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20090727171514" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/81/Lily_and_James_Potter.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20090727171514" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Lily and James Potter" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/81/Lily_and_James_Potter.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20090727171514" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="200" height="150" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Lily and James Potter.jpg" data-image-key="Lily_and_James_Potter.jpg" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/81/Lily_and_James_Potter.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20090727171514" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Lily_and_James_Potter.jpg" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption"><a href="/wiki/James_Potter_(I)" title="James Potter (I)">James</a> and <a href="/wiki/Lily_Potter_(I)" title="Lily Potter (I)">Lily Potter</a>, his friends and former students</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Dumbledore first met James Potter and Lily Evans during their first year at <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts</a>, where he was the Headmaster. Dumbledore had a good relationship with both of them, knowing them both to be pure souls. James had lent Dumbledore his <a href="/wiki/Cloak_of_Invisibility" title="Cloak of Invisibility">Invisibility Cloak</a>, one of the three <a href="/wiki/Deathly_Hallows" title="Deathly Hallows">Deathly Hallows</a>, at Dumbledore's own request for examination. After James's <a href="/wiki/Death" title="Death">death</a>, Dumbledore returned the cloak to James's son, <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry</a>.
</p><p>When the Potters became Voldemort's targets due to a prophecy made about their son and the Dark Lord, Dumbledore attempted to protect them by casting the <a href="/wiki/Fidelius_Charm" title="Fidelius Charm">Fidelius Charm</a> and offering to be their Secret Keeper, but the role of <a href="/wiki/Secret_Keeper" title="Secret Keeper">Secret Keeper</a> went instead to <a href="/wiki/Peter_Pettigrew" title="Peter Pettigrew">Peter Pettigrew</a>, which turned out to be a fatal mistake, as Peter turned out to be a spy, and he betrayed Lily and James to Voldemort, who killed them. Dumbledore was very saddened by their deaths and dedicated the rest of his life to protecting their son, Harry, without giving him any happiness in his childhood. He often told Harry about the great goodness of his parents, and repeatedly consoled him with the assurance that his parents would never ever truly leave him because of their love for him. Dumbledore also believed that Harry's love for his parents was his greatest power.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Dursley_family">Dursley family</span></h3>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">"<i>Remember my last, Petunia</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— Albus Dumbledore's Howler to Petunia Dursley, reminding her of the protection that she gave Harry<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 250px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/72/Dursley_Family.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20170310050024" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Dursley Family" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="184" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Dursley Family.jpg" data-image-key="Dursley_Family.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/72/Dursley_Family.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20170310050024" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/72/Dursley_Family.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20170310050024" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Dursley Family" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/72/Dursley_Family.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20170310050024" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="184" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Dursley Family.jpg" data-image-key="Dursley_Family.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/72/Dursley_Family.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20170310050024" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Dursley_Family.jpg" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">The Dursleys, whom he entrusted Harry Potter to</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Dumbledore had been known to have at least some correspondence with the Dursley family before the birth of <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">their nephew</a>. In <a href="/wiki/1971" title="1971">1971</a>, <a href="/wiki/Petunia_Dursley" title="Petunia Dursley">Petunia Evans</a> wrote a letter to Dumbledore asking if she could attend <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts</a> along with <a href="/wiki/Lily_Potter_(I)" title="Lily Potter (I)">her sister</a>. Dumbledore kindly rejected her request due to her being a <a href="/wiki/Non-magic_people" title="Non-magic people">Muggle</a>, which had likely contributed to Petunia's already growing hatred of magic. Ten years later, Dumbledore illegally dropped Petunia's <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">nephew</a> at her doorstep shortly after the <a href="/wiki/Attack_at_Godric%27s_Hollow_(1981)" title="Attack at Godric's Hollow (1981)">murders</a> of <a href="/wiki/Lily_Potter_(I)" title="Lily Potter (I)">her sister</a> and <a href="/wiki/James_Potter_(I)" title="James Potter (I)">brother-in-law</a>, despite the fact they were not named guardian candidates of Harry in the events of James and Lily's death. Dumbledore had hoped that doing so would ensure an <a href="/wiki/Sacrificial_protection" title="Sacrificial protection">ancient form of magic</a> that Lily's wilful loving sacrifice for her son had created. However, Petunia and her <a href="/wiki/Vernon_Dursley" title="Vernon Dursley">own husband</a> both resented Harry's presence for the next ten years.
</p><p>After Harry had received his letter from <a href="/wiki/Rubeus_Hagrid" title="Rubeus Hagrid">Rubeus Hagrid</a>, Vernon had denounced Dumbledore as a "<i>crackpot old fool</i>" and refused to pay for Harry's school funds. In response to this irreverent outburst, Hagrid gave a pig's tail to Vernon's son, <a href="/wiki/Dudley_Dursley" title="Dudley Dursley">Dudley Dursley</a>. In the summer of <a href="/wiki/1995" title="1995">1995</a>, Vernon was about to throw Harry out of the <a href="/wiki/4_Privet_Drive" title="4 Privet Drive">house</a> when Petunia received a <a href="/wiki/Howler" title="Howler">Howler</a> from Dumbledore simply stating, "<i>Remember my last, Petunia</i>." Less than a year later, Harry and Dumbledore were talking about why the former had to stay at the Dursley house despite his miserable existence he endured there.
</p><p>A couple of months later, Dumbledore met with the Dursleys for the final time in his life. During his visit to their house, Dumbledore went over the protection that the Dursleys were affording Harry, Harry's inheritance of <a href="/wiki/Sirius_Black" title="Sirius Black">Sirius Black</a>'s possessions, and current updates in the <a href="/wiki/Wizarding_world" title="Wizarding world">wizarding world</a>. In addition, Dumbledore chastised the Dursleys for their indulgence of their son, Dudley. Vernon and Petunia were likely indignant at Dumbledore's remarks, although Petunia, at least in Harry's eyes, responded to Dumbledore's chastisement by looking rather flustered.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Sirius_Black">Sirius Black</span></h3>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">"<i><a href="/wiki/Sirius_Black" title="Sirius Black">Sirius</a> was a brave, clever, and energetic man, and such men are not usually content to sit at home in hiding while they believe others to be in danger.</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— Albus Dumbledore's opinion of Sirius<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>

<p>Dumbledore had also a good relationship with Sirius Black, <a href="/wiki/James_Potter_(I)" title="James Potter (I)">James Potter</a>'s best friend and <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a>'s godfather, as well as a member of the <a href="/wiki/Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Order of the Phoenix">Order of the Phoenix</a>, an organisation that Dumbledore led to oppose Voldemort and his followers. Like the rest of the wizarding world, Dumbledore initially believed that Sirius was the one who betrayed Lily and James to <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a> (and helped to condemn him in Azkaban with unproven statements and lack of evidence about his supposed betrayal), but, in 1994, he learned that it was actually <a href="/wiki/Peter_Pettigrew" title="Peter Pettigrew">Peter Pettigrew</a>. As he had no way to prove Sirius's innocence, despite being Chief Warlock and having the power to give him a trial, Dumbledore compensated by helping Hermione and Harry save Sirius from the <a href="/wiki/Dementor%27s_Kiss" title="Dementor's Kiss">Dementor's Kiss</a>, and to escape from his Ministry captors, by means of a <a href="/wiki/Time-Turner" title="Time-Turner">Time-Turner</a> and <a href="/wiki/Buckbeak" title="Buckbeak">Buckbeak</a>.
</p><p>The two resumed their friendship, and Sirius helped Dumbledore to recall the Order of the Phoenix an hour after Voldemort returned. However, their relationship was soon strained: Dumbledore forced Sirius to stay at <a href="/wiki/12_Grimmauld_Place" title="12 Grimmauld Place">12 Grimmauld Place</a> on account of his being a wanted convict, and because he had a tendency to act rashly, which could lead him to put himself in great danger. Though his intentions were noble, Sirius could not bring himself to appreciate Dumbledore's thoughtfulness, as he utterly despised the home which brought him many bitter, unhappy memories, and the fact that he was to be alone in the house most of the time made it all the more intolerable. Nevertheless, he still trusted Dumbledore enough to confide in him about how Harry felt Voldemort awaking inside him the night that <a href="/wiki/Arthur_Weasley" title="Arthur Weasley">Mr Weasley</a> was attacked. Dumbledore was devastated when Sirius died, believing that it was mostly his fault and comforted Harry to the best of his ability, and expressed his belief that Sirius was a lively man of wit and courage, with a deep and genuine concern for his <a href="/wiki/Love" title="Love">loved</a> ones, and would not hesitate to come to their rescue even if it meant putting himself in danger. Sirius's death was also a factor that led to Dumbledore confessing to Harry several things that had been kept secret from him, mainly about the true power of his mother's sacrificial protection, and <a href="/wiki/Sybill_Trelawney%27s_first_prophecy" class="mw-redirect" title="Sybill Trelawney's first prophecy">the prophecy</a> about him and Voldemort.
</p>

<p>Another good friend of Dumbledore was Remus Lupin, one of <a href="/wiki/James_Potter_(I)" title="James Potter (I)">James</a>'s and <a href="/wiki/Sirius_Black" title="Sirius Black">Sirius</a>'s dearest friends, and a <a href="/wiki/Werewolf" title="Werewolf">werewolf</a>. It was Dumbledore who, by several special precautions, ensured that Remus was able to come to Hogwarts to receive a proper magical education despite his werewolf status. He became a member of the <a href="/wiki/Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Order of the Phoenix">Order of the Phoenix</a> after his graduation. Later on, in <a href="/wiki/1993" title="1993">1993</a>, Dumbledore gave him the post of teaching <a href="/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts" title="Defence Against the Dark Arts">Defence Against the Dark Arts</a>, a decision some considered questionable. He even helped Remus control his werewolf-side by having Snape brew the <a href="/wiki/Wolfsbane_Potion" title="Wolfsbane Potion">Wolfsbane Potion</a> for him on a regular basis. On his part, Remus confessed that Dumbledore's trust and exceptional kindness towards him meant everything to him, given that the vast majority of the wizarding world shunned him because of the deep prejudice towards werewolves, and Remus felt guilty for betraying this kindness by allowing his three Marauder friends illegally become Animagi and roaming wild during their schooling years. Despite this, after learning of Sirius's innocence, Dumbledore forgave Remus for his supposed betrayal, understanding his Marauder friends only became Animagi to help Remus in his werewolf form and considered it an extraordinary achievement. He re-joined the Order of the Phoenix when Dumbledore reinstated it in <a href="/wiki/1995" title="1995">1995</a>, and they both fought in the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Department_of_Mysteries" title="Battle of the Department of Mysteries">Battle of the Department of Mysteries</a>, where Remus suffered a devastating loss: Sirius died in the hands of <a href="/wiki/Bellatrix_Lestrange" title="Bellatrix Lestrange">Bellatrix Lestrange</a>. Later on, upon overhearing a conversation about Harry's misgivings of Snape, he told Harry that to doubt Snape would be to doubt Dumbledore. In 1997, Remus was devastated by Dumbledore's <a href="/wiki/Death" title="Death">death</a> after the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Astronomy_Tower" title="Battle of the Astronomy Tower">Battle of the Astronomy Tower</a>, and later demonstrated his faith and loyalty to Dumbledore by fighting in the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Hogwarts" title="Battle of Hogwarts">Battle of Hogwarts</a>.
</p>

<p><a href="/wiki/Alastor_Moody" title="Alastor Moody">Alastor Moody</a> was a prominent <a href="/wiki/Auror" title="Auror">Auror</a> and Dumbledore's close friend. They fought together in many battles, and the intimacy of their friendship can be demonstrated by an instance where the usually formidable, no-nonsense Moody actually teased Dumbledore for his hatred of the <a href="/wiki/Dementor" title="Dementor">Dementors</a>. In <a href="/wiki/1994" title="1994">1994</a>, Moody accepted Dumbledore's offer to teach <a href="/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts" title="Defence Against the Dark Arts">Defence Against the Dark Arts</a>, but was captured and imprisoned by <a href="/wiki/Bartemius_Crouch_Junior" title="Bartemius Crouch Junior">Barty Crouch Jnr</a>, who impersonated him during the 1994-1995 school year, in order to send <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a> to <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a>. Dumbledore was close enough to Moody to realise at once that he was an impostor from one, slight lapse in the facade's performance and was enraged to discover the truth.
</p><p>Dumbledore and Moody fought along in the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Department_of_Mysteries" title="Battle of the Department of Mysteries">Battle of the Department of Mysteries</a>, where they suffered a devastating loss: <a href="/wiki/Sirius_Black" title="Sirius Black">Sirius</a>, one of their dear friends, was killed by <a href="/wiki/Bellatrix_Lestrange" title="Bellatrix Lestrange">Bellatrix Lestrange</a>. Moody turned out to be the next member of the Order to die after Dumbledore.
</p>

<p>Albus Dumbledore had a very strong bond with <a href="/wiki/Fawkes" title="Fawkes">Fawkes</a>, his pet <a href="/wiki/Phoenix" title="Phoenix">phoenix</a>, who served as a messenger and close companion. Dumbledore always looked after Fawkes when he was reborn after his countless deaths and in return Fawkes was extremely loyal to him. Fawkes was willing to take a Killing Curse in order to protect Dumbledore and did so in order to defend him from Lord Voldemort. He also helped Albus escape from several members of the Ministry of Magic when they tried to arrest him. When Dumbledore died Fawkes mourned him by singing a lament and then left Hogwarts and was apparently never seen again.
</p>

<p>The Order of the Phoenix was an organisation Dumbledore formed to oppose Voldemort and his forces. He had good relationships with most of the members, such as his brother <a href="/wiki/Aberforth_Dumbledore" title="Aberforth Dumbledore">Aberforth</a>, <a href="/wiki/Elphias_Doge" title="Elphias Doge">Elphias Doge</a>, <a href="/wiki/Minerva_McGonagall" title="Minerva McGonagall">Minerva McGonagall</a>, <a href="/wiki/Rubeus_Hagrid" title="Rubeus Hagrid">Rubeus Hagrid</a>, <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Severus Snape</a>, <a href="/wiki/James_and_Lily_Potter" class="mw-disambig" title="James and Lily Potter">James and Lily Potter</a>, <a href="/wiki/Sirius_Black" title="Sirius Black">Sirius Black</a>, <a href="/wiki/Remus_Lupin" title="Remus Lupin">Remus Lupin</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Alastor_Moody" title="Alastor Moody">Alastor Moody</a>.
</p>

<p>He was also friends with <a href="/wiki/Kingsley_Shacklebolt" title="Kingsley Shacklebolt">Kingsley Shacklebolt</a>, who believed in equality and fairness for all <a href="/wiki/Wizardkind" title="Wizardkind">wizards and witches</a> and <a href="/wiki/Non-magic_people" title="Non-magic people">Muggles</a>; <a href="/wiki/Arabella_Figg" title="Arabella Figg">Arabella Figg</a>, whom he trusted to watch Harry Potter during his years at the Dursleys' house (and heard about the abuse Harry suffered while doing nothing); <a href="/wiki/Nymphadora_Tonks" title="Nymphadora Tonks">Nymphadora Tonks</a>, an Auror; <a href="/wiki/Dedalus_Diggle" title="Dedalus Diggle">Dedalus Diggle</a>; <a href="/wiki/Hestia_Jones" title="Hestia Jones">Hestia Jones</a>; <a href="/wiki/Emmeline_Vance" title="Emmeline Vance">Emmeline Vance</a>; <a href="/wiki/Sturgis_Podmore" title="Sturgis Podmore">Sturgis Podmore</a>; <a href="/wiki/Mundungus_Fletcher" title="Mundungus Fletcher">Mundungus Fletcher</a>; and the <a href="/wiki/Weasley_family" title="Weasley family">Weasley family</a>. Emmeline Vance was killed by <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eaters</a> during the <a href="/wiki/Second_Wizarding_War" title="Second Wizarding War">Second Wizarding War</a>.
</p><p>Other possible Dumbledore's friends who were killed or seriously injured during the <a href="/wiki/First_Wizarding_War" title="First Wizarding War">First Wizarding War</a> were <a href="/wiki/Edgar_Bones" title="Edgar Bones">Edgar Bones</a>, <a href="/wiki/Caradoc_Dearborn" title="Caradoc Dearborn">Caradoc Dearborn</a>, <a href="/wiki/Benjy_Fenwick" title="Benjy Fenwick">Benjy Fenwick</a>, <a href="/wiki/Marlene_McKinnon" title="Marlene McKinnon">Marlene McKinnon</a>, <a href="/wiki/Dorcas_Meadowes" title="Dorcas Meadowes">Dorcas Meadowes</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Fabian_Prewett" title="Fabian Prewett">Fabian</a> and <a href="/wiki/Gideon_Prewett" title="Gideon Prewett">Gideon Prewett</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Alice_Longbottom" title="Alice Longbottom">Alice</a> and <a href="/wiki/Frank_Longbottom" title="Frank Longbottom">Frank Longbottom</a>, who were tortured into insanity by <a href="/wiki/Bellatrix_Lestrange" title="Bellatrix Lestrange">Bellatrix Lestrange</a> and <a href="/wiki/Bartemius_Crouch_Junior" title="Bartemius Crouch Junior">Barty Crouch Jnr</a>
</p><p>Dumbledore was also friend of many allies of the Order, including <a href="/wiki/Olympe_Maxime" title="Olympe Maxime">Olympe Maxime</a>, the headmistress of <a href="/wiki/Beauxbatons_Academy_of_Magic" title="Beauxbatons Academy of Magic">Beauxbatons Academy of Magic</a>, whom he met during the <a href="/wiki/Triwizard_Tournament" title="Triwizard Tournament">Triwizard Tournament</a>, his co-workers <a href="/wiki/Filius_Flitwick" title="Filius Flitwick">Filius Flitwick</a>, <a href="/wiki/Pomona_Sprout" title="Pomona Sprout">Pomona Sprout</a> and <a href="/wiki/Horace_Slughorn" title="Horace Slughorn">Horace Slughorn</a>, <a href="/wiki/Augusta_Longbottom" title="Augusta Longbottom">Augusta Longbottom</a>, <a href="/wiki/Edward_Tonks" title="Edward Tonks">Ted</a> and <a href="/wiki/Andromeda_Tonks" title="Andromeda Tonks">Andromeda Tonks</a>. Other allies of the Order were Dumbledore's students, <a href="/wiki/Ginevra_Weasley" title="Ginevra Weasley">Ginny Weasley</a>, <a href="/wiki/Neville_Longbottom" title="Neville Longbottom">Neville Longbottom</a>, <a href="/wiki/Luna_Lovegood" title="Luna Lovegood">Luna Lovegood</a>, <a href="/wiki/Lee_Jordan" title="Lee Jordan">Lee Jordan</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Percy_Weasley" title="Percy Weasley">Percy Weasley</a>. He also liked the <a href="/wiki/House-elf" title="House-elf">house-elf</a> <a href="/wiki/Dobby" title="Dobby">Dobby</a>, and pitied the house-elf <a href="/wiki/Kreacher" title="Kreacher">Kreacher</a>, asking them to work at Hogwarts kitchens.
</p><p>It is possible that all the members and allies of the Order who were neither killed nor imprisoned, fought in the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Hogwarts" title="Battle of Hogwarts">Battle of Hogwarts</a> (except Arabella Figg, who was a <a href="/wiki/Squib" title="Squib">Squib</a>, and couldn't fight. However, she might have helped in another way.)
</p>

<p>Except the already mentioned Minerva McGonagall, <a href="/wiki/Rubeus_Hagrid" title="Rubeus Hagrid">Rubeus Hagrid</a>, <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Severus Snape</a>, <a href="/wiki/Remus_Lupin" title="Remus Lupin">Remus Lupin</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Alastor_Moody" title="Alastor Moody">Alastor Moody</a>, Dumbledore had many co-workers during his career at Hogwarts. Some of his earliest co-workers were: <a href="/wiki/Armando_Dippet" title="Armando Dippet">Armando Dippet</a>, the previous Headmaster, Dumbledore being notably among the very few Dippet trusted apparently due to his teaching efficiency; <a href="/wiki/Herbert_Beery" title="Herbert Beery">Herbert Beery</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Herbology" title="Herbology">Herbology</a> Professor, who later resigned his teaching post at Hogwarts to go teaching at the <a href="/wiki/Wizarding_Academy_of_Dramatic_Arts" title="Wizarding Academy of Dramatic Arts">Wizarding Academy of Dramatic Arts</a>, who Dumbledore was apparently on good terms with as despite Herbert being such an enthusiast, he trusted Dumbledore enough to confide in him the personal fact that his first act made all his other performances ruined; <a href="/wiki/Galatea_Merrythought" title="Galatea Merrythought">Galatea Merrythought</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts" title="Defence Against the Dark Arts">Defence Against the Dark Arts</a> Professor, who retired before Dippet's death; <a href="/wiki/Silvanus_Kettleburn" title="Silvanus Kettleburn">Silvanus Kettleburn</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Care_of_Magical_Creatures" title="Care of Magical Creatures">Care of Magical Creatures</a> Professor; and <a href="/wiki/Horace_Slughorn" title="Horace Slughorn">Horace Slughorn</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Potions_(class)" title="Potions (class)">Potions master</a>, who was hired twice, and gave Harry Potter his memory, helping him and Dumbledore find and destroy Voldemort's Horcruxes.
</p><p>After Dippet's death, he became the new <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts</a> headmaster. He also had a friendship with <a href="/wiki/Filius_Flitwick" title="Filius Flitwick">Filius Flitwick</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Charms_(class)" title="Charms (class)">Charms</a> Professor and <a href="/wiki/Head_of_Ravenclaw_House" title="Head of Ravenclaw House">Head of Ravenclaw House</a>, <a href="/wiki/Pomona_Sprout" title="Pomona Sprout">Pomona Sprout</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Herbology" title="Herbology">Herbology</a> Professor and <a href="/wiki/Head_of_Hufflepuff_House" title="Head of Hufflepuff House">Head of Hufflepuff House</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Poppy_Pomfrey" title="Poppy Pomfrey">Poppy Pomfrey</a>, the nurse.
</p><p>Every Hogwarts staff member, with the exception of <a href="/wiki/Dolores_Umbridge" title="Dolores Umbridge">Dolores Umbridge</a>, both respected and held a high opinion of Dumbledore. Other staff were <a href="/wiki/Argus_Filch" title="Argus Filch">Argus Filch</a>, the caretaker; <a href="/wiki/Wilhelmina_Grubbly-Plank" title="Wilhelmina Grubbly-Plank">Wilhelmina Grubbly-Plank</a>, the Care of Magical Creatures Substitute Professor; <a href="/wiki/Firenze" title="Firenze">Firenze</a>, a <a href="/wiki/Centaur" title="Centaur">centaur</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Divination" title="Divination">Divination</a> Professor; <a href="/wiki/Rolanda_Hooch" title="Rolanda Hooch">Rolanda Hooch</a>, the Flying Instructor; Aurora Sinistra, the <a href="/wiki/Astronomy" title="Astronomy">Astronomy</a> Professor; <a href="/wiki/Bathsheda_Babbling" title="Bathsheda Babbling">Bathsheda Babbling</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Study_of_Ancient_Runes" title="Study of Ancient Runes">Study of Ancient Runes</a> Professor; <a href="/wiki/Septima_Vector" title="Septima Vector">Septima Vector</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Arithmancy" title="Arithmancy">Arithmancy</a> Professor; <a href="/wiki/Irma_Pince" title="Irma Pince">Irma Pince</a>, the librarian; <a href="/wiki/Cuthbert_Binns" title="Cuthbert Binns">Cuthbert Binns</a>, a <a href="/wiki/Ghost" title="Ghost">ghost</a> and the <a href="/wiki/History_of_Magic" title="History of Magic">History of Magic</a> Professor; <a href="/wiki/Charity_Burbage" title="Charity Burbage">Charity Burbage</a> the <a href="/wiki/Muggle_Studies" title="Muggle Studies">Muggle Studies</a> Professor. 
</p><p>Dumbledore also knew <a href="/wiki/Gilderoy_Lockhart" title="Gilderoy Lockhart">Gilderoy Lockhart</a>, the Defence Against the Dark Arts Professor (<a href="/wiki/1992%E2%80%931993_school_year" title="1992–1993 school year">1992-1993</a>), when he was still a student. It's unknown how Dumbledore viewed him, but he apparently found Lockhart's antics to be amusing instead of irritating unlike many of the other professors, as he kindly denied Lockhart's proposal of starting a school newspaper rather than punishing him as many, if not all, of the other staff members have been known to do out of dislike of Lockhart's vanity seeking. Due to his optimistic personality and tendency to see the good in people in order to try to give them another chance, it can be assumed that he may have once thought that Lockhart can overcome his love for vanity and become a great wizard due to his talents. However, when Lockhart erased the memories of two wizards that Dumbledore knew, Dumbledore, having never been fooled by Lockhart's tall tales, easily found out the truth and immediately decided to appoint him as a Hogwarts professor to expose Lockhart's fraudulence, and because Lockhart at the time was the only person willing to apply for the cursed Defence against the Dark Arts post. While he apparently disliked Lockhart's deeds, he nevertheless did not seem to truly hate Lockhart, as he was cordial and polite to him whenever they interacted and after the Memory Charm completely wiped out Lockhart's memories, Dumbledore was compassionate enough that he decided to leave Lockhart in peace and did not expose his crimes, likely as he pitied Lockhart and saw that having completely lost all of his popularity and with the remnants of his magical brilliance now lost to him and his cunning now harmless, to condemn him to being eternally despised by the wizarding community would be unnecessarily cruel, not to say that if he did reveal what Lockhart had did, he would likely be either sentenced to Azkaban or heavily secured in St Mungo, both fates that he seemingly deemed too cruel of a punishment for what Lockhart did.
</p><p>Another Professor was <a href="/wiki/Sybill_Trelawney" title="Sybill Trelawney">Sybill Trelawney</a>, who taught Divination. Dumbledore planned on discontinuing Divination but went to her job interview out of politeness, by the end of the interview however, he has summed her up as a fraud. When he heard her conceiving <a href="/wiki/Sybill_Trelawney%27s_first_prophecy" class="mw-redirect" title="Sybill Trelawney's first prophecy">Sybill Trelawney's first prophecy</a>, he hired Trelawney to protect her from the <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eaters</a>. In 1995, when <a href="/wiki/Dolores_Umbridge" title="Dolores Umbridge">Dolores Umbridge</a> sacked Trelawney and tried to banish her from Hogwarts, it was Dumbledore who stepped in and told Umbridge he wished that Trelawney would remain at Hogwarts.
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Quirinus_Quirrell" title="Quirinus Quirrell">Quirinus Quirrell</a> was the Muggle Studies Professor, before he started to teach Defence Against the Dark Arts. It was unknown of Dumbledore's feelings towards him at the time, but he likely saw Quirrell as being a gifted wizard from his academical performances during his time as a student, considering that he had been the Headmaster by the time Quirrell came to Hogwarts and appointed him in first Muggle Studies before having him teach Defence Against the Dark Arts. It was unknown how he felt about Quirrell's frailty or if he knew of Quirrell's bitterness over his bullying, making him desire to be noticed, but it was likely that although he was concerned about it, ever the optimist, he had hoped that Quirrell could overcome this with time. However, when Quirrell met Voldemort when he travelled around the world, and shared his body with him and since then, he served him faithfully, trying to steal the <a href="/wiki/Philosopher%27s_Stone" title="Philosopher's Stone">Philosopher's Stone</a> and kill Harry Potter, Dumbledore quickly saw through Quirrell and after he was killed by Harry Potter in 1992, being burned by Harry's touching, Dumbledore openly noted that Quirrell's fate was well-deserved, noting on how Quirrell's hunger for power, hatred and ambitions made him allow Voldemort to possess him and incapable of understanding love, fell victim to it, showing his disgust at his former professor.
</p><p>In 1995, <a href="/wiki/Dolores_Umbridge" title="Dolores Umbridge">Dolores Umbridge</a> was appointed the Defence Against the Dark Arts Professor by the <a href="/wiki/British_Ministry_of_Magic" title="British Ministry of Magic">Ministry of Magic</a>. She was a sadistic woman who enjoyed punishing students and appointed solely to undermine, subvert and eventually usurp Dumbledore's position and authority as Headmaster in accordance with the desired political status quo. Though Dumbledore was perfectly aware of this, he nevertheless treated Umbridge with his usual unfailing politeness even in the face of outright rudeness and disrespect (such as when she interrupted his customary Start-of-Term announcement to make her own speech) and even took it upon himself to rescue her from the horde of centaurs she'd stupidly insulted and provoked. The only time he showed outright anger with her was when she roughly manhandled <a href="/wiki/Marietta_Edgecombe" title="Marietta Edgecombe">Marietta Edgecombe</a> right in front of him, prompting him to draw his wand on and threaten her if she did it again.
</p><p>Every member of the Hogwarts staff was devastated by Dumbledore's <a href="/wiki/Death" title="Death">death</a>, and it is more than likely that every member fought in the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Hogwarts" title="Battle of Hogwarts">Battle of Hogwarts</a>.
</p>

Though Dumbledore was aware of the organisation's formation from the start, he was not aware of its name and seemed quite overwhelmed when he first discovered it, apparently very touched by the open show of devotion and trust in him. He also lied directly to the Ministry by claiming credit for the organisation's creation as an attempt to subvert the Ministry and taking full blame for its illicit activities, which spared all of its members from expulsion and allowed them to remain at Hogwarts.

Brown">Lavender Brown</a>, <a href="/wiki/Hannah_Abbott" title="Hannah Abbott">Hannah Abbott</a>, <a href="/wiki/Ernest_Macmillan" title="Ernest Macmillan">Ernie Macmillan</a>, <a href="/wiki/Susan_Bones" title="Susan Bones">Susan Bones</a>, <a href="/wiki/Justin_Finch-Fletchley" title="Justin Finch-Fletchley">Justin Finch-Fletchley</a>, <a href="/wiki/Michael_Corner" title="Michael Corner">Michael Corner</a>, <a href="/wiki/Terry_Boot" title="Terry Boot">Terry Boot</a>, <a href="/wiki/Anthony_Goldstein" title="Anthony Goldstein">Anthony Goldstein</a>, <a href="/wiki/Katie_Bell" title="Katie Bell">Katie Bell</a>, <a href="/wiki/Alicia_Spinnet" title="Alicia Spinnet">Alicia Spinnet</a>, <a href="/wiki/Angelina_Johnson" title="Angelina Johnson">Angelina Johnson</a>, <a href="/wiki/Colin_and_Dennis_Creevey" class="mw-disambig" title="Colin and Dennis Creevey">Colin and Dennis Creevey</a>, <a href="/wiki/Zacharias_Smith" title="Zacharias Smith">Zacharias Smith</a> and <a href="/wiki/Marietta_Edgecombe" title="Marietta Edgecombe">Marietta Edgecombe</a>.
</p><p>All of the members of Dumbledore's Army were devastated by Dumbledore's death, and it is possible that all of them fought in the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Hogwarts" title="Battle of Hogwarts">Battle of Hogwarts</a>. Three of the members were killed: <a href="/wiki/Fred_Weasley" title="Fred Weasley">Fred Weasley</a>, <a href="/wiki/Lavender_Brown" title="Lavender Brown">Lavender Brown</a> and <a href="/wiki/Colin_Creevey" title="Colin Creevey">Colin Creevey</a>. The two defectors, <a href="/wiki/Marietta_Edgecombe" title="Marietta Edgecombe">Marietta Edgecombe</a> and <a href="/wiki/Zacharias_Smith" title="Zacharias Smith">Zacharias Smith</a>, are the ones who did not believe in Dumbledore from the beginning and did not participate in the final battle.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Other_friendships">Other friendships</span></h3>
<p>During his life, Dumbledore became friend of many famous wizards and witches, such as <a href="/wiki/Nicolas_Flamel" title="Nicolas Flamel">Nicolas Flamel</a> and his wife, <a href="/wiki/Perenelle_Flamel" title="Perenelle Flamel">Perenelle</a>, <a href="/wiki/Bathilda_Bagshot" title="Bathilda Bagshot">Bathilda Bagshot</a> and <a href="/wiki/Griselda_Marchbanks" title="Griselda Marchbanks">Griselda Marchbanks</a>. Nicolas Flamel and Perenelle were over 650 years of age, when they agreed to destroy the Philosopher's Stone to thwart <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a>'s return. Bathilda Bagshot died a few months after Dumbledore, being killed by Voldemort.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Death_Eaters">Death Eaters</span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Bellatrix_Lestrange">Bellatrix Lestrange</span></h4>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">"<i>...or dear Bellatrix, who likes to play with her food before she eats it...</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— Dumbledore regarding Bellatrix Lestrange's sadistic personality<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/77/Bellatrix_Lestrange_Profile_PM.png/revision/latest?cb=20161126040430" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Bellatrix Lestrange Profile PM" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="230" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Bellatrix Lestrange Profile PM.png" data-image-key="Bellatrix_Lestrange_Profile_PM.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/77/Bellatrix_Lestrange_Profile_PM.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20161126040430" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/77/Bellatrix_Lestrange_Profile_PM.png/revision/latest?cb=20161126040430" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Bellatrix Lestrange Profile PM" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/77/Bellatrix_Lestrange_Profile_PM.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20161126040430" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="230" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Bellatrix Lestrange Profile PM.png" data-image-key="Bellatrix_Lestrange_Profile_PM.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/77/Bellatrix_Lestrange_Profile_PM.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20161126040430" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Bellatrix_Lestrange_Profile_PM.png" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption"><a href="/wiki/Bellatrix_Lestrange" title="Bellatrix Lestrange">Bellatrix Lestrange</a>, his former student</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Bellatrix Lestrange was a <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eater</a> who fought in both Wizarding Wars. She was fanatically loyal to Lord Voldemort who was her only true love and so, although reluctantly acknowledging Dumbledore as a very powerful wizard, considered her master as the superior wizard, though she did fear Dumbledore and opted to flee rather than fight him. Bellatrix was among the few people who knew of the <a href="/wiki/Plot_to_assassinate_Albus_Dumbledore" title="Plot to assassinate Albus Dumbledore">plan to assassinate Dumbledore</a>, and that <a href="/wiki/Draco_Malfoy" title="Draco Malfoy">Draco Malfoy</a> had been assigned the task of murdering him. Bellatrix did not live to discover that her initial suspicions of Snape's loyalty had been correct, dying during a ferocious duel with <a href="/wiki/Molly_Weasley" title="Molly Weasley">Molly Weasley</a>. Dumbledore recognised Bellatrix as an incredibly dangerous and sadistic <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eater</a>, commenting to <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Severus Snape</a> that, given the choice, he would prefer to die a quick and clean death rather than fall prey to Bellatrix who tended to "play with her food". Bellatrix also killed many of Dumbledore's friends, such as <a href="/wiki/Sirius_Black" title="Sirius Black">Sirius Black</a>, <a href="/wiki/Dobby" title="Dobby">Dobby</a> the <a href="/wiki/House-elf" title="House-elf">house-elf</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Nymphadora_Tonks" title="Nymphadora Tonks">Nymphadora Tonks</a>.
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Lucius_Malfoy">Lucius Malfoy</span></h4>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets">"<i>On the other hand, I would advise you, Lucius, not to go giving out any more of Lord Voldemort's old school things. If any more of them find their way into innocent hands, I think Arthur Weasley, for one, will make sure they are traced back to you...</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— Albus Dumbledore dismissing Lucius Malfoy<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Chamber_of_Secrets" title="Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/5/54/Lucius_Malfoy_Profile.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20190115061220" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Lucius Malfoy Profile" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="266" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Lucius Malfoy Profile.jpg" data-image-key="Lucius_Malfoy_Profile.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/5/54/Lucius_Malfoy_Profile.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20190115061220" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/5/54/Lucius_Malfoy_Profile.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20190115061220" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Lucius Malfoy Profile" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/5/54/Lucius_Malfoy_Profile.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20190115061220" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="266" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Lucius Malfoy Profile.jpg" data-image-key="Lucius_Malfoy_Profile.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/5/54/Lucius_Malfoy_Profile.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20190115061220" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Lucius_Malfoy_Profile.jpg" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption"><a href="/wiki/Lucius_Malfoy" title="Lucius Malfoy">Lucius Malfoy</a>, his former student and enemy</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p><a href="/wiki/Lucius_Malfoy" title="Lucius Malfoy">Lucius Malfoy</a> was a prefect during Dumbledore's early years as Hogwarts Headmaster, and was among the Death Eaters who avoided Azkaban after <a href="/wiki/First_Wizarding_War" title="First Wizarding War">First Wizarding War</a>. In 1991, Lucius's son, <a href="/wiki/Draco_Malfoy" title="Draco Malfoy">Draco</a>, started attending Hogwarts. The Malfoys had disdain for Dumbledore due to his acceptance of Muggle-borns and belief in Muggle rights. In 1992, Lucius manipulated <a href="/wiki/Ginevra_Weasley" title="Ginevra Weasley">Ginny Weasley</a> into reopening the <a href="/wiki/Chamber_of_Secrets" title="Chamber of Secrets">Chamber of Secrets</a> by giving her <a href="/wiki/T._M._Riddle%27s_Diary" title="T. M. Riddle's Diary">Tom Riddle's Diary</a> in order to stigmatise her father <a href="/wiki/Arthur_Weasley" title="Arthur Weasley">Arthur</a> and kick Dumbledore out of <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts</a>. This failed because Dumbledore was able to guess the truth, when Harry Potter saved Ginny from the <a href="/wiki/Serpent_of_Slytherin" title="Serpent of Slytherin">Serpent of Slytherin</a>. Dumbledore thus let Harry decide Lucius's punishment, which was giving the Malfoy <a href="/wiki/House-elf" title="House-elf">house-elf</a> <a href="/wiki/Dobby" title="Dobby">Dobby</a> his freedom as a reward and let Lucius himself get stripped from his position on the <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_Board_of_Governors" title="Hogwarts Board of Governors">Hogwarts Board of Governors</a>. 
</p><p>In 1996, Dumbledore and Lucius fought in the Battle of the Department of Mysteries. Lucius was stunned and imprisoned in Azkaban, failing to give Voldemort the Prophecy about the Chosen One, so Voldemort became angry and made Draco a Death Eater and ordered him to kill Dumbledore, otherwise he would kill his family. During a discussion about Horcruxes, Dumbledore expressed to Harry a certain sympathy to Lucius, as he believed that Lucius was secretly glad to be imprisoned for accidentally getting rid of his master's Horcrux diary and the debacle of the prophecy retrieval. Draco attempted to kill Dumbledore, on Voldemort's orders, telling him that the Dark Lord would kill him, if he didn't do so. Dumbledore showed kindness and sympathy to Draco's plight, sensing he wasn't capable of murder and suggested him to abandon Voldemort, and that he and his <a href="/wiki/Narcissa_Malfoy" title="Narcissa Malfoy">mother</a> would be hidden by the Order of the Phoenix. Draco would most likely have accepted but was interrupted by Death Eaters. A year later, the Malfoy family changed sides.
</p><p>At some point during his tenure as Headmaster, Lucius Malfoy tried to assure Dumbledore would be removed from the post of Headmaster of Hogwarts after he had ensured the inclusion of pro-Muggle tales (such as <i><a href="/wiki/The_Fountain_of_Fair_Fortune" title="The Fountain of Fair Fortune">The Fountain of Fair Fortune</a></i>) in <i><a href="/wiki/The_Tales_of_Beedle_the_Bard" title="The Tales of Beedle the Bard">The Tales of Beedle the Bard</a></i>, which was stocked at the school. Dumbledore, in turn, commented that he worked hard to make Malfoy "Voldemort's least favourite Death Eater".<sup id="cite_ref-TBBF_126-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-TBBF-126"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>126<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>

<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban">"<i>You saved his life, <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry</a>... <a href="/wiki/Peter_Pettigrew" title="Peter Pettigrew">he</a> owes you a life-debt...</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— Albus Dumbledore regarding Pettigrew<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban" title="Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban">[src]</a></sup></dd>

<p><a href="/wiki/Peter_Pettigrew" title="Peter Pettigrew">Peter Pettigrew</a> was a member of the <a href="/wiki/Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Order of the Phoenix">Order of the Phoenix</a> and another close friend of James Potter. It is possible that he was a friend of Dumbledore. However, in 1981, Pettigrew betrayed <a href="/wiki/James_and_Lily_Potter" class="mw-disambig" title="James and Lily Potter">James and Lily</a> to <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Voldemort</a> in his role as their family <a href="/wiki/Secret_Keeper" title="Secret Keeper">Secret-Keeper</a> and faked his own death by cutting off his finger in a crowded London street which he blew up with the <a href="/wiki/Blasting_Curse" title="Blasting Curse">Blasting Curse</a> in order to frame <a href="/wiki/Sirius_Black" title="Sirius Black">Sirius Black</a>. Like the rest of the wizarding world, Dumbledore initially believed that it was Sirius who was behind the Potters' betrayal, and that Pettigrew died confronting him about their deaths. He learned the truth in <a href="/wiki/1994" title="1994">1994</a>, when Harry Potter saved Pettigrew's life from Sirius's and Remus Lupin's attempt to extinguish it for his crime. After Harry saved Sirius from the <a href="/wiki/Dementor" title="Dementor">Dementors</a>, Dumbledore congratulated him by saying that as long as Pettigrew was a Death Eater in a <a href="/wiki/Life_debt" title="Life debt">life-debt</a> with the last Potter, he would requite. Dumbledore's observation was proven true: Pettigrew attempted to strangle Harry during the <a href="/wiki/Skirmish_at_Malfoy_Manor" title="Skirmish at Malfoy Manor">Skirmish at Malfoy Manor</a>, but he hesitated when Harry reminded him of the debt, causing the <a href="/wiki/Peter_Pettigrew%27s_silver_hand" title="Peter Pettigrew's silver hand">silver hand</a> that was given to him by Voldemort to strangle and kill him.
</p>

<dd>— Karkaroff and Dumbledore greeting each other upon the arrival of Durmstrang delegation to Hogwarts<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire" title="Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire">[src]</a></sup></dd></dl>
</div>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/1b/Igor_Karkaroff_GoF.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100724115703" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Igor Karkaroff GoF" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="273" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Igor Karkaroff GoF.jpg" data-image-key="Igor_Karkaroff_GoF.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/1b/Igor_Karkaroff_GoF.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100724115703" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/1b/Igor_Karkaroff_GoF.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100724115703" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Igor Karkaroff GoF" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/1b/Igor_Karkaroff_GoF.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100724115703" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="273" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Igor Karkaroff GoF.jpg" data-image-key="Igor_Karkaroff_GoF.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/1b/Igor_Karkaroff_GoF.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100724115703" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Igor_Karkaroff_GoF.jpg" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Igor Karkaroff</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p><a href="/wiki/Igor_Karkaroff" title="Igor Karkaroff">Igor Karkaroff</a> was a Death Eater in the First Wizarding War. Dumbledore participated in his trial and saw him betraying many Death Eaters to avoid imprisonment in Azkaban. After his release, he abandoned Voldemort and became the Headmaster of <a href="/wiki/Durmstrang_Institute" title="Durmstrang Institute">Durmstrang Institute</a>. He met Dumbledore in 1994, when he visited Hogwarts during the <a href="/wiki/Triwizard_Tournament" title="Triwizard Tournament">Triwizard Tournament</a>. At first, the two headmasters greeted each other as old friends, seemingly showing no animosity. However, Karkaroff would later denounce Dumbledore as a fraud who put Harry Potter's name in the <a href="/wiki/Goblet_of_Fire" title="Goblet of Fire">Goblet of Fire</a> and was even more angry to learn about <a href="/wiki/Bartemius_Crouch_Senior" title="Bartemius Crouch Senior">Barty Crouch Snr</a>'s attack on Durmstrang champion <a href="/wiki/Viktor_Krum" title="Viktor Krum">Viktor Krum</a>, suggesting that the <a href="/wiki/British_Ministry_of_Magic" title="British Ministry of Magic">British Ministry of Magic</a> was tainted with corruption. He left Hogwarts after Voldemort's rebirth, and was killed by Death Eaters in either 1995 or 1996. Despite public appearances, Dumbledore thought Karkaroff was a coward.
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Barty_Crouch_Junior">Barty Crouch Junior</span></h4>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire"><b>Albus Dumbledore</b>: "<i>Can you hear me?</i>"</span></dd>
<dd><b>Barty Crouch Junior</b>: "<i>Yes.</i>"</dd>
<dd><b>Albus Dumbledore</b>: "<i>I would like you to tell us how you came to be here. How did you escape from Azkaban?</i>"</dd>
<dd>— Dumbledore interrogating Barty Crouch Junior after having exposed him<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire" title="Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire">[src]</a></sup></dd></dl>
</div>

<p>Another very loyal Death Eater was <a href="/wiki/Bartemius_Crouch_Junior" title="Bartemius Crouch Junior">Barty Crouch Jnr</a>, who was imprisoned in Azkaban by his <a href="/wiki/Bartemius_Crouch_Senior" title="Bartemius Crouch Senior">father</a>, but escaped with the help of his <a href="/wiki/Bartemius_Crouch_Junior%27s_mother" title="Bartemius Crouch Junior's mother">mother</a>. Crouch played a key-role in Voldemort's rebirth, after he captured and imprisoned <a href="/wiki/Alastor_Moody" title="Alastor Moody">Alastor Moody</a>, and took his form, to teach at Hogwarts, while Dumbledore thought he was dead. Crouch put Harry's name in the Goblet of Fire and helped him with the tasks of the Triwizard Tournament, sending him to Voldemort. When Harry escaped, Crouch attempted to kill him, but was stopped by Dumbledore. Barty Crouch was given the <a href="/wiki/Dementor" title="Dementor">Dementor</a>'s <a href="/wiki/Dementor%27s_Kiss" title="Dementor's Kiss">Kiss</a> in 1995. Dumbledore showed cold fury and disgust at Crouch Jnr's actions but was still disappointed and revolted when Cornelius Fudge sentenced him to Dementor's Kiss as it both meant that Voldemort's return could no longer be testified and that the Crouch family blood line had permanently ended. This showed that despite his disgust of Crouch Jnr's actions, he still had some pity for what Crouch Jnr had become.
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Fenrir_Greyback">Fenrir Greyback</span></h4>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince"><b>Albus Dumbledore</b>: "<i>Am I to take it that you are attacking even without the full moon now? This is most unusual... you have developed a taste for human flesh that cannot be satisfied once a month?</i>"</span></dd>
<dd><b>Fenrir Greyback</b>: "<i>That's right. Shocks you, that, does it, Dumbledore? Frightens you?</i>"</dd>
<dd><b>Albus Dumbledore</b>: "<i>Well, I cannot pretend it does not disgust me a little. And, yes, I am a little shocked that Draco here invited you, of all people, into the school where his friends live...</i>"</dd>
<dd>— Dumbledore expressing his disgust for Fenrir Greyback<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">[src]</a></sup></dd></dl>
</div>

<p><a href="/wiki/Fenrir_Greyback" title="Fenrir Greyback">Fenrir Greyback</a> was a savage <a href="/wiki/Werewolf" title="Werewolf">werewolf</a> who seemed to have had dealings with Dumbledore in the past, as Dumbledore was shocked that he, of all people, had come to Hogwarts the night that the Death Eaters entered the <a href="/wiki/Astronomy_Tower" title="Astronomy Tower">Astronomy Tower</a>. He was also disgusted that Greyback had started to attack outside the full moon and enjoyed the taste of human flesh. Greyback offered to 'do Dumbledore for afters', indicating that he would, possibly, maul him to death after attacking children within the castle. In fact, Dumbledore seemed somewhat disappointed when he incorrectly believed that Draco would invite Greyback into the castle.
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Other_Death_Eaters">Other Death Eaters</span></h4>
<p>It is likely that Dumbledore knew and fought other Death Eaters during the Wars and attended their trials if caught. It is certain that the Death Eaters both hated and yet feared Dumbledore.
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Etymology">Etymology</span></h2>
<p>Dumbledore's given names could be interpreted as representing the four primary divisions of the British Isles:
</p>
<ul><li><i>Albus</i> is a Latin word for "white", and also a Roman cognomen. According to Rowling herself, the first names of Albus Dumbledore and <a href="/wiki/Rubeus_Hagrid" title="Rubeus Hagrid">Rubeus Hagrid</a> were chosen based on "the white" and "the red", which were considered essential mystical components of <a href="/wiki/Alchemy" title="Alchemy">alchemy</a>. Dumbledore was given the white for asceticism, "a spiritual theoretician, brilliant, idealised, and somewhat detached".<sup id="cite_ref-pottermorecolours_127-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-pottermorecolours-127"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>127<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><i>Percival</i> is a legendary Arthurian knight from Wales involved in the Grail quest. In <i>Le morte d'Arthur</i> by Thomas Mallory, Percival is both hero of the quest for the Grail and narrator of the tale, as is the case for Dumbledore in parts of the story. It is a name which presumably comes from his <a href="/wiki/Percival_Dumbledore" title="Percival Dumbledore">father</a>.</li>
<li><i>Wulfric</i> is an Anglo-Saxon name found in the <i>Anglo-Saxon Chronicle</i> and could be representative of England. Wulfric translates literally as "wolf-power", and is reminiscent of another similar name, Beowulf, which means "powerful wolf-bear". The legendary hero Beowulf slew the monster Grendel as a youth, a name similar to <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Gellert Grindelwald</a>, the Dark wizard Dumbledore defeated in his own youth. Beowulf was fatally wounded by a dragon in a sea cave, and the only one who would help him was his squire, an orphaned son of some loyal followers. Dumbledore was also severely wounded by the <a href="/wiki/Emerald_Potion" title="Emerald Potion">potion</a> in <a href="/wiki/The_Cave" title="The Cave">The Cave</a> and the orphaned follower is obviously Harry.</li>
<li><i>Brian</i> is the name of the legendary Irish high-king and hero Brian Boru who defeated the Vikings at the Battle of Clontarf near Dublin. Dumbledore himself was a veteran of many wizarding battles against Dark wizards. However, this name was probably chosen because of its comic mundanity compared to his other four names.</li>
<li><i>Dumbledore</i> is an old 18th century English word for 'bumblebee'. It is still used in Newfoundland, Canada, to refer to a bumblebee. Rowling stated she imagined him flitting about the castle humming to himself.</li>
<li>The initials of JK Rowling's old school headmaster, Alfred Dunn, may have inspired the name "Albus Dumbledore".</li></ul>
